inline bots so that the app can suggest the bots you are most likely to use in the attachment menu (or when you start a new message with \u201c@\u201d).\nTo turn this feature off and delete the relevant data, go to Settings &gt.\nPrivacy &amp.\nSecurity &gt.\nData Settings and disable \u201cSuggest Frequent Contacts\u201d.</p>\n<i>\n</i>5.6.\nNo Ads\n<p>Unlike other services, we don't use your data for ad targeting or other commercial purposes.\nTelegram only stores the information it needs to function as a secure and feature-rich cloud service.\n</p>\n<i>\n</i>6.\nBot Messages\n<i>\n</i>6.1.\nEcosystem\n<p>Telegram has an API that allows third-party developers to create bots.\nBots are apps that look like special Telegram users: you can talk to them from your chat list, add them to groups or use a special \u201cinline\u201d interface to access their features.\nBy performing any of these actions, you will be sending some of your data to the respective third-party bot developers.</p>\n<i>\n</i>6.2.\nHow Bots Can Receive Data\n<p>You can send data to bot developers when you interact with their bots in one of these ways:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>By sending messages to a bot.</li>\n<li>By using an inline bot.</li>\n<li>By participating in a group with a bot.</li>\n<li>By pressing buttons in messages sent by a bot.</li>\n<li>By paying for goods and services via bots (see section 7 below).</li>\n</ul>\n<i>\n</i>6.3.\nWhat Data Bots Receive\n<p>In any of the above cases, the developers of an automated user (bot) can get your public account data (see section 3.1 above): your screen name, username and profile picture(s).</p>\n<p>Bots can also receive the following data when you <strong>interact</strong> with them.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Bots will obviously get your messages when you send them something.</li>\n<li>If you click on links or buttons provided by the bot, the bot can potentially get your IP address (provided that it controls the website to which the link leads).\n</li>\n<li>If the bot is a member of the same group with you, it may know you are a member.</li>\n<li>When you start your message with the username of an inline bot (e.g.\n@gif) the interface transforms so that everything you type becomes a query to that bot.\nThis query is sent to the bot so that it can provide its service.\nWe will warn you about this the first time you use an inline bot.</li>\n<li>Bots added to groups can operate in two modes: with access to messages in the group or without access.\nIf the bot has access to messages, it can see everything that happens in the group.\nThe interface clearly shows whether or not a bot has access to messages in groups.</li>\n</ul>\n<i>\n</i>6.4.\nBots Are Not Maintained by Telegram\n<p>Other than our own bots, no other bots or third-party bot developers are affiliated with Telegram.\nThey are completely independent from us.\nThey should ask you for your permission before they access your data or you make it available to them.</p>\n<i>\n</i>7.\nThird Party Payment Services\n<i>\n</i>7.1.\nPayment Information\n<p>The Payment Platform for Bots is available to users as of Telegram 4.0.\nTelegram does not process payments from users and instead relies on different payment providers around the world.\nIt is the payment providers that handle and store your credit card details.\nNeither Telegram nor the merchants on the platform (bot developers) have access to this information.\nAlthough we work with payment providers they are completely independent from Telegram.\nPlease study their relevant privacy policies before making your data available to them.\n</p>\n<i>\n</i>7.2.\nCredit Card Information\n<p>When making a purchase, you enter your credit card details into a form supplied by the payment provider that will be processing the payment, and this information goes directly to the payment provider's server.\nYour credit card information never reaches Telegram's servers.\nWe do not access and do not store your credit card information.\nWhen you save your credit card info, it is saved on the respective payment provider's servers and the payment provider gives Telegram a <em>token</em> that you can reuse for future payments.\nIt is not possible to reconstruct your credit card info from the token.</p>\n<i>\n</i>7.3 Shipping Information\n<p>When you enter shipping information in the process of placing an order, we send it directly to the merchant bot developer.\nWe can store your shipping information for you if you choose to save it for future purchases.\nWe will delete this information immediately if you ask us to.</p>\n<i>\n</i>7.4.\nClearing Payment Information\n<p>You can clear all payment information associated with your account at any time by going to Telegram Settings &gt.\nPrivacy &amp.\nSecurity &gt.\nData Settings and selecting \u2018Clear Payment &amp.\nShipping Info\u2019.\nIf you choose to remove your payment information, we will delete your stored shipping info and payment tokens from all providers and ask the payment providers to remove your credit card information that they store.</p>\n<i>\n</i>7.5.\nPayment Disputes\n<p>Due to the fact that Telegram doesn't store any credit card details or transaction information, it is impossible for us to handle complaints or cashbacks \u2013 any disputed payments are the responsibility of the bot developers, payment providers, and banks that participated in the exchange.</p>\n<i>\n</i>8.\nWho Your Personal Data May Be Shared With\n<i>\n</i>8.1.\nOther Telegram Users\n<p>Other users of our Services with whom you choose to communicate with and share certain information, who may be located outside the EEA.\nNote that by entering into the Terms of Service and choosing to communicate with such other users of Telegram, you are instructing us to transfer your personal data, on your behalf, to those users in accordance with this Privacy Policy.\nWe employ all appropriate technical and organizational measures (including encryption of your personal data) to ensure a level of security for your personal data that is appropriate to the risk.\n</p>\n<i>\n</i>8.2.\nTelegram\u2019s Group Companies\n<p>We may share your personal data with: <em>(1)</em> our parent company, Telegram Group Inc, located in the British Virgin Islands.\nand <em>(2)</em> Telegram FZ-LLC, a group member located in Dubai, to help provide, improve and support our Services.\nWe will implement appropriate safeguards to protect the security and integrity of that personal data.\nThis will take the form of standard contract clauses approved by the European Commission in an agreement between us and our relevant group companies.\nIf you would like more information regarding these clauses, please contact us using the details in section 12 below.</p>\n<i>\n</i>8.3.\nLaw Enforcement Authorities\n<p>If Telegram receives a court order that confirms you're a terror suspect, we may disclose your IP address and phone number to the relevant authorities.\nSo far, this has never happened.\nWhen it does, we will include it in a semiannual transparency report published at: https://t.me/transparency.</p>\n<i>\n</i>9.\nYour Rights Regarding the Personal Data You Provide to Us\n<i>\n</i>9.1.\nYour Rights\n<p>Under applicable data protection legislation, in certain circumstances, you have rights concerning your personal data.\nYou have a right to: <em>(1)</em> request a copy of all your personal data that we store and to transmit that copy to another data controller.\n<em>(2)</em> delete (see section 10 below) or amend your personal data.\n<em>(3)</em> restrict, or object to, the processing of your personal data.\n<em>(4)</em> correct any inaccurate or incomplete personal data we hold on you.\nand <em>(5)</em> lodge a complaint with national data protection authorities regarding our processing of your personal data.</p>\n<i>\n</i>9.2.\nExercising Your Rights\n<p>If you wish to exercise any of these rights, kindly contact us using the details in section 12 below.</p>\n<i>\n</i>9.3.\nData Settings\n<p>You can control how your data is used (e.g., delete synced contacts) in <em>Settings &gt.\nPrivacy &amp.\nSecurity &gt.\nData Settings</em> (using one of our mobile apps).\n</p>\n<p>Sadly, if you're generally not OK with Telegram's modest requirements, it won't be possible for us to provide you with our Services.\nYou can delete your Telegram account by proceeding to the deactivation page.</p>\n<i>\n</i>10.\nDeleting data\n<i>\n</i>10.1.\nAccounts\n<p>If you would like to delete your account, you can do this on the deactivation page.\nDeleting your account removes all messages, media, contacts and every other piece of data you store in the Telegram cloud.\nThis action must be confirmed via your Telegram account and cannot be undone.</p>\n<i>\n</i>10.2.\nMessages\n<ul>\n<li>In secret chats, deleting a message always instructs the app on the other end to delete it too.</li>\n<li>In cloud chats, you can choose to delete a message for all participants within at least 48 hours after sending.\nOtherwise, deleting a message will delete it from your message history.\nThis means that a copy will stay on the server as part of your partner's message history.\nAs soon as your partner deletes it too, it's gone forever.</li>\n<li>As of version 5.5, any party can choose to delete any messages in one-on-one chats, both sent and received, for both sides.\nThere is no time limit.\nAny party can also opt to clear the entire chat history for both parties, in which case the apps will be instructed to remove all messages in that chat, however many of them are still retained by either of the participants.</li>\n<li>In supergroups and channels, deleting a message removes it for all participants.\nNote that deleted messages and original versions of edited messages from supergroups are stored for 48 hours after deletion in order to be shown in the admins log.</li>\n</ul>\n<i>\n</i>10.3.\nSelf-Destructing Messages\n<p>Messages in Secret Chats can be ordered to self-destruct.\nAs soon as such a message is read (2 checks appear), the countdown starts.\nWhen the timer expires, both devices participating in a secret chat are instructed to delete the message (photo, video, etc.).\nMedia with short timers (less than a minute) are shown with blurred previews.\nThe timer is triggered when they are viewed.</p>\n<i>\n</i>10.4.\nAccount Self-Destruction\n<p>By default, if you stop using Telegram and do not come online for at least 6 months, your account will be deleted along with all messages, media, contacts and every other piece of data you store in the Telegram cloud.\nYou can go to Settings to change the exact period after which your inactive account will self-destruct.</p>\n<i>\n</i>11.\nChanges to this Privacy Policy\n<p>We will review and may update this Privacy Policy from time to time.\nAny changes to this Privacy Policy will become effective when we post the revised Privacy Policy on this page <strong>www.telegram.org/privacy</strong>.\nPlease check our website frequently to see any updates or changes to our Privacy Policy, a summary of which we will set out below.\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>March 25, 2019</strong>\n</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Expanded [10.2.\nDeleting Messages] with data on the new features in version 5.5, which allow both participants to remove any messages from one-on-one chats for both sides without a time limit.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Important changes made to this Privacy Policy will be notified to you via Telegram.\n</p>\n<i>\n</i>12.\nQuestions and concerns\n<p>If you have any questions about privacy and our data policies, please contact our @GDPRbot.\nUse the <em>/access</em> command to learn how to get a copy of your Telegram data and use the <em>/contact</em> command to leave a request, which we will answer at the earliest opportunity.</p>\n<p>Telegram is an open source project.\nYou can examine more information on our:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>API at: https://core.telegram.org/api.\n</li>\n<li>Bot Platform at: https://core.telegram.org/bots.\n</li>\n<li>Protocol at: https://core.telegram.org/mtproto.\nand</li>\n<li>Source Code at: https://telegram.org/apps#source-code.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<em>This policy has been expanded on August 14, 2018 to add information required by the EU data protection law.</em>\n</p> Telegram Telegram is a cloud-based mobile and desktop messaging app with a focus on security and speed.\nAbout <ul>\n<li>FAQ</li>\n<li>Blog</li>\n<li>Jobs</li>\n</ul> Mobile Apps Privacy Policy <ol>\n<li> Summary </li>\n<li> Information we collect and retain <ol>\n<li> Registration information </li>\n<li> Help tickets </li>\n<li> Session identifiers </li>\n<li> Email transit logs </li>\n<li> Quarter of last log in </li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li> Information we choose to not retain <ol>\n<li> IP addresses </li>\n<li> Browser fingerprint </li>\n<li> Message metadata </li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li> How we store and share collected information <ol>\n<li> Encryption </li>\n<li> We do not share user information </li>\n<li> Academic research </li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li> Account deletion </li>\n<li> Changes to this policy </li>\n</ol>\n<p>This document describes what information we collect and what it\u2019s used for.\nIt applies to all interactions with riseup.net.\nYour use of riseup.net services will constitute your agreement to our Privacy Policy.\nPlease also review our Terms of Service.</p> Summary <p>You have a reasonable expectation of privacy regarding any communication or data transiting or stored on this information system.\nWe collect very little personal information, and none of the information we do collect is ever shared.</p> Information we collect and retain Registration information <p>When you create an account, we retain the date you registered (rounded to the nearest quarter year).\nAccount request information is removed after four months, and invite status is removed after one month.\nIf you choose to set a reset email address, we retain this record but in a format that is unreadable by us (it is stored in a hashed digest, similar to how passwords are stored).</p> Help tickets <p>The content of any help ticket you create or comment on while authenticated will be associated with your user account.\nYou can choose to fill out a help ticket anonymously by creating a ticket while not logged in.\nWe periodically delete old help tickets that are closed.</p> Session identifiers <p>While currently logged in, we keep a temporary session identifier on your computer that your software uses to prove your authentication state.\nThis is erased immediately after you log out or the session expires.\nWe do not use any third party cookies or tracking of any kind.</p> Email transit logs <p>In order to detect when our servers are under attack from a \u201cspam bomb\u201d or when a spammer is using our system, we keep a log of the \u201cfrom\u201d or \u201cto\u201d information for every message relayed.\nThese logs are purged on a daily basis.</p> Quarter of last log in <p>We keep a record of the quarter and year of your last successful authentication (in order to be able to disable and delete dormant accounts).\nWe do not record the time or day of the last log in.\nFor example, this information looks like \u201cQ3 2018\u201d.</p> Information we choose to not retain IP addresses <p>No IP addresses of any user for any service are retained.</p> Browser fingerprint <p>Your web browser communicates uniquely identifying information to all web servers it visits by allowing the site to know details about your operating system, browser information, plugins installed, fonts installed, screen resolution, and much more.\nWe do not retain any of this information.</p> Message metadata <p>Even when using end-to-end OpenPGP encryption for email messages, the email \u201csubject\u201d and routing information regarding the message \u201cfrom\u201d and \u201cto\u201d are seen by our servers in the clear when the email initially arrives.\nThis is due to inherent limitations in the email protocol and in OpenPGP.</p> How we store and share collected information Encryption <p>All of your data is stored in an encrypted format, and only Riseup has the keys to decrypt the data.\nAdditionally, as of March 2017, the storage for all new accounts is personally encrypted.\nRiseup is unable to read any of the stored content for these accounts.\nAny user with an account created prior to March 2017 may opt-in to personally encrypted storage.</p> We do not share user information <p>We retain only the bare minimum of information about each user that is required to make the service work.\nWe do not sell or share any of it.</p> Academic research <p>Anonymous, aggregated information that cannot be linked back to an individual user may be made available to experienced researchers for the sole purpose of developing better systems for anonymous and secure communication.\nFor example, we may aggregate information on how many messages a typical user sends and receives, and with what frequency.</p>\n<p>We will not read, search, or process any of your incoming or outgoing mail other than to protect you from viruses and spam or when directed to do so by you when troubleshooting.</p> Account deletion <p>You may choose to delete your riseup.net account at any time.\nDoing so will destroy all the data we retain that is associated with your account.\nThe usernames associated with deleted accounts remain unavailable for others to use for one year.</p> Changes to this policy <p>We reserve the right to change this policy.\nIf we make major changes, we will notify our users in a clear and prominent manner (like our Newsletters).\nMinor changes may only be highlighted in the footer of our website.</p> This site is run by Riseup, your friendly \u24b6utonomous tech collective since 1999 <ul>\n<li> Donate! </li>\n<li> About Us </li>\n<li> Privacy Policy </li>\n</ul> Please edit this site ", "created_at": "2018-08-29T04:16:58.738Z", liability.\nIt applies to all interactions with riseup.net.\nYour use of riseup.net services constitutes your agreement to these Terms of Service.</p> Summary <ol>\n<li>If you do anything truly evil, we will terminate your account.</li>\n<li>We are not liable for any damages related to the use of this service.</li>\n<li>You agree to hold patience in your heart for the hard work we do.</li>\n</ol> Privacy policies <p>We ask that you review our(Privacy Policy), so that you are aware of how we collect and use your information.</p> Ownership of and responsibility for content <p>All Content, whether publicly posted or privately transmitted, is the sole responsibility of the person who originated such Content.\nWe may not monitor or control the Content posted via the Services and we cannot take responsibility for such Content.\nAny use or reliance on any Content or materials posted via the Services or obtained by you through the Services is at your own risk.\nYou are responsible for your use of the Services, for any Content you provide, and for any consequences thereof.</p> Refraining from certain activities <p>You may not engage in the following activities through the services provided by riseup.net:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Harassing or abusing others by engaging in threats, stalking or sending spam.\nThis includes usernames, aliases or using any of our resources for this purpose.</li>\n<li>Misuse of services by distributing viruses or malware, engaging in a denial of service attack, or attempting to gain unauthorized access to any computer system, including this one.</li>\n<li>Contributing to the abuse of others by distributing material where the production process created violence or sexual assault against persons.</li>\n</ul> Account Termination <p>riseup.net may terminate your service at any time for any reason.\nTypically, however, accounts are destroyed because of one of the following conditions:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The account has been found to be sending Spam (excessive amounts of unsolicited email).</li>\n<li>The account has engaged one or more of the banned activities listed above.</li>\n</ul> Limitation on Liability <p>You agree that riseup.net is not liable to you or to any other party for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses, regardless of whether we were advised of the possibility of such damage.\nIn the case that applicable law may not allow the limitation or exclusion of liability or incidental or consequential damages, the above limitation or exclusion may not apply to you, although our liability will be limited to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.</p> Choice of Forum and Law <p>You agree that these Terms of Service and your use of riseup\u2019s services is governed by the law of the State of Washington and any claim or dispute shall be resolved in the Superior Court for King County, Washington.\nYou agree that the English language version of our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy is controlling in any claim or dispute.</p> Your account terminates on your death <p>You agree that any rights to your riseup account, including all information stored therein, terminate upon your death.</p> Policy regarding copyright infringement - DMCA <p>riseup.net complies with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act\u2019s notice and take-down procedures.\nDMCA complaints should be addressed to:</p>\n<code>Alan Korn\n1840 Woolsey Street\nBerkeley, CA 94703\nPh.\n(510)548-7300\nFax (510)284-3750\n</code>\n<p>Please note that it is riseup.net\u2019s policy to take reasonable steps, within our power, to terminate the accounts of users who are repeat infringers in appropriate circumstances.</p> No Warranty <p>You understand and agree that riseup provides online services \u201cas is\u201d and without any warranty, express, implied, or statutory.\nWe specifically disclaim any implied warrannties of title, merchantability, fitness for a particularly purpose and non-infringement.\nWe make no warranty as to the reliability, accessibility, or quality of our services.\nYou agree that the use of our services is at your sole and exclusive risk.</p> Changes to this policy <p>We reserve the right to change this policy.\nIf we make major changes, we will notify our users in a clear and prominent manner.\nMinor changes may only be highlighted in the footer of our website.</p> This site is run by Riseup, your friendly "updated_at": "2020-12-14T19:17:46.358Z"}, {"id": "430", "name": "Riseup and Government FAQ", "url": "https://riseup.net/en/about-us/policy/government-faq", "xpath": "", "text": " Riseup Home Home Donate! Red Accounts Account Support Email Chat VPN Black Accounts Account VPN Other Services Lists Pad Share Groups <ul>\n<li> Home </li>\n<li> Email </li>\n<li> Lists </li>\n<li> Chat </li>\n<li> VPN </li>\n<li> Security </li>\n<li> About Us </li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li> Canary </li>\n<li> Contact </li>\n<li> Newsletters </li>\n<li> Donate </li>\n<li> Policy </li>\n<li> Political Principles </li>\n<li> Press </li>\n<li> Projects </li>\n</ul> \u4e2d\u6587 Espa\u00f1ol English Portugu\u00eas Pycc\u0138\u0438\u0439 Deutsch Fran\u00e7ais Italiano Polski \u0395\u03bb\u03bb\u03b7\u03bd\u03b9\u03ba\u03ac Catal\u00e0 Hindi Support Riseup! Riseup and Government FAQ <ol>\n<li> Is Riseup working with the NSA? </li>\n<li> But your servers are located in the U.S., doesn\u2019t that mean you have to install backdoors/monitoring/etc? </li>\n<li> How is Riseup different than Lavabit and Silent Circle? </li>\n<li> What if someone (like law enforcement) takes Riseup\u2019s servers? </li>\n<li> How can I limit the amount of data that Riseup stores for me? </li>\n<li> Will Riseup services last forever? </li>\n<li> What about child porn, drugs, corruption, etc.\nWould you fight law enforcement requests for users doing these things? </li>\n</ol>\n<p>We have received your emails asking a number of good questions in light of last week\u2019s news about Lavabit and SilentCircle closing down.\nWe would like to clearly state that Riseup has never given any user information to any third party.\nWe have never permitted installation of any hardware or software monitoring on any system that we control.</p>\n<p>We will do everything in our power to protect the data of social movements and activists, short of extended incarceration.\nWe would rather pull the plug than submit to repressive surveillance by our government, or any government.\nWe are doing everything we can, as quickly as possible, to forge forward with options that would prevent us from having to shut down, in case we are faced with making such a decision.\nIn cooperation with other groups, we are hard at work to develop and deploy a radical new infrastructure that would allow us to provide email in a way that is a thousand times more secure and that would prevent us from having access to any user\u2019s data.\nWe have been working on this for over a year, but we have a lot more work to do before it is finalized.</p>\n<p>Don\u2019t panic.\nHere are some questions and answers.</p> Is Riseup working with the NSA? <p>We would rather stop being Riseup before we did that.\nWe are not working with any government agency.\nWe have never simply handed over information when requested, and for years have had a no logging policy.\nWe have fought and won every time anyone has tried to get us to give up information.\nWe have never turned over any user data to any third party, fourth party, fifth party or any party.</p> But your servers are located in the U.S., doesn\u2019t that mean you have to install backdoors/monitoring/etc? <p>We have no control over our network providers, but we have physical control of our servers, they are not hosted \u201cin the cloud.\u201d This gives us much more physical assurance of the security of our machines.\nWe would not consent to the installation of any external hardware or software on our network and would end the organization rather than install any.\nHowever, once our fiber connections leave our space, they could be monitored.\nThis is not new, and has been our assumption from the beginning.\nWhen you send an email to someone with an email hosted elsewhere, we have no control over it once it leaves our servers.\nAlso, the US still has <em>better</em> laws for internet providers than in many other countries, including many places in Europe, where there are data retention laws requiring providers to keep logs.\nThe US has no such requirement and it has been our policy for years to not keep any logs.</p> How is Riseup different than Lavabit and Silent Circle? <p>These were commercial services whose primary mission was to provide paid private email.\nRiseup is different in that we are a non-profit whose goal is to support activists and keep them safe.\nThose companies were for-profit businesses, Riseup is in it for social change!</p> What if someone (like law enforcement) takes Riseup\u2019s servers? <p>They have in the past! This usually happens when they want logs, we tell them that we don\u2019t have any and then they come and take the machine because they don\u2019t believe us and want to see for themselves.\nHowever, all of our servers use full disk encryption, which means they cannot see or do anything with the data on the disks without the keys.\nNevertheless, we do not keep IP identifying logs, and store as little data as possible on our users.\nBut this is not just Riseup\u2019s responsibility, each user is responsible for limiting the amount of data that Riseup stores for them!</p> How can I limit the amount of data that Riseup stores for me? <p>There are several ways</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Account info:</strong> When you applied for an account you provided a little information.\nAfter you are approved we don\u2019t need this information anymore and you can clean it up.\nLogin to user.riseup.net and review the information that you have provided there and consider what information you have given us that identifies you.\nFor example, if Obama had a secret email address with Riseup and applied for the address using president@whitehouse.gov as his alternate email address, it would be a good idea for him to remove president@whitehouse.gov from his alternate email if he wanted to be able to engage in Constitutionally-protected, anonymous, speech.</p>\n<p>But please note: If you do remove your alternate email, and you later lose/forget your password, it will <em>not be possible</em> for us to reset your password.\nYou will be permanently locked out of your account and will not be able to access your emails.\nYou have been warned!</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Email:</strong> If you are not already, consider using an email client that lets you download email via the POP protocol and deletes it from the server.\nThere is no getting around the mail arriving on Riseup\u2019s server, but if you download it and it\u2019s deleted from the server then Riseup doesn\u2019t have it anymore.\nBut note this does have a downside, using webmail or the IMAP protocol does allow you to check email from more than one computer.\nIf you need that ability, one approach might be to move older email offline to a single computer and just check newer things from multiple locations.\nHere are some directions for downloading your email.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Lists:</strong> one of the nice features of having a mailing list is having a message archive.\nBut if the idea of someone you don\u2019t want getting access to that archive scares you, then it might be better to do without an archive or periodically move the archive to a more secure location.\nBut don\u2019t forget that any subscriber to your list gets a copy of every message, so even if you have the archives removed, there is nothing that prevents subscribers from leaking those messages! More info at: Downloading List Archives.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Ask yourself:</strong> where are the important emails, documents, and manifestos of your group stored? Do you have a good place for them for people to find when you are gone and people want to write the history about how you changed the world? If they are only stored in Riseup, that isn\u2019t good.\nDownload them and put them somewhere safer! We are birds, so we like eggs, but we don\u2019t like people putting all their eggs in our basket.</p> Will Riseup services last forever? <p>While we are committed to doing everything in our power to protect the data of social movements and activists, short of extended incarceration, we would rather pull the plug than submit to repressive surveillance by any government.\nWe would be really sad to see Riseup go, but if we are forced to, we would rather it go away than to betray your trust and compromise the activist community.\nWith this in mind, you should be sure you are prepared in case something does happen, such as downloading and archive your email on your own computer!</p> What about child porn, drugs, corruption, etc.\nWould you fight law enforcement requests for users doing these things? <p>Those things violate Riseup\u2019s Terms of Service and, unlike some more \u201cAmerican Libertarian\u201d service providers, we do not exist to provide privacy for doing anything you want.\nWe would close the accounts of people doing those things and the collective may even decide to cooperate with law enforcement rather than set all the servers on fire and destroy the organization, and your email.</p> This site is run by Riseup, your friendly \u24b6utonomous tech collective since 1999 <ul>\n<li> Donate! </li>\n<li> About Us </li>\n<li> Privacy Policy </li>\n</ul> Thank you for your interest in www.MyAnimeList.net and the MyAnimeList online manga store, and any other MyAnimeList branded websites, online stores, services, games and applications, and other MyAnimeList applications and online services (collectively, the \u201cService\u201d or \u201cServices\u201d, which also include the MAL Online Manga Store as defined below in Section 18), owned and operated by MyAnimeList Co., Ltd.\n(formerly MyAnimeList, LLC) (\u201cMyAnimeList\u201d, \u201cMAL\u201d, \u201cwe\u201d, \u201cus\u201d, \u201cour\u201d or \u201cCompany\u201d).\nPlease read this Terms of Use Agreement document (\u201cAgreement\u201d or \u201cTerms of Use\u201d) carefully because it is legally binding and governs your access to and use of our Service, including any Company Content and User Content (defined below).\nThis Agreement applies to all visitors, users, Members (referenced below), moderators, and others who access or use the Services (\u201cUser\u201d or \"Users\").\nAll references to \u201cyou\u201d or \u201cyour,\u201d as applicable, mean the User or other person or entity who accesses or uses the Services in any manner.</p>\n<p>By accessing or using the Service, you signify that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Use, MyAnimeList's Privacy Policy, and any additional terms and conditions, notices and disclaimers displayed through the Service, whether or not you are a registered user of the Service.\nYou agree that by clicking \u201cSign Up\u201d, \u201cJoin\u201d or other similar registration links or buttons or by accessing or using the Service, <b>you are agreeing to enter into a legally binding contract with the Company</b>.\nIf you do not agree to these Terms of Use, MyAnimeList's Privacy Policy, or any other terms and conditions, notices or disclaimers displayed through the Service, do not click \u201cSign Up\u201d, \u201cJoin\u201d or other similar links or buttons and do not access or use any of our Services.\n</p> 1.\nAmendments to these Terms of Use <p>These Terms of Use may be amended by us from time to time and we reserve the right to do so at any time.\nWhen we amend these Terms of Use, we will provide notice to you.\nWe may provide you notice of amended Terms of Use by sending an email to the email address associated with your MyAnimeList user account (if you have chosen to provide an email address) or by otherwise providing notice through our Service.\nAny amendments to the Terms of Use will be posted here and the date indicated on the top of the Terms of Use will state the date the Terms of Use were last revised.\nContinued use of the Service after any amendments to the Terms of Use and after we have provided you notice of the amended Terms of Use constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms of Use.\nIf you do not agree to the Terms of Use, you may not access or use the Services and should therefore immediately cease any use of the Services.\n</p> 2.\nEligibility <p>You represent that you are over the age of majority as required by the applicable law of your jurisdiction.\nIf you are a minor in the jurisdiction in which you reside (e.g.\nunder 18 years of age), you may only use the Service if (a) you obtain parental or legal guardian consent after review of this Agreement prior to you using any of the Service provided by Company and (b) you are competent and fully able to enter into the representations, and warranties, terms, conditions, obligations, and affirmations, set forth in this Agreement, and to comply with and abide by this Agreement.\nAll minors must be directly supervised by their parent or guardian while using our chat rooms.\nThough Company has the right to monitor the Service, including the chat rooms, Company has no obligation to do so, and Company does not systematically monitor and review the conversations that take place in the chat rooms.\nCompany does not determine the true identity or age of those who frequent and use the Service chat rooms.</p>\n<p>Additionally, children under age 13 in the U.S.\nand children under age 16 in Europe may only use the Service if, and only if, we have obtained verifiable parental consent from their parent or guardian, as discussed in our Privacy Policy.\nThe Company may in its sole discretion for any or no reason, with or without notice, including without limitation if it has not received verifiable parental consent and it believes that you are under 13 in the U.S.\nor under 16 in Europe, terminate your account or profile, delete any content or information that you have posted on the Service, and/or prohibit you from using or accessing the Service (or any portion, aspect or feature of the Service).</p>\n<p>If you do not agree or are not in compliance with these Terms of Use, you may not use our Service.\n</p> 3.\nLimitation of Liability <p>IN NO EVENT WILL THE COMPANY, ITS AFFILIATES, OR ITS AND THEIR RESPECTIVE DIRECTORS, MANAGERS, OFFICERS, MEMBERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUCCESSORS, OR ASSIGNS BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING DAMAGES FOR LOST PROFITS OR LOSS DAMAGES.\nNOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY SET FORTH HEREIN, THE COMPANY'S AGGREGATE LIABILITY TO YOU FOR ANY CAUSE WHATSOEVER, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF THE ACTION, WILL AT ALL TIMES BE LIMITED TO AN AMOUNT NO GREATER THAN THE AMOUNT YOU PAID TO US FOR THE SERVICES, DIGITAL CONTENT (DEFINED BELOW) OR ANY RELATED PRODUCTS.\nTO THE EXTENT APPLICABLE LAW DOES NOT ALLOW THE EXCLUSIONS AND LIMITATIONS OF DAMAGES AS SET FORTH ABOVE, SOME OR ALL OF THE ABOVE EXCLUSIONS AND LIMITATIONS MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU, IN WHICH CASE THE COMPANY'S LIABILITY TO YOU WILL BE LIMITED TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.\nTHE LIMITATIONS AND EXCLUSIONS SET FORTH HEREIN WILL SURVIVE ANY TERMINATION OF ACCESS TO OR USE OF OUR SERVICE.</p>\n<p>Without limiting the foregoing, and to the extent allowed by applicable law, Company assumes no liability or responsibility, including but not limited to, for any of the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Any interruption or cessation of transmission to or from the Service.\n</li>\n<li>Errors, mistakes, or inaccuracies of content.\n</li>\n<li>Any unauthorized access to or use of our secure servers and/or any and all personal information stored any kind suffered by you or claimed to have been suffered by you arising out of or as a result of your use of any third party websites, applications or other services that may link to, be linked to from, access or integrate with our Services.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The foregoing limitation of liability shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by law in the applicable jurisdiction.\nThis limitation of liability section applies whether the alleged liability is based on contract, tort, negligence, strict liability, or any other basis, even if Company has been advised of the possibility of such damage.\n</p>\n<p>The Service is controlled and operated from facilities in Japan, and we may process some data in the United States.\nThose who access or use the Service from other jurisdictions do so at their own volition and are entirely responsible for compliance with local law, including but not limited to export and import regulations, to the extent permitted by law.\nYou represent that you are not (1) located in a country that is subject to a Japan or U.S.\ngovernment embargo, or that has been designated by the Japan or U.S.\ngovernment as a \u201cterrorist supporting\u201d country, and (2) listed on any Japan or U.S.\ngovernment list of prohibited or restricted parties.\nWithout limiting the foregoing, software available in connection with the Service may be subject to applicable export controls.\nNo feature, function, software or any component thereof may be downloaded from the Service or otherwise exported or re-exported in violation of any applicable export laws.\nDownloading or using any software is at your sole risk.\nYou further agree not to upload to the Service any data or software that cannot be exported without prior written government authorization.</p> 4.\nUse of the Service <p>Company grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-assignable, non-sub-licensable, revocable, license to use the Service solely for your personal, noncommercial use, and as set forth in this Agreement, provided that (a) you will not alter or modify any part of the Service other than as may be reasonably necessary to use the Service for its intended purpose, (b) you will not copy, distribute, or disclose any part of the Service in any medium, and (c) you will otherwise comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.\nCompany may revoke this license at any time, and in its sole discretion.\nUpon such revocation, you must promptly destroy all materials downloaded or otherwise obtained from the Service, as well as all copies of such materials, whether made in accordance with these Terms of Use or otherwise.</p>\n<p>No registration is required to use the Service.\nHowever, in order to access certain features of the Service, registration with Company will be required and you will need to create a \"Member\" account or other user account or profile.\nYour account or profile gives you access to the services and functionality that we may establish and maintain from time to time and in our sole discretion.</p>\n<p>Company may also offer a paid subscription service where Users may use the Service with premium features, including, for example (i) where Members will not see ads hosted by the Service while logged into their accounts, and (ii) receive special discounts for purchases of goods and services from the Service, affiliates and third party partners.\nMyAnimeList may change the fees or benefits associated with the premium features from time to time with reasonable advance notice.\nprovided, however, that no advance notice will be required for temporary promotions, including temporary reductions in the fees associated with the premium features.</p>\n<p>You may submit your debit card, credit card, or other payment information (\"Payment Information\") via our Service to purchase premium features or other paid products or services.\nWe use third-party service providers to process your Payment Information.\nIf you submit your Payment Information, you agree to pay all costs that you incur, and you give us permission to charge you when payment is due for an amount that includes these costs and any applicable taxes and fees.\nBy signing up for premium features or other paid products or services, you are providing us with your payment account information, you are signing up to an auto-renewing subscription requiring recurring payments and agree to pay the then-current applicable fee listed in the agreement.</p>\n<p>If you sign up for a monthly subscription service, you will be charged your first monthly subscription fee and any applicable taxes on the date you purchase your subscription or, if your subscription includes a free trial, on the day after your free trial ends.\nYour subscription will automatically continue on a monthly basis, and you will continue to be charged on a monthly basis at the then-current price (including any applicable taxes), until you cancel your subscription or we terminate it.\nIf you sign up for the yearly subscription service, you will be charged your first upfront, non-refundable (except as described below) yearly subscription fee and any applicable taxes on the date you purchase your subscription or, if your subscription includes a free trial, on the day after your free trial ends.\nYour subscription will automatically continue on a yearly basis at the then-current price (including any applicable taxes), and you will continue to be charged on a yearly basis, until you cancel your subscription or we terminate it.\nYou can find your monthly and/or yearly subscription billing date in your account settings.</p>\n<p>If your subscription includes a free trial, you will not be charged the applicable fee during your free trial.\nTo obtain the free trial you will be required to provide a credit card in order to ensure uninterrupted access to the premium features and services and continued use after the expiration of the free trial.\nUpon completion of your free trial, your subscription will automatically convert into a paid monthly subscription and your payment method will be charged the applicable fee unless you have cancelled that subscription.\nYou may cancel your monthly subscription as described below.\nYou agree that your payment method may be authorized for up to approximately one month of charges of service as soon as you subscribe.\nIn some instances, your available balance or credit limit may be reduced to reflect the authorization.\nhowever, no charges will be made against the payment method unless you do not cancel prior to the end of your free trial.\nYou may not receive a notice from us that your free trial has ended or that the paying portion of your monthly subscription has begun.\nYou are only permitted one free trial.\nIf your monthly subscription is ever terminated for any reason, and you purchase an additional monthly subscription, you shall not be eligible for a free trial on any subsequent monthly subscriptions.</p>\n<p>We may change the subscription terms or fees at any time on a going forward basis in our discretion.\nIf the pricing for your subscription increases, we will notify you, and provide you an opportunity to change your subscription before applying those changes to your account or charging your payment details in connection with an automatic renewal.\nIf we notify you in advance of at least fifteen (15) days, your continued use of the premium features or other products and services associated with your monthly subscription after the changes have been made will constitute your acceptance of the changes.\nIf you do not wish to continue subscribing with the new fees or features, you may cancel your subscription.\nIf you accept the new subscription, its terms and conditions will apply for that renewal and all renewals going forward.\nFor information on the monthly and yearly subscription fees and terms, please visit our Customer Support.</p>\n<p>You may cancel your subscription service at any time in your account settings or by contacting us via our Help Center.\nYou must cancel your subscription before it renews to avoid billing of the next periodic subscription fees to your account.\nHowever, if you cancel a pre-paid yearly or monthly subscription, you will not receive any refund.\nIf you cancel your monthly or yearly subscription, you will be able to use your premium features and services for the remainder of your pre-paid subscription term.</p>\n<p>We may terminate your subscription at our discretion and without any notice.\nFees for such services are refundable in Company's sole discretion.\nIf we cancel your yearly subscription, we will give you a prorated refund based on the amount of time remaining in your pre-paid subscription.\nprovided, however, that Company will not be obligated to grant you a refund if we terminate your account or your subscription because we determine, in our sole discretion, that your actions or your use of the Service violates these Terms of Use or has harmed or damaged another user.\nOtherwise, there is no prorated refund of any fees upon any termination or cancellation.\n</p>\n<p>You agree to immediately pay any amounts accrued, but remaining unpaid, as of termination (if any).\nYou hereby authorize Company to collect fees through various service.\nWhen creating your account or profile, you must provide complete and accurate information, and you must update your information to keep it accurate, current, and complete.\nYou are solely login(s)).\nYou authorize moderators to review such information as reasonably necessary to investigate complaints, respond to appeals, or for such other purposes as contemplated in the Privacy Policy harvesting techniques.\nAs such, you understand and agree that your User Content may become publicly available outside of the Services.\n</p> 6.\nModerators <p>Except for the moderating performed by conditions pertaining to User Content herein.\nWe may change the features or abilities associated with moderating from time to time without prior notice.\n&nbsp;We reserve the right to revoke or limit a User\u2019s ability to moderate at any time and for any reason or no reason, including for a breach of these Terms of Use.\n</p>\n<p>For guidance on how to become a MyAnimeList moderator, Users should visit the forum page, \u201cHow to become a MAL Moderator,\u201d which outlines this process, the types of moderators, and contains links to various guidelines for moderators and Users of a particular subject.</p>\n<p>If selected and you choose to become a MyAnimeList moderator:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You agree to provide an email address for us to contact you to verify who you are as a moderator, business purposes related to your role as a moderator, and for security purposes, as may be needed.\n</li>\n<li>You agree that when you receive reports related to your threads and community, that you will take action to moderate by removing content and/or escalating to the head moderators for review as appropriate.\n</li>\n<li>You agree to respond within a reasonable amount of time to the head moderators and site admins.\n</li>\n<li>You may not represent that you are authorized to act on behalf of the Company.\n</li>\n<li>You may not enter into any agreement with a third party on behalf of the Company without our written approval.\n</li>\n<li>You may not perform moderation actions in return for any form of compensation or favor from third parties.\n</li>\n<li>Moderators may not represent brands in their capacity as moderators, and any discussion of brands by a moderator shall be unofficial and will not be associated with MyAnimeList in any way.\n</li>\n<li>If you have access to non-public information through your role as a moderator, or as a result of moderating a MyAnimeList thread or community, you will safeguard that information and not disclose it except as may be required by these Terms of Use, the Company or applicable law, and you will only use such non-public information as reasonably necessary in connection with your performance moderating services.\nand </li>\n<li>You may create and enforce rules for the MyAnimeList threads and communities that you moderate, provided that such rules are consistent with and do not conflict with these Terms of Use.\nYou may also have the ability to ban Users who violate these Terms of Use or otherwise act maliciously, unlawfully or inappropriately.\nAppeals from Users to your actions should be taken seriously, and moderator responses to appeals from Users should be consistent, germane to the issue raised, and focused on educating that User about conduct in accordance with the rules.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>MyAnimeList reserves the right, but has no obligation, to overturn any action or decision of a moderator, if MyAnimeList believes that such action or decision is not in the interest of MyAnimeList or the MyAnimeList community.</p> 7.\nPrivacy Policy <p>Please refer to our Privacy Policy.\nBy using the Service, you grant Company the right to collect, store, use, share the Service, please notify our copyright agent, as set forth below.\nFor your notice to be effective under the DMCA, you, as a complaining party, must provide all of the following information in writing to our copyright agent:</p>\n<p>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nA physical or electronic signature of a person authorized site.</p>\n<p>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nIdentification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that you request to be removed or access to which be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit MyAnimeList to locate the material.</p>\n<p>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nInformation reasonably sufficient to permit MyAnimeList to contact the complaining party, such as an address, telephone number, and, if available, an email address at which the complaining party may be contacted.</p>\n<p>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nA statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that use of the material in information in the notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.</p>\n<p>Please submit your notice to MyAnimeList\u2019s copyright agent:</p>\n<p>MyAnimeList Co., Ltd.<br> Address: 1-1-1 Hitotsubashi Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo 100-0003 Japan<br> Attn: Copyright Manager<br> Email: legal@mail.myanimelist.net</p>\n<p>Please note that this procedure is exclusively for notifying Company that your copyrighted material has been infringed.\nThe preceding with no prior activity may be deactivated or deleted after three or more months of inactivity.</p>\n<p>We may deactivate, delete, suspend or terminate your account, status as a moderator, or ability
