{"name": "PayPal", "documents": [{"id": "158", "name": "Privacy Policy", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/ua/privacy-full", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/div/section/div", "text": "<p>&gt;&gt.\nView all legal agreements</p>PayPal Privacy Statement<p>\n</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Effective October 16, 2020</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Overview</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Your privacy rights and choices</strong>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Understanding your rights</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Understanding your choices</strong>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>The personal data we collect</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Where personal data comes from</strong>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>How we use tracking technologies like cookies</strong>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Why we collect personal data</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>How and why we share personal data</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>How we protect your personal data</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>How this statement changes over time</strong>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Contact Us</strong>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Overview <p>This privacy statement explains how and why PayPal collects, stores, uses, and shares personal data when you visit our websites or use our services.\nReading it will help you understand your privacy rights and choices.</p>\n<p>\u201cPersonal data\u201d in this statement means information about you, including your identity, finances, and online behavior.</p>\n<p>\u201cPayPal\u201d in this statement means PayPal, Inc.\nThis privacy statement only applies to the PayPal and Xoom services offered by PayPal.\nTo learn about our privacy practices for our other products or services, like Venmo or Braintree, visit the website and review the privacy statement for that product or service.</p> Your privacy rights and choices <p>When it comes to how your personal data is collected, stored, used, and shared, you have rights and choices.</p>\n<strong>Understanding your rights</strong>\n<p>You have the right to request a copy of the personal data we\u2019ve collected about you in the past 12 months.\nYou also have the right to ask us to delete your personal data we have collected about you.\nIf you want to see or delete your personal data, contact us.\nWe will not deny you services, charge you different prices, or provide you with a different level of service solely for exercising your privacy rights.</p>\n<p>If you request to see or delete your personal data, we\u2019ll first need to verify who you are before we can respond to your request.\nIf we can\u2019t verify your identity, we will not be able to fulfill your request.</p>\n<p>If you want to delete your personal data, you have choices:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Log in to your account and delete information you previously added.\nFor example, you can delete your profile picture and non-primary addresses in your settings</li>\n<li>Call us and request that we delete specific information</li>\n<li>Close your account</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you close your account or request that we delete personal data, we still need to keep some personal data so we can:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Complete a transaction, provide goods or services you requested, or comply with our promises to you in the User Agreement or other contract you have with us</li>\n<li>Detect and prevent malicious, fraudulent, or illegal activity</li>\n<li>Protect your (or another person\u2019s) legal rights, including the right to free speech</li>\n<li>Manage our internal business processes that are reasonably related to your expectations when using our services</li>\n<li>Comply with laws</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Depending on where you live and what type of account you use, you may have different rights and choices for managing your personal data.\nFor example, certain State privacy laws do not apply to personal data collected, processed, or disclosed by a financial institution according to federal laws, such as the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act.\nConsumers may read our <u>Consumer Privacy Notice</u> for more information about their rights under US federal law.</p>\n<strong>Understanding your choices</strong>\n<p>You can control how personal data is collected or shared, as well as how we communicate with you.\nHere are some of the ways you can customize your choices.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Choose how we collect personal data</strong>\n</p>\n<p>You may choose to limit the personal data you provide when our apps or services request it.\nTo help make choices that are right for you, it\u2019s important to understand that personal data helps us provide a richer, more personalized experience for you.\nAlso, some personal data is required for our services to function at all.</p>\n<p>For example, sharing your contacts helps make it easier for you to find the people you want to send money to.\nIf you choose not to share your contacts with us, you can still use our mobile apps, but some actions may not be as fast or easy as it would be if shared your contacts.\nAnother example is creating an account with us.\nIf you choose not to provide information that is required for an account to function, like your name and email address, we will not be able to create an account for you.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Choose how connected accounts collect and use personal data</strong>\n</p>\n<p>If you connect your account to a third-party service, you may be able to manage how your personal data is collected, used, and shared by them.\nRead the third parties\u2019 privacy policies to see the choices they offer you.</p>\n<p>You can control which third-party services you connect to your account and what personal data they can collect about you.\nFor example, to manage the permissions, go to the Security settings in your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Choose how we communicate with you</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Your choices about how we communicate with you differ depending on the purpose of the message and how it is delivered.\nSome messages are considered optional and some are necessary for you to manage your accounts with us.\nWe use email, text messages, push notifications on your mobile device, and even paper mail depending on the situation and your preferences.</p>\n<p>You can click the unsubscribe link in a marketing email, opt out of a text message by replying \u201cSTOP,\u201d or turn off notifications on your device.\nYou can also change your account\u2019s notification settings or the notification preferences on your device.</p>\n<p>You won\u2019t be able to opt out of messages that are considered necessary for you to manage your account, such as receipts and emails that alert you to changes in your account\u2019s status that require your attention.\nYou may be able to decide how we send those messages, such as by email, text message, or a notification on your mobile device.</p> The personal data we collect <p>We may collect your personal data when you register for or use our services, such as when you create an account, make a payment, or make a purchase on a merchant\u2019s website.</p>\n<p>If you use our services without creating or logging into an account, we\u2019ll still collect personal data, which may include your payment information, device information, and location.\nWhen you use our services without creating or logging into an account, we will use this information to process transactions, prevent fraud and comply with the law.\nWe may connect this information with your account, if you have one or if you create an account at a later date.</p>\n<p>Here are the kinds of personal data that we may collect when you create an account or use our services:</p>\n<p>1.\nInformation that identifies you, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>First and last name</li>\n<li>Address</li>\n<li>Phone number</li>\n<li>Email</li>\n<li>IP address</li>\n<li>Information collected from cookies or other tracking technologies</li>\n</ul>\n<p>2.\nRecords and financial information, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Social Security Number</li>\n<li>Government-issued identification</li>\n<li>Bank account and routing numbers</li>\n<li>Credit and debit card information</li>\n<li>Financial information</li>\n</ul>\n<p>3.\nPersonal characteristics, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Age</li>\n<li>National origin</li>\n<li>Disability</li>\n<li>Citizenship</li>\n<li>Military status</li>\n</ul>\n<p>4.\nCommercial information, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Online shopping cart information</li>\n<li>Purchase history</li>\n</ul>\n<p>5.\nInternet or network activity, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Interactions with our services or sites</li>\n<li>Shopping history</li>\n</ul>\n<p>6.\nGeolocation data, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Global Positioning System (GPS) information when you give us permission through your device settings</li>\n<li>IP-based geolocation</li>\n</ul>\n<p>7.\nAudio, electronic, visual, biometric, or similar information, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Call recordings when you talk to customer service</li>\n<li>Voice identification, when you consent to this biometric method of authentication</li>\n<li>Photo IDs and profile pictures you provide</li>\n</ul>\n<p>8.\nProfessional or employment information, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Business information, contact emails and phone numbers</li>\n<li>Tax IDs</li>\n</ul>\n<p>9.\nInformation we infer based on your personal data, for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Fraud and risk assessments</li>\n<li>Personalization preferences</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Where personal data comes from <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We may collect personal information about you from various sources, for example from:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You</li>\n<li>Merchants</li>\n<li>Our payment partners, such as card networks and payment processors</li>\n<li>Financial institutions, such as banks</li>\n<li>Credit bureaus</li>\n<li>Service providers, such as companies that help us manage risk and fraud, deliver services to you, and market our services</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We do not knowingly collect personal information from people who are not allowed to use our sites and services, such as children under the age of 13.\n<u>Contact us</u> if you believe that we\u2019ve mistakenly collected personal data from someone not allowed to use our services.\nWe\u2019ll delete it immediately, unless we\u2019re legally required to keep it.</p>\n<strong>How we use tracking technologies like cookies</strong>\n<p>We or our authorized service providers may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect personal data whenever you use our services, visit our sites, or visit websites that offer our services.\nThe information collected with these technologies helps us personalize your experience, measure the effect of our ads, prevent fraud and enhance the security of our sites and service.</p>\n<p>You can disable or decline some cookies for our sites and services.\nBut, since some parts of our service rely on cookies to work, those services could become difficult or impossible to use.</p>\n<p>Some web browsers have an optional setting called \u201cDo Not Track\u201d (DNT) that lets you opt-out of being tracked by advertisers and some third parties.\nBecause many of our services won\u2019t function without tracking data, we do not respond to DNT settings.</p>\n<p>If you want to know more about how we use cookies, read our <u>Cookie Statement</u>.\nTo learn how to opt-out of this kind of tracking technology, visit <u>About Ads</u>.</p> Why we collect personal data <p>We collect personal data for many reasons, including to improve your experience, and to run our business.\nSpecific reasons why we collect your personal data include:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Run our sites and provide better services, for example to help you send or request money, make purchases, show you your account information, verify access to your account, and keep your account and payment information up to date.</li>\n<li>Manage and improve our business.\nFor example, we do user research to improve our products\u2019 performance and abilities.\nWe also monitor and analyze our sites to help ensure they work as expected.&nbsp;</li>\n<li>Protect our business and our customers from risk and fraud, including fraud that involves our business partners, strategic ventures, or other individuals and merchants, such as eBay, Inc.</li>\n<li>Send you marketing information about our products and services.\nWe may use personal data to market about our partners, such as merchants.\nWe use personal data to better understand and cater to your interests.</li>\n<li>Personalize your experience when you use our sites and services, as well as other third-party sites and services.\nIn this case, we might use tracking technologies like cookies.\nSee our&nbsp;Cookie Statement&nbsp;for more details.</li>\n<li>Send you locally relevant options, but only if you agree to let us track your location.\nIf you do, this can help us enhance the security of our sites and services, and customize our services by using the right language and personalizing content such as ads and search results.</li>\n<li>Make it easy for you to find and connect with others.\nFor instance, if you let us access your contacts, we can suggest connections with people you may know.</li>\n<li>Contact you when you need us, such as answering a question you sent to our customer service team.</li>\n<li>Comply with laws and enforce our agreements with you and other people who use our services.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> How and why we share personal data <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We do not sell your personal data.\nHowever, we may share personal data across our services and with other members of the PayPal corporate family.\nSometimes we share the personal data we collect with third parties to help us provide services, protect our customers from risk and fraud, market our products, and comply with legal obligations.</p>\n<p>You can review the personal data that we may share by reviewing <u>The personal data we collect</u> section.</p>\n<p>We may share personal data with:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Other members of the PayPal corporate family</li>\n<li>Service providers that help us with processing payments, marketing, research, compliance, audits, corporate governance, communications, and security</li>\n<li>Card networks and payment processors</li>\n<li>Financial institutions, such as banks we partner with to offer joint products, like Synchrony Bank in connection with PayPal Credit, the PayPal Cashback Mastercard, and the PayPal Extras Mastercard</li>\n<li>Credit reporting and collections agencies</li>\n<li>Courts, governments, regulators and law enforcement when accompanied by a subpoena or other legal documentation that requires PayPal or members of our corporate family to respond</li>\n<li>People involved in a transaction, such as other users or merchants and their service providers.</li>\n<li>Third parties that you asked us to connect with, such as other financial or social media apps.\nIf you want us to stop sharing information with a third party, disconnect your account from that third party.</li>\n<li>Third-party tools used to help fight spam and abuse.\nFor instance, we use ReCaptcha to help determine whether you\u2019re a person or a computer.\nWhen you use ReCaptcha, your personal data is subject to&nbsp;Google\u2019s Privacy Policy&nbsp;and&nbsp;Terms of Use.</li>\n<li>Other third parties to: <ul>\n<li>Comply with laws</li>\n<li>Investigate or enforce violations of our user agreement</li>\n<li>Facilitate a merger, purchase, or sale of part or all of our business</li>\n<li>Comply with card association rules</li>\n<li>To prevent physical harm or illegal activity</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> How we protect your personal data <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Helping to keep your personal data safe against loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, and alteration is our top priority.</p>\n<p>To protect your personal data, we use technical, physical, and administrative security measures that include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Firewalls</li>\n<li>Data encryption</li>\n<li>Physical access controls at our data centers</li>\n</ul>\n<p>While we protect our systems and services, you\u2019re responsible for keeping your password(s) and account information private.\nYou are also responsible for making sure your personal information is accurate and up to date.</p>\n<p>If your account is closed, we may keep your personal data and other information as required by law and according to our data retention policy.\nIf we do, we\u2019ll continue to handle it as we describe in this statement.</p> How this statement changes over time <p>We\u2019ll make changes to this privacy statement from time to time.\nThis helps us stay up to date with changes to our business and the most current laws.\nAfter a new version is published, we\u2019ll collect, store, use, and protect your personal data as we outline in that revised statement.</p>\n<p>If the new version reduces your rights or increases your responsibilities, we\u2019ll post it on the <u>Policy Updates or Privacy Statement</u> page of our website at least 21 days before it becomes effective.</p>\n<p>We may notify you about these changes through email or other communications.</p> Contact Us <p>If you have questions about this privacy statement or your personal data, contact us so we can help.</p>\n<p>To talk about your PayPal account:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Call PayPal Customer Service at 1-888-221-1161</li>\n<li>or <u>visit our Customer Service web portal</u>&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>To talk about your Xoom account:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Call Xoom Customer Service at 1-877-815-1531</li>\n<li>or <u>visit our Help Center web portal</u>&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Consumer Privacy Notice <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Effective Date: March 12, 2020</p>\n<p>This Consumer Privacy Notice applies to you if you are an individual who resides in the United States and uses PayPal sites or services for your own personal, family or household purposes.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>FACTS</p>\n<p>\n<strong>WHAT DOES PAYPAL DO WITH YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Why?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Financial companies choose how they share your personal information.\nFederal law gives consumers the right to limit some but not all sharing.\nFederal law also requires us to tell you how we collect, share, and protect your personal information.\nPlease read this notice carefully to understand what we do.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>What?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>The types of personal information we collect and share depend on the product or service you have with us.\nThis information can include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Social Security number and account balances</li>\n<li>Payment history or transaction history</li>\n<li>Credit history or credit scores</li>\n</ul>\n<p>When you are no longer our customer, we continue to share your information as described in this notice.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>How?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>All financial companies need to share customers\u2019 personal information to run their everyday business.\nIn the section below, we list the reasons financial companies can share their customers\u2019 personal information.\nthe reasons PayPal chooses to share.\nand whether you can limit this sharing.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Reasons we can share your personal information</p>\n<p>Does PayPal share?</p>\n<p>Can you limit this sharing?</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For our everyday business purposes \u2013</strong>\n<br> such as to process your transactions, maintain your account(s), respond to court orders and legal investigations, or report to credit bureaus</p>\n<p>Yes</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For our marketing purposes \u2013</strong>\n<br> to offer our products and services to you</p>\n<p>Yes</p>\n<p>No<br> &nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For joint marketing with other financial companies</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Yes</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For our affiliates\u2019 everyday business purposes \u2013</strong>\n<br> information about your transactions and experiences</p>\n<p>Yes</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For our affiliates\u2019 everyday business purposes \u2013</strong>\n<br> information about your creditworthiness</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>We don\u2019t share</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For our affiliates to market to you</strong>\n</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>We don\u2019t share</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For nonaffiliates to market to you</strong>\n</p>\n<p>No</p>\n<p>We don\u2019t share</p> Questions? <p>Call our customer service at 1-888-221-1161or visit us at&nbsp;<strong>https://www.paypal.com/us/smarthelp/contact-us?email=privacy</strong>.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Who we are</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Who is providing this Privacy&nbsp;<u>Statement</u>?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>This privacy notice is provided by PayPal, Inc.\nand is applicable to your personal U.S.\nPayPal and/or Xoom accounts.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>What we do</p>\n<p>\n<strong>How does PayPal protect my personal information?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>To protect your personal information from unauthorized access and use, we use security measures that comply with federal law.\nThese measures include computer safeguards and secured files and buildings.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>How does PayPal collect my personal information?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>We collect your personal information, for example, when you</p>\n<ul>\n<li>open an account or provide account information</li>\n<li>use your credit or debit card or give us your contact information</li>\n<li>use your PayPal and/or Xoom account to send or receive funds</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We also collect your personal information from others, such as credit bureaus, affiliates, or other companies.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Why can\u2019t I limit all sharing?</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Federal law gives you the right to limit only</p>\n<ul>\n<li>sharing for affiliates\u2019 everyday business purposes \u2014 information about your creditworthiness</li>\n<li>affiliates from using your information to market to you</li>\n<li>sharing for nonaffiliates to market to you</li>\n</ul>\n<p>State laws and individual companies may give you additional rights to limit sharing.\nSee below for more information on your rights under state law.</p>\n<p>Definitions</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Affiliates</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Companies related by common ownership or control.\nThey can be financial and nonfinancial companies.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Our affiliates include Bill Me Later, Inc.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>Nonaffiliates</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Companies not related by common ownership or control.\nThey can be financial and nonfinancial companies.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Nonaffiliates with which we share personal information include service providers that perform services or functions on our behalf.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>Joint Marketing</strong>\n</p>\n<p>A formal agreement between nonaffiliated financial companies that together market financial products or services to you.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Our joint marketing partners include financial companies and banks, such as Synchrony Bank.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Other important information</p>\n<p>We may transfer personal information to other countries, for example, for customer service or to process transactions.</p> &nbsp.\n<p>\n<u>California:</u> Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Act of 2018 (CCPA) permits consumers who are California residents to ask businesses covered under the act about personal data it has collected about the consumer, submit an access or deletion request, and opt-out of the sale of personal information, if applicable.\nThese provisions do not apply to personal data collected, processed, shared, or disclosed by financial institutions pursuant to federal law such as the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act.\nContact us if you have questions about our privacy statement, this consumer notice, or your personal data.\nIf your PayPal account has a California mailing address, we will not share personal information we collect about you except to the extent permitted under California law.&nbsp;</p> &nbsp.\n<p>To talk about your PayPal account, call PayPal Customer Service at 1-888-221-1161 or&nbsp;visit our Customer Service web portal.&nbsp;To talk about your Xoom account, call Xoom Customer Service at 1-877-815-1531 or&nbsp;visit our Help Center web portal.</p> &nbsp.\n<p>\n<u>Vermont</u>: If your PayPal account has a Vermont mailing address, we will not share personal information we collect about you with non-affiliates unless the law allows or you provide authorization.&nbsp;</p> &nbsp.\n<p>\n<u>Nevada</u>: If your PayPal account has a Nevada mailing address, we are providing this notice pursuant to Nevada law.\nIf you prefer not to receive marketing calls from PayPal, you may be placed on our internal Do Not Call List by calling 1-888-221-1161 or going to&nbsp;<strong>https://www.paypal.com/selfhelp/home</strong>.\nFor more information, you can contact PayPal at 12312 Port Grace Blvd, La Vista, NE 68128 or you can contact the Bureau of Consumer Protection, Office of the Nevada Attorney General, 555 E.\nWashington St., Suite 3900, Las Vegas, NV 89101.\ntelephone number: 1-702-486-3132.\nemail:&nbsp;Aginfo@ag.nv.gov</p>\n<p>\n</p>", "created_at": "2018-07-17T10:11:49.170Z", "updated_at": "2020-12-14T14:00:47.434Z"}, {"id": "368", Agreement PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT About Your Account <p>This user agreement will be effective for all users as of September 14, 2020.\n</p> Welcome to PayPal!<p>These are the terms and conditions of the contract between you and PayPal (Europe) S.a r.l.\net Cie, S.C.A.\n(\u201cPayPal\u201d) governing your use of your PayPal account and the PayPal services, which we call our user agreement.\nIt applies only to PayPal accounts of residents of Netherlands.\nIf you are an individual, you must be at least 18 years old and have full legal capacity to enter into a contract to open a PayPal account and use the PayPal services.\nIf you are a business, the business must be registered in Netherlands.</p>\n<p>To use the PayPal services you need to open a PayPal account.\nBy opening and using a PayPal account, you agree to comply with all of the terms and conditions in this user agreement.\nYou also agree to comply with the following additional documents and each of the other documents on the Legal Agreements page that apply to you:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Fees page</li>\n<li>Privacy Statement</li>\n<li>Acceptable Use Policy</li>\n<li>All future changes notified in the Policy Update already published on the \u201cLegal Agreements\u201d page.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Please read carefully all of the terms and conditions of this user agreement and each of the other documents that apply to you.</p>\n<p>We may revise this user agreement and any of the documents listed above from time to time.\nThe revised version will be effective at the time we post it, unless otherwise noted.\nIf our changes reduce your rights or increase your responsibilities we will post a notice on the Policy Updates page of our website and provide notice to you of at least two months.\nBy continuing to use our services after any changes to this user agreement take effect, you agree to be bound by those changes.\nIf you do not agree with any changes, you may close your account before the changes take effect.</p> Information about us and our service<p>PayPal\u2019s main business is the issuance of electronic money and the provision of payment services using that electronic money.</p>\n<p>For more information about us and our service, you can read our Key Payment and Service Information.</p>\n<p>This user agreement, together with other legal terms and legally required disclosures relating to your use of our service will be made available to you at all times on the PayPal website (typically located on the \u201cLegal Agreements\u201d page).\nWe may also send this information to you.</p>\n<p>You may request a copy of any legally required disclosures (including this user agreement and the Key Payment and Service Information) from us and we will provide this to you in a form which allows you to store and reproduce the information (for example, by e-mail).\n</p> Opening an account <p>We offer two types of accounts: personal accounts and business accounts.</p>Personal accounts<p>With a personal account you can send and request money from friends and family and pay online for purchases.</p>\n<p>Holders of certain existing personal accounts may be required to upgrade their accounts (which may include providing further information to PayPal) in order to be able to use all of the current functionality available in a personal account.\n</p>\n<p>To use your PayPal account primarily to sell things, you must open a business account or convert your personal account to a business account.</p>Business accounts <p>Business accounts are for people and organisations (whether incorporated or not) that primarily use PayPal to receive online payments for sales or donations.</p>\n<p>Business accounts may be subject to fees that differ from the fees applicable to personal accounts.\nSee our Fees for further details.</p>\n<strong>\n<p>By opening a business account or converting a personal account to a business account, you certify to us that you are using it primarily for a business or commercial purpose.\n</p>\n</strong> Commercial Entity Status <p>If the activity through your business account reaches certain thresholds or involves certain business segments or activities, you are required by the card networks to agree to Commercial Entity Agreements directly with our processing partners to allow you to continue accepting card-funded payments.\nIn this case, these Commercial Entity Agreements will apply to any payment processed by PayPal on your behalf in addition to this user agreement.\n</p> Safe use of your PayPal account <p>You should take reasonable steps to stop your PayPal account being misused.\nYou must maintain adequate security and control of any and all devices, items, IDs, passwords and personal identification numbers / codes that you use to access your PayPal account and the PayPal services.\nPlease see our Key Payment and Service Information for guidelines.\n</p>\n<p>You must comply with all reasonable instructions we may issue regarding how you can keep your Payment Instrument safe.</p>\n<p>We may require you to authenticate any instruction relating to your account (i.e.\ngive us the information that we need to be sure that it\u2019s you giving us the instruction, such as submitting your correct log-in information \u2013 this could include your e-mail address and password) and otherwise successfully log into your PayPal account to provide to us your instruction.</p>\n<p>You must keep your postal address, email address and other contact information current in your PayPal account profile.</p>\n<p>You may expressly grant, remove and manage permissions for some third parties to take certain actions on your behalf.\nIn some cases you can do this when logged into your account \u2013 in other cases you can do this directly with the third party.\nYou acknowledge that if you grant permission for a third party to take actions on your behalf, we may disclose certain information about your Account to this third party.</p>\n<p>You may permit third party service providers licensed by applicable law to: </p>\n<ul>\n<li>provide account information services to access information about your account on your behalf;</li>\n<li>confirm whether an amount necessary for the execution of a card-based payment transaction is available on your account.\nor</li>\n<li>provide payment initiation services to initiate payments from your account on your behalf.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Granting permission to any third party to access your account in any way does not relieve you of any of your responsibilities under this user agreement.\nYou are liable to us for the actions that you authorise the third parties to carry out.\nYou will not hold us responsible for, and you will indemnify us from, any liability arising from the actions or inactions of such third parties in connection with the permissions you granted, subject to your mandatory legal rights.</p> Closing Your PayPal Account <p>\n<strong>You can close your account at any time.</strong> See the PayPal Help Centre for how to do this.</p>\n<p>We may close your account at our convenience by providing you with two months\u2019 prior notice.\nWe may also close your account at any time if:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>you are in breach of this user agreement and/or we are otherwise entitled to close your account under this user agreement;</li>\n<li>you do not access your account for three years.\nor</li>\n<li>we suspect that your account has been accessed without your authorisation.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Where we decide to close your account we will provide you with notice of account closure and where practicable, the reasons for closing your account, together with the ability to withdraw any undisputed funds that we are holding.</p>\n<p>When your account is closed:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>this user agreement terminates immediately, except that this user agreement survives termination to the extent and for so long as we require to deal with the closure of your account and to comply with applicable laws and regulations;</li>\n<li>we may cancel any pending transactions and you will forfeit any balances associated with special funding arrangements;</li>\n<li>we may suspend, limit or terminate your access to or use of our services, websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the services) operated by us or on our behalf or some or all of the services;</li>\n<li>you will remain liable for all outstanding obligations under this user agreement related to your account prior to closure;</li>\n<li>we may keep your account information in our database for the purpose of fulfilling our legal obligations.\nand</li>\n<li>we may retain your electronic money after closure to the extent and for the time we reasonably require to protect us and/or any third party against the risk of reversals, fees, fines, penalties and other liabilities of whatever nature.\nAfter this time you will be able to withdraw any undisputed funds that we are holding.\nPlease Contact Us if you have any questions about funds held in your account on closure.<br>\n<strong>If you are the legal representative of an incapacitated or deceased account holder, please Contact Us for assistance.</strong>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>In the event that we decide to discontinue any of our services or any portion or feature of our services for any reason, we will give you at least two months prior notice before discontinuing the service or feature, unless we determine in good faith that: </p>\n<ul>\n<li>the service or feature must be discontinued sooner as required by law or a third-party relationship.\nor </li>\n<li>doing so could create a security risk or substantial economic or material technical burden.</li>\n</ul> Linking and Unlinking a Funding Source <p>All money in your account is legally termed \u201celectronic money\u201d, which is recognised throughout the European Economic Area as a form of money suitable for use online.\n</p>\n<p>You can use a funding source as a way to pay us to obtain electronic money in your account or to receive withdrawals from your account, as further outlined in this user agreement (see in particular Adding or Withdrawing Money and Funding your Payment.\n</p>\n<p>You can link or unlink a credit card, debit card, a prepaid card (where available) a bank account or PayPal Credit (where available) to your PayPal account as a funding source.\n</p>\n<p>We may limit the availability of your funding sources to manage our risk.</p>\n<p>Please keep your funding source information current (e.g.\ncredit card number and expiration date).\nIf this information changes, we may update it using information and third-party sources available to us without any action on your part.\nIf you do not want us to update your card information, you may contact your issuer to request this or remove your funding source from your PayPal account.\nIf we update your funding source, we will keep any preference setting attached to that funding source.\nYou may choose to confirm your card or bank account, so that we can verify that the card or bank account is valid and that you are its owner.\nWe may allow you to do this by following the Link and Confirm Card process (for cards) or the Bank Confirmation process (for bank accounts) or other processes which we may notify to you or which we may publish from time to time.</p>Your continuous permission for us to charge your funding sources <p>By linking a funding source to your PayPal account, you give us continuous permission to automatically charge that funding source (subject to this user agreement and the terms of any mandate (e.g.\nbank direct debit) used by the provider of that funding source to set up and maintain that authority) for the required value of the electronic money:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>to cover the payment amount (plus all transaction fees payable to us) when you use your account to send a payment to another user.\nand</li>\n<li>to top up your account when you use the Add Funds functionality account interface.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may charge the funding source again if the previous attempt failed.\nIf you cancel any continuous permission from your funding source, you will reimburse us for the value of any electronic money we\u2019ve already issued for which a charge from that funding source remains outstanding.\n</p>\n<p>You can stop the permission by unlinking the funding source from your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>SEPA is an initiative of the European Commission and European banking sector, aimed at making transactions more efficient within the European Union.\nWhenever you register a bank account with PayPal or use a new bank account for the first time as a Funding Source, you grant PayPal a SEPA Direct Debit mandate.\nIf you use a SEPA Direct Debit mandate for the continuous authority:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>you can access the mandate and the mandate reference number (MRN) in your PayPal account profile at any time and cancel or change the mandate for future transactions.</li>\n<li>PayPal will inform you of the amount of the SEPA Direct Debit payment and the time frame in which PayPal will collect the amount from the bank account together with the purchase confirmation.\nIf PayPal resubmits any SEPA Direct Debit payment request due to reversal of the original payment, there will be no (additional) information given on the amount and the time frame ahead of the resubmission.</li>\n<li>you can claim a refund from your bank at any time up to 8 weeks after the date on which the SEPA Direct Debit payment took place in accordance with your bank\u2019s terms and conditions.</li>\n</ul> Risk of reversals to your funding source and when eCheques may arise <p>When we receive a payment from your funding source we may store the resulting electronic money in your reserve account for as long as we have reason to believe that there is risk of reversal by the funding source provider.\nThis is because we do not have all the information necessary to place the funds from your payment at your disposal in your PayPal balance while there is such a risk of reversal.\n</p>\n<p>When you instruct us to make a payment from your account to another user funded by a payment from your bank account and we store the resulting electronic money in this way, we call this type of payment from your bank account an \u201ceCheque\u201d payment.\nSee Funding payments you send from your account below for how we use eCheques.</p> Holding and using a PayPal balance <p>You will not receive interest or any other earnings on the money in your account.\nThis is because the money in your account is electronic money and European law forbids paying interest on electronic money.\nAlso, electronic money is not a deposit or an investment under Luxembourg law, so the Luxembourg deposit guarantee or investor indemnity schemes administered by the <i>Conseil des Protection des Deposants et des Investisseurs</i> cannot protect you.</p>\n<p>We may store and move the money in your account in and between:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>the PayPal balance.\nand </li>\n<li>the reserve account, </li>\n</ul>\n<p>at any given time subject further to this user agreement.</p>PayPal balance <p>The operational part of your account contains your PayPal balance, which is the balance of money available for payments or withdrawals.\n</p>\n<p>When you use our payment service to pay another user, you instruct us to transfer the money from your PayPal balance to the recipient\u2019s account.\n</p>\n<p>You need to have enough PayPal balance in cleared funds to cover the amount of any payment you make and the transaction fees you owe us at the time of the payment.\nOther requirements also apply \u2013 see the section Making a Payment below.\nIf you have insufficient PayPal balance or have chosen a preferred funding source you are also requesting us to obtain funds on your behalf from your applicable funding source and issue electronic money to your PayPal balance for your payment to be made.</p>\n<p>When you withdraw your money you need to have enough PayPal balance to cover the value of any withdrawal at the time of the withdrawal.</p>\n<p>See Adding or Withdrawing Money to know how to get a PayPal balance and how to withdraw it.</p>\n<p>If your PayPal balance shows a negative amount, this is the net amount you owe to us at the given time.\n</p> Reserve account <p>Money marked in your account overview as \u201cpending\u201d, \u201cuncleared\u201d, \u201cheld\u201d or otherwise restricted or limited at any given time is held in the part of your account which acts as a reserve account.\nYou cannot access and use money stored in the reserve account.</p> Adding or Withdrawing Money Adding money <p>To get electronic money into your account you can, subject further to this user agreement:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>accept a payment in your account from someone else.\nWe may charge you fees for this.\nor</li>\n<li>obtain electronic money from us by paying us an equivalent amount.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You can obtain electronic money from us by:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>automatically using your applicable funding source(s) to cover the amount of the payments that you instruct us to send to other users (and the transaction fees payable by you to us)..\nor</li>\n<li>manually using the \u201cAdd Funds\u201d function available from your account interface to pay us or instructing us to charge your funding source for the electronic money.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The execution of any payment to us from your funding source provider is your funding source provider\u2019s legal responsibility.\nWe have no control over how long the payment to us will take.</p>Withdrawing money <p>If you have a PayPal balance, you may withdraw any amount by transferring it to your nominated funding source linked to your PayPal account, as we may allow from time to time.\nThis could include your bank account or debit or credit card, depending on the country in which your PayPal account is registered.</p>\n<p>When you instruct us to withdraw any amount of your PayPal balance, subject further to this user agreement we will:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>convert the electronic money to money that we can transfer to your nominated funding source.\nand </li>\n<li>instruct our own bank to transfer that money to your nominated funding source.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We aim to send the withdrawal payment instruction to our bank by the end of the next Business Day (\u201cBusiness Day\u201d means a day on which banks in Luxembourg are open to the general public).\nif there are no other delays subject to this user agreement.\nOnce our bank receives our payment instruction, we have no control over how long the payment to you will take to complete.\nAt this point, our bank, your funding source provider and the payment systems that they rely on take over responsibility for getting the money to your nominated funding source and this can affect the time it takes for you to receive your money.\nWe may allow you to withdraw the money by transferring the money to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>an eligible bank account (where we make this available) through: <ul>\n<li>a standard transfer to your bank account linked to your account (this withdrawal/redemption functionality is sometimes known as \u201ctransfer to bank\u201d).\nor</li>\n<li>an Instant Transfer to your bank account linked to your account.\n<br>\n<br> We may allow the above transfers to be made through the debit card attached to that bank account.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>your branded MasterCard or Visa card (where we make this available).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Fees apply to withdrawals.\nWe will also disclose to you the fees in advance each time you initiate such a withdrawal.</p>\n<p>The funding source (for example, bank account or card) into which you request the withdrawal must be denominated in the original opening currency of your account or another currency that PayPal supports for withdrawals in your country of residence.</p>\n<p>You may only withdraw PayPal balance in the opening currency of your account, unless we agree otherwise.\nIn order to withdraw PayPal balance held in another currency you will have to convert the currency to the opening currency of your account, or it will be converted for you at the time of your withdrawal.\nOur transaction exchange rate will be used.</p>\n<p>This means that if you withdraw:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>a PayPal balance held in a currency other than the original opening currency of your account, you will be charged a fee for the conversion into your original opening currency.\nand</li>\n<li>to a funding source (for example, bank account or card) denominated in a currency other than the original opening currency of your account, you will be charged a fee for the conversion into the currency in which the funding source is denominated.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>To protect you, our other users and us from loss and to allow us to comply with our anti-money laundering and other legal obligations, we may delay a withdrawal, in certain situations, including if we need to confirm that you have authorised the withdrawal or if payments to your PayPal account have been subject to a reversal (for example, as a result of a chargeback, bank reversal or dispute by a buyer).\nIf we place a limitation on your PayPal account, a payment is subject to a hold, or your account or an associated account has a negative balance in any currency while a withdrawal from your PayPal account is pending, you will have to reinitiate the withdrawal once the limitation or hold has been lifted, or negative balance is fully paid off.</p>\n<p>We may set limits on your withdrawals, and you can view any withdrawal limit by logging into your PayPal account.\nYou must follow the steps that we will notify to you or publish from time to time (which we may set out in your account overview) to lift your withdrawal limit.</p> Managing Your Money in Multiple Currencies <p>When you open your account, it is configured for use with the opening currency of your account.\n</p>\n<p>The opening currency of your account is Euro (EUR).\n</p>\n<p>We may configure your account further so that you can use it to store money and send and receive payments in currencies other than the opening currency of your account.\nIf you hold a PayPal balance, we may allow you to convert it to balance in another currency.\n</p>\n<p> If your PayPal balance is not enough to cover the amount of a payment you instruct us to make in a particular currency, we may perform a currency conversion from any PayPal balance in another currency to cover the shortfall.\nThere may be some restrictions on where you can send payments in certain currencies.\n</p>\n<p> We may allow you to choose the way in which your account treats and/or converts payments received in currencies other than the opening currency of your account.\nTo receive money in a currency other than the opening currency of your account, it may be necessary to create a balance in that currency or convert the money into another currency that we allow you to hold.\n</p>\n<p> Payments in certain currencies can only be received by automatic conversion of the money into another currency that we allow you to hold.\n</p>\n<p> If you receive a payment from anyone who doesn\u2019t have a PayPal account and that payment is in a currency which your account is not currently configured to use, we may automatically convert the amount received into a currency that your account is configured to use at the time the payment is made.\n</p>\n<p> Please see the Withdrawing Money section above to see how withdrawals in different currencies can be made.\n</p>\n<p> If one of the currency balances in your account shows that you owe us an amount of funds for any reason, we may set off the amount you owe us by using funds you maintain in a different currency balance or by deducting amounts you owe us from money you receive into your account, or money you attempt to withdraw or send from your account, or in a different account, and by deducting funds from any withdrawals you attempt to make.\nIf, for a period of 21 Days, you have a PayPal balance that reflects an amount owing to us that is not in Euros, we may convert the amount you owe us to Euros.\n</p>\n<p> We may, at our discretion, impose limits on the amount of money you can convert or the number of conversions you can perform.\nYou are responsible for all risks associated with maintaining multiple currencies in a PayPal account.\nYou may not manage or convert currencies for speculative trading purposes, conversion arbitrage, conversion options, or any other activity that we determine is primarily for the purpose of gaining or making money based on currency conversion rates.\nWe may hold, cancel, or reverse any transaction we determine to violate this policy.\n</p>How we convert currency <p>If PayPal converts currency, it will be completed at the transaction exchange rate we set for the relevant currency exchange.\n</p>\n<p> The transaction exchange rate is adjusted regularly and includes a currency conversion fee applied and retained by us on a base exchange rate to form the rate applicable to your conversion.\nThe base exchange rate is based on rates within the wholesale currency markets on the conversion day or the prior Business Day.\nor, if required by law or regulation, set at the relevant government reference rate(s).\n</p>\n<p> We may make a transaction exchange rate (including our currency conversion fee) available for your review during your transaction.\nIf you complete the transaction, that transaction exchange rate may apply to the payment for the transaction whenever it is processed.\nor that rate may be valid only if the payment for that transaction is processed within a limited time, as stated during the transaction.\nAfter that limited time, we may use the transaction exchange rate in effect at the time the transaction is processed, or not perform the currency conversion.\n</p>\n<p> If you have authorised a payment under a billing agreement, and we perform currency conversion for that payment, we will use the transaction exchange rate in effect at the time the payment transaction is processed.\nThe transaction exchange rate for each payment under a billing agreement may vary.\n</p>\n<p> We may provide you access to a \u201cCurrency Converter\u201d tool to see what transaction exchange rate (including our currency conversion fee) may apply for certain currency conversions.\nAny rates shown using the Currency Converter tool only apply at the time you use the tool and are subject to change.</p> Currency conversion choices <p>When your payment is funded by a debit or credit card and PayPal determines currency conversion is necessary, you consent to and authorise us to convert the currency in place of your debit or credit card issuer.\n</p>\n<p> You may have the right to have your card issuer convert the currency of the card payment into the currency in which you send the payment from your PayPal account, if applicable for that card issuer and network.\nThis selection may be presented to you in various forms, including a choice of which currency is used for the transaction, whether we or your card issuer performs the conversion, or which conversion rate is used for the transaction, among others.\nIf your card issuer converts the currency, your card issuer will determine the currency conversion rate and what fees they may charge.\n</p>\n<p> PayPal will always perform the conversion for transactions where you use existing balance or your linked bank account is the funding source.\n</p>\n<p> If PayPal determines currency conversion is necessary for a transaction that also requires a backup funding source to be chosen, you may not be able to separately choose whether PayPal or your card issuer performs the currency conversion on the payment from your backup funding source.\n</p>\n<p> Where a currency conversion is offered at the point of sale by the merchant, not by PayPal, and you choose to authorise the payment transaction on the basis of the merchant's exchange rate and charges, PayPal has no liability to you for that currency conversion.\n</p> Account Statements and Requesting Account Records <p>Unless your Account is restricted you may view and download your PayPal account statement by logging into your PayPal account.\nYou agree to review your transactions through your PayPal account history instead of receiving periodic statements by email.\n</p>\n<p>Key information relating to your payments will be provided to you via e-mail and your transaction history will also be updated and made available to you at any time by logging into your account.\nYou can also access a downloadable report from your PayPal account.\nThis will show all fees incurred and any other amounts charged to your PayPal account in the relevant period.\nThe report will only be updated and made available if there has been any activity on your PayPal account or any fees have been incurred in the relevant period.\nThe way in which we provide the transaction information will allow you to store and reproduce the information unchanged, for example by printing a copy.\n</p>\n<p> We reserve the right to charge a fee for providing you with additional information or for providing the transaction history and other information about fees in a different way but we won\u2019t charge you for records requested in connection with your good-faith assertion of an error in your PayPal account.</p> Fees <p> We charge fees for our services as set out on the fees page.\n</p>\n<p> Quoted fees are inclusive of all applicable taxes.\nhowever, other taxes or costs may exist that are not paid through or imposed by us.\n</p>\n<p> You are liable for telephone charges and any charges made by your internet service provider or similar or associated charges as a result of the use by you of our services.\n</p>\n<p> We may deduct our fees from your PayPal balance.\nWe may deduct our transaction-related fees from the amounts we transfer before those funds are credited to your PayPal balance.\n</p>\n<p> We will provide you with the details of the amounts you receive and our fees charged either by e-mail or in your transaction history (which you can access by logging into your account).\n</p>\n<p> If your payment requires you to pay a fee to us, we may disclose that fee to you when you provide your payment instruction to us.\n</p>\n<p> You cannot set off or deduct any amounts from our fees.\n</p>\n<p> We may make a charge for any additional services we provide outside this user agreement.\nWe will tell you of those charges when you ask for the service.\n</p>\n<p>If you are a merchant and you wish to apply for (and retain) our volume-based tiered merchant rate, the terms of the merchant rate in the Receiving Payments section below apply.</p> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nMaking A Payment General provisions for making a payment Your payment instruction <p>We may allow you to provide your payment instruction to us in any way which we may notify to you from time to time.\nThe way in which you provide your payment instruction can depend on the type of payment you are making \u2013 for example:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>If you are paying for a purchase or making a donation, many sellers and/or fund collectors allow you to provide your payment instruction to us in a dedicated PayPal checkout or other PayPal payment collection integration on their site.</li>\n<li>You can use the \u201cSend Money\u201d feature when you log into your PayPal account to send a payment to someone.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p> We may require you to authenticate your instruction (i.e.\ngive us the information that we need to be sure that it\u2019s you giving us the instruction, such as submitting your correct log-in information \u2013 this could include your e-mail address and password) and otherwise successfully log into your PayPal account to provide to us your payment instruction.\n</p> Cancelling your payment instruction <p> Once you provide you payment instruction to us, you may not cancel it, except if it is a payment instruction under a billing agreement (see below for more details).\n</p> How long will my payment take? <p>Your payment to another user will leave your account [within the Business Day] after we receive your complete payment instruction.</p>\n<p>The payment will leave your account within two Business Days if we receive your complete payment instruction:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>on a day which is not a Business Day.\nor</li>\n<li>after the following local cut off times on a Business Day for accounts registered in the following countries: 4pm in Netherlands.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may allow you to ask us to make your payment on a specific later date, in which case your payment will leave your account on that later date.</p>\n<p>Other provisions in this user agreement may cause the above timeframes to be extended.</p>When we may refuse to make your payment <p>We may treat your payment instruction as not complete and we may refuse to make your payment if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>you do not have enough money in your PayPal balance.\n</li>\n<li>we have reason to believe that your linked funding sources do not have sufficient funds to cover the money required to make your payment;</li>\n<li>you do not provide us with all mandatory information requested in the relevant payment or checkout flows which we use to obtain your payment instructions (for instance, sufficient details of the recipient as we may request and authentication of your payment instruction);</li>\n<li>the payment exceeds the sending limit we tell you about when you try to make the payment.\nor</li>\n<li>we have reason to believe that a restricted activity has happened in relation to your account or you are otherwise in breach of this user agreement.\n</li>\n</ul> When your payment is not accepted by the recipient <p> If we allow you to send a payment to someone who does not have a PayPal account, the recipient can claim the money by opening a PayPal account.\n</p>\n<p> If the recipient already has a PayPal account, they can refuse to accept the money.\n</p>\n<p> If the recipient refuses to accept the money or doesn\u2019t open a PayPal account and claim the money within 30 days after the date it is sent, the money (including any fees you were charged) will be refunded to your PayPal account.\nSee Refunds to your account for what can happen when your PayPal account receives a refund.\n</p> Sending limits <p> We may, at our discretion, impose limits on the amount and value of payments you can make, including money you send for purchases.\nYou can view any sending limit by logging into your PayPal account.\nTo lift your sending limit, you must follow the steps that we will notify to you or publish from time to time (which we may set out in your account overview).</p> Setting up automatic charges from your account Seller delayed payments <p> When you pay certain sellers or pay for certain purchases (for instance, purchases which have to be shipped to you or may be updated and finalised by the seller), you are providing: </p>\n<ul>\n<li>an authorisation to the seller to collect your payment at a later time.\nand</li>\n<li>an instruction to us to automatically pay that seller when the seller requests payment.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> Your authorisation will typically remain valid for up to 30 days, but may remain valid for longer.\nIf you have balance, we may hold the payment amount as pending until the seller collects your payment.\nIf your payment requires a currency conversion by us, the transaction exchange rate will be determined and applied (as described in the Currency Conversion section) at the time the payment is processed.\n</p>\n<p> Your authorisation allows the seller to update the payment amount before the seller collects the payment (to account for any changes to the purchase that you may agree with the seller, such as additional taxes, shipping or postage charges or discounts).\nWe are not required to verify any changes at any time (including at the time the payment is transferred).\nWe may transfer any amount on the basis of your authorisation and upon receiving instructions from the seller of the final payment amount.\n</p> Billing agreement payments <p> You can use a billing agreement to manage payments to the same recipient(s) on an ongoing automatic basis.\nWhen you enter into a billing agreement:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>you authorise the named recipient(s) to collect payments from your account as the recipient determines (this could be for payments of amounts you owe the recipient for a purchase of goods or services under a separate contract that you have with the recipient).\nand</li>\n<li>you instruct PayPal to pay the named recipient(s) (or other recipient(s) that the named recipient(s) direct(s)) when the named recipient(s) request(s) PayPal to make your payment.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>This makes the recipient a \u201ctrusted beneficiary\u201d (the legal term for someone you tell us is a trusted recipient) of all your payments made under that billing agreement, so we will not normally ask you to authenticate (e.g.\nlog in) or approve these payments when they are made.\n</p>\n<p> Payments made under the billing agreement may be in variable amounts and may be made on various dates.\nWe are only a payment service provider so we can\u2019t (and please don\u2019t expect us to) know what you have or haven\u2019t agreed with the recipient or to know why the recipient decided to collect your payment.\nWe are not obliged to verify or confirm the amount the recipient presents to us for the purpose of processing payments made under the billing agreement.\n</p>\n<p> We use several names for payments that can be managed by a billing agreement \u2013 these include \u201cautomatic payments,\u201d \"subscription payments\" \"recurring payments\u201d \u201creference transactions\u201d \"preauthorised transfers\" or \"preapproved payment.\" </p>\n<p> You can cancel your billing agreement at any time with immediate effect in your account interface or by contacting us.\nWhere a payment under that billing agreement is scheduled to be made before the end of the next Business Day after you tell us to cancel it, we may cancel your billing agreement after that payment has been made.\nIf you cancel a billing agreement, you may still owe the recipient money for goods or services that you have received but have not paid for.\n</p>\n<p> If we determine currency conversion is necessary for a billing agreement payment, and we perform the conversion, we will use the transaction exchange rate (including our currency conversion fee) in effect at the time the payment is processed.\nThe transaction exchange rate for each payment transaction may vary.\n</p> Refunds to your account How refunds can happen <p> We may allow the recipient of your payment to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>refuse to accept it.\nor</li>\n<li>decide to accept it and then use our service to send you a refund of all or any part of the amount of the payment later.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p> We will return the amount of any refused payment or refunded payment to your Balance.\nWe will return the amount of an unclaimed payment to your balance within 30 days after the date you initiated the payment.\nIf any amount of any payment is returned to you in any of the ways outlined above, we may convert the returned amount for you into either: </p>\n<ul>\n<li>the currency of the balance you used for the original payment (before any conversion into the currency received by the recipient happened);</li>\n<li>the opening currency of your account.\nor</li>\n<li>US dollars (opening a balance in that currency for you, if you don\u2019t have one already).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If the original payment you sent involved a currency conversion we will convert the returned amount from the currency received by the recipient as follows:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>if the amount is returned within 1 day of the date of the original payment we will use the transaction exchange rate applicable on the date of the original payment, so that you receive the original amount (including the currency conversion fee you paid) in the original currency you converted for the original payment.\nand</li>\n<li>if the amount is returned after 1 day of the date of the original payment we will use the transaction exchange rate applicable at the time of the conversion of the returned amount.\nYou agree to bear the currency conversion fee for amounts returned to you as refunds or refused payments.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Unless otherwise outlined above in this section, you agree to bear the currency conversion fee for amounts returned to you as refunds or refused payments when you convert any amount returned to you in the ways outlined above.\nThe transaction exchange rate may be applied immediately and without notice to you.\n</p>\n<p> We may also automatically withdraw the returned amount from your Balance and transfer the funds back to the funding source you used for the original payment.\nWithdrawals can also involve a currency conversion \u2013 see the section on Withdrawing money above.\n</p>Risks when receiving refunds <p> The returned amount could be lower in value than your original payment amount.\nThis can happen as a result of:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>the recipient sending you a refund lower in value than your original payment amount.\nAs we are only a payment service provider, we cannot know what you are entitled to from the original payment recipient as a refund or why the recipient sent the refund in a particular amount.\nor</li>\n<li>transaction exchange rate fluctuations.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>PayPal is not responsible for any loss resulting from the recipient's decision to refuse or refund your payment, except to the extent that a refund sent by the recipient is a payment executed incorrectly by PayPal </p>\n<p>We are not liable to you for the difference between the value of your original payment and the value of the resulting refund, except to the extent that the refund is an incorrect payment (see the section on Resolving Problems).\n</p> Funding Your Payment Selecting a preferred funding source <p>You may select a preferred funding source when logged into your account.\nSubject to this user agreement, the preferred funding source will be used as the default funding source for payments you send from your account.</p>\n<p> You can set separate preferred funding sources for some billing agreement payments.\n</p> Special Funding Arrangements <p> Some payments can be funded by special funding arrangements linked to your PayPal account, such as merchant/transaction specific balance, gift vouchers or other promotional funding arrangements.\nThe use and priority of these special funding arrangements are subject to further terms and conditions between you and us.\nYour account overview may show the notional amount available in your special funding arrangements to fund qualifying payments at any given time.\nThis amount does not constitute electronic money, is not deemed part of your PayPal balance and is not redeemable in cash - it only represents the amount of electronic money which we offer to issue and credit to your account at the time of (and only to immediately fund) a qualifying payment, subject to (and only for the period outlined in) the further terms and conditions of use of that special funding arrangement.\nIf your payment funded by a special funding arrangement is reversed at a later time for any reason, we will keep the amount that represents the portion of that payment that was funded by your special funding arrangement and (provided that the special funding arrangement has not already expired) reinstate the special funding arrangement.</p> Funding payments you send from your account <p> We will obtain electronic money for the payment you send from your account from the following sources in the following order to the extent they are available:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Special Funding Arrangements (if available for the given transaction)</li>\n<li>Preferred funding source (if selected and available)</li>\n<li>Pre-existing PayPal balance</li>\n<li>Bank account (instant transfer via bank mandate)</li>\n<li>PayPal Credit (where available)</li>\n<li>PayPal-branded debit card (where available)</li>\n<li>PayPal-branded credit card (where available)</li>\n<li>Debit card</li>\n<li>Credit card</li>\n<li>Bank account (eCheque) </li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you have linked a bank account as a funding source we may choose to offer you access to Pay After Delivery, which allows you to defer a charge to this bank account for a period of time.\nIf you are offered and choose to use this service, the Pay After Delivery Terms will apply.</p> PayPal Buyer Protection <p>When you buy something from a seller who accepts PayPal, you may be eligible for a refund under PayPal Buyer Protection.\nWhen applicable, PayPal Buyer Protection program entitles you to reimbursement for the full purchase price of the item plus the original shipping costs you paid, if any.\nPayPal determines, in its sole discretion, whether your claim qualifies for PayPal Buyer Protection.\nPayPal\u2019s original determination is considered final, but you may be able to file an appeal of the decision with PayPal if you have new or compelling information not available at the time of the original determination or you believe there was an error in the decision-making process.</p>\n<p>IMPORTANT: You may be required to return the item to the seller or other party we specify as part of the settlement of your claim.\nPayPal Buyer Protection does not entitle you to reimbursement for the return shipping costs that you may incur.</p>\n<p>PayPal Buyer Protection program may apply when you encounter these specific problems with a transaction:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You didn\u2019t receive your item from a seller (referred to as an \u201cItem Not Received\u201d claim), or</li>\n<li>You received an item, but the item isn\u2019t what you ordered (referred to as a \u201cSignificantly Not as Described\u201d claim).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you believe that a transaction made through your PayPal account was not authorized by you, this type of claim is different from the PayPal Buyer Protection, and is described below under Liability for Unauthorized Transactions and Other Errors.</p> QR Code Transactions <p>If you buy something from a seller in-person by using a PayPal goods and services QR, your transaction may be eligible for PayPal Buyer Protection.</p>Item Not Received claims <p>Your claim <em>\n<strong>will not</strong>\n</em> qualify for a refund under PayPal Buyer Protection for an Item Not Received claim, if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You collect the item in person, or arrange for it to be collected on your behalf, including if you use PayPal in a seller\u2019s retail point of sale, except for in-person PayPal QR code goods and services transactions or</li>\n<li>The seller has provided proof of delivery.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If the seller presents evidence that they delivered the goods to you, PayPal may find in favor of the seller for an Item Not Received claim even if you claim you did not receive the goods.</p> Significantly Not as Described claims <p>An item may be considered Significantly Not as Described if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The item is materially different from the seller\u2019s description of it.</li>\n<li>You received a completely different item.</li>\n<li>The condition of the item was misrepresented.\nFor example, the item was described as \u201cnew\u201d but the item was used.</li>\n<li>The item was advertised as authentic but is not authentic (i.e.\ncounterfeit).</li>\n<li>The item is missing major parts or features and those facts were not disclosed in the description of the item when you bought it.</li>\n<li>You purchased a certain number of items but didn\u2019t receive them all.</li>\n<li>The item was damaged during shipment.</li>\n<li>The item is unusable in its received state and was not disclosed as such.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>An item may not be considered Significantly Not as Described if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The defect in the item was correctly described by the seller in its description of the item.</li>\n<li>The item was properly described but you didn't want it after you received it.</li>\n<li>The item was properly described but did not meet your expectations.</li>\n<li>The item has minor scratches and was described as \u201cused.\"</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Ineligible items and transactions under PayPal Buyer Protection <p>Payments for the following are not eligible for reimbursement under PayPal Buyer Protection:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Real estate, including residential property.</li>\n<li>Financial products or investments of any kind.</li>\n<li>Businesses (when you buy or invest in a business).</li>\n<li>Vehicles, including, but not limited to, motor vehicles, motorcycles, recreational vehicles, aircraft and boats, except for personally portable light vehicles used for recreational purposes like bicycles and wheeled hoverboards.</li>\n<li>Significantly Not as Described claims for wholly or partly custom-made items or items picked up in person.</li>\n<li>Donations including payments on crowdfunding platforms, as well as payments made on crowdlending platforms.</li>\n<li>Items prohibited by the PayPal&nbsp;<strong>Acceptable Use Policy</strong>.</li>\n<li>For Item Not Received claims, items which you collect in person or arrange to be collected on your behalf, including items bought in a seller\u2019s retail point of sale, , except for in-person PayPal QR code goods and services transactions.</li>\n<li>Industrial machinery used in manufacturing.</li>\n<li>Payments to state-run bodies, (except for state-owned enterprises) or traders acting on mandates received from state-run bodies.</li>\n<li>Payment equivalent to cash, including stored value items such as gift cards and pre-paid cards.&nbsp;</li>\n<li>Gambling, gaming and/or any other activity with an entry fee and a prize.</li>\n<li>Personal Payments.&nbsp;</li>\n<li>Payments made using PayPal Payouts and Mass Pay&nbsp.\ni.e.\nnot sent using your PayPal account.</li>\n<li>Items intended for resale, including single item transactions or transactions that include multiple items.</li>\n<li>Payments made in respect of gold (whether in physical form or in exchange-traded form).</li>\n</ul> Transaction eligibility for PayPal Buyer Protection <p>To be eligible for PayPal Buyer Protection you must meet all of the following requirements:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Have a PayPal account in good standing.</li>\n<li>Pay for the eligible item from your PayPal account.</li>\n<li>Attempt to contact the seller to resolve your issue directly before filing a claim under PayPal\u2019s Purchase Protection through the Resolution Center.</li>\n<li>Respond to PayPal's request for documentation and other information within the time requested.</li>\n<li>Open a dispute in the Resolution Center within 180 days of the date you sent the payment, then follow our online dispute resolution process.</li>\n<li>Not have received a recovery related to such purchase from another source.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Our online dispute resolution process <p>If you\u2019re unable to resolve a transaction related issue directly with a seller, you must follow our online dispute resolution process through the&nbsp;<strong>Resolution Center</strong>&nbsp;to pursue a claim under our PayPal Buyer Protection.\nYou may also file a claim (Step 2 below) by calling us and speaking to an agent.\nThe steps you must follow are described below, and if you do not follow these steps your claim may be denied:</p>\n<p>Step 1: <strong>Open a dispute</strong> within&nbsp;180 days&nbsp;of the date you made the payment.\nThis might allow you to start a direct conversation with the seller regarding your issue with the transaction that may help resolve the dispute.\nIf you are unable to resolve the dispute directly with the seller, proceed to Step 2.\nWe will place a hold on all funds related to the transaction in the seller's PayPal&nbsp;account until the dispute is resolved or closed.</p>\n<p>Step 2: <strong>Escalate the dispute to a claim</strong> for reimbursement within 20 days&nbsp;after opening the dispute, if you and the seller are unable to come to an agreement, or we will automatically close the dispute.\nYou can escalate the dispute to a claim for reimbursement through the <strong>Resolution Center</strong>.\nThe seller or PayPal may also escalate the dispute to a claim at this point.\nIf you are making an Item Not Received claim, PayPal may ask you to wait at least 7 days from the transaction date to escalate the dispute.</p>\n<p>Step 3:&nbsp;<strong>Respond to PayPal\u2019s requests for documentation or other information</strong>, after you, the seller or PayPal escalates your dispute to a claim for reimbursement.\nPayPal may require you to provide receipts, third party evaluations, police reports or other documents that PayPal specifies.\nYou must respond to these requests in a timely manner as requested in our correspondence with you.</p>\n<p>Step 4:&nbsp;<strong>Comply with PayPal\u2019s shipping requests in a timely manner</strong>, if you\u2019re filing a Significantly Not as Described claim.\nPayPal may require you, at your expense, to ship the item&nbsp;back to the seller, to PayPal or to a third party (which will be specified by PayPal) and to provide Proof of Delivery.</p>\n<p>Step 5:&nbsp;<strong>PayPal will make a final decision&nbsp;</strong>(including automatically closing any dispute or claim), in its sole discretion, based on the coverage and eligibility requirements set forth above, any additional information provided during the online dispute resolution process or any other information PayPal deems relevant and appropriate under the circumstances.</p> Event tickets <p>In certain cases, if you purchase a ticket or pay for the right to attend an event from a payment recipient who is a UK registered PayPal account holder (\u201cEvent\u201d), all monies paid by you may be held by PayPal on trust for you, so that the beneficial interest in such monies remains with you until the performance of the Event in question.</p>Dispute with us or your card issuer <p>If you used a debit or credit card as the payment method for a transaction through your PayPal account and you are dissatisfied with the transaction, you may be entitled to dispute the transaction with your card issuer.\nApplicable card chargeback rights may be broader than those available to you under PayPal\u2019s Buyer Protection.\nFor example, if you dispute a transaction with your card issuer, you may be able to recover amounts you paid for unsatisfactory items even if they don\u2019t qualify for protection under a Significantly Not as Described claim with us.</p>\n<p>You must choose whether to
