pursue a dispute with PayPal under our PayPal Buyer Protection, or to pursue the dispute with your card issuer.\nYou can\u2019t do both at the same time or seek a double recovery.\nIf you pursue a dispute/claim with us and you also pursue a dispute for the same transaction with your card issuer, we\u2019ll close your dispute/claim with us.\nThis won\u2019t affect the dispute process with your card issuer.\nIn addition, if you pursue a dispute with your card issuer, you cannot pursue a dispute/claim with us later.</p>\n<p>If you choose to dispute a transaction with PayPal and we decide against you, you can seek to pursue the dispute with your card issuer later.\nIf PayPal does not make a final decision on your claim until after your card issuer's deadline for filing a dispute, and because of our delay you recover less than the full amount you would have been entitled to recover from the card issuer, we will reimburse you for the remainder of your loss (minus any amount you have already recovered from the seller or your card issuer).</p>\n<p>Before contacting your card issuer or filing a dispute with PayPal, you should contact the seller to attempt to resolve your issue in accordance with the seller\u2019s return policy.</p> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nReceiving Payments General provisions for receiving payments <p>PayPal may allow anybody (with or without an account) to make a payment resulting in the issuance or transfer of electronic money to your account.\n</p>\n<p>By integrating (including by having already integrated) into your online checkout/platform any functionality intended to enable a payer without a PayPal account to send a payment to your PayPal account, you agree to all further terms of use of that functionality which PayPal will make available to you on any page on the PayPal or Braintree website (including any page for developers and our Legal Agreements page) or online platform.\nSuch further terms include the PayPal Alternative Payment Methods Agreement.\n</p>\n<p>The receipt of a payment into your account does not equate to the receipt of cleared funds.\nA notification that a payment has been sent to you does not amount to a receipt of electronic money in your account unless you have accepted the payment.\n</p>\n<p>We may allow you to accept payments in any currency supported by our Service from time to time.\n</p>\n<p>Where you (instead of PayPal) offer the payer at the point of sale a currency conversion of an amount you receive through PayPal, you will inform the buyer of the exchange rate and any charges that will be applied to the payment transaction.\nPayPal has no liability to any buyer if you fail to inform the buyer of the exchange rate and charges.\nYou acknowledge that if you fail to disclose the exchange rate and charges to the buyer this may constitute a criminal offence by you.</p>\n<p>Any payment sent to you may be subject to a reversal, payment review, limitation, reserve or hold as allowed under this user agreement.\n</p>Receiving limits <p>We may, at our discretion, impose limits on the amount and value of payments you can receive, including money you receive for purchases.\nTo lift your receiving limit, you must follow the steps that we will notify to you or publish from time to time (which we may set out in your account overview).</p>\n<strong>New checkout solution included in the PayPal Commerce Platform</strong>\n<p>The PayPal Commerce Platform includes our new checkout solution.&nbsp.\nThe checkout solution consists of:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<p>our dedicated bundled checkout capability in your online checkout/platform to enable a buyer with or without an account to send a payment to your account.\nand</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Fraud Protection.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may offer you all, any part or any combination of parts of the checkout solution.\nIf we offer you the checkout solution and you choose to use it, in addition to this user agreement, you agree to the following further terms relating to the following capabilities:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>the&nbsp;<strong>PayPal Alternative Payment Methods Agreement</strong>, when you use our APM functionality as part of the checkout solution.\nand</li>\n<li>the&nbsp;<strong>PayPal Online Card Payment Services Agreement</strong>, when you use: <ul>\n<li>our Advanced Credit and Debit Card Payments as part of the checkout solution bundle.\nand</li>\n<li>Fraud Protection as part of the checkout solution.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Our <strong>Fees</strong>&nbsp;for using the checkout solution apply.</p> Rules about surcharging <p>PayPal does not encourage surcharging because it is a commercial practice that can penalise the consumer and create unnecessary confusion, friction and abandonment at checkout.\n</p>\n<p>You may only surcharge for the use of our services in compliance with any law applicable to you and not in excess of the surcharges that you apply for the use of other payment methods.</p>\n<p>If you surcharge a buyer, you, and not we, will inform the buyer of the requested charge.\nWe are not liable to any buyer where you have failed to inform the buyer of any surcharge.\nYou acknowledge that you could be committing a criminal offence if you surcharge and/or fail to disclose any form of surcharge to a buyer.</p> Presentation of PayPal <p>You must treat PayPal as a payment method or mark at least on par with any other payment methods offered at your points of sale, including your websites or mobile applications.\nThis includes at least equal or substantially similar:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>logo placement,</li>\n<li>position within any point of sale,</li>\n<li>treatment in terms of payment flow, terms, conditions, restrictions, or fees, in each case as compared to other marks and payment methods at your points of sale.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>In representations to your customers or in public communications, you must not mischaracterise PayPal as a payment method or exhibit a preference for other payment methods over PayPal.</p> Taxes and information reporting <p>It is your responsibility to determine what, if any, taxes apply to the payments you make or receive, and it is solely your responsibility to assess, collect, report and remit the correct taxes to the appropriate authority.\nWe are not responsible for determining whether any taxes apply to your transaction, or for calculating, collecting, reporting or remitting taxes arising from any transaction.\nAs a bank service provider no sales tax applies to the PayPal services in the EU.</p> Your refund policy and privacy policy <p>You must publish a refunds and return policy, as well as a privacy policy.</p> In-store payments and QR code transactions <p>If you accept PayPal payments at your physical store, you must communicate the total amount of the transaction to the customer before it takes place.\nYou may charge your customer's account only for transactions that they have authorized.\nYou must also provide customers with a physical receipt if they request one.\nYou agree that any transaction that you make shall have an accurate and true description of the goods and services being purchased.</p>\n<p>If you use a QR code to accept payments in your physical store, you must use a QR code intended for goods and services transactions.\nYou must also not use QR codes for in-person transactions as a method of accepting payment for goods and services transactions occurring online.\nFor any buyer claims related to QR code transactions you may be required to provide us with alternative evidence of delivery, or such additional documentation or information relating to the transaction.</p> Marketplace sellers <p>If you\u2019re a seller on a marketplace or through a third-party application where PayPal is offered, you must comply with any rules that apply to the marketplace\u2019s or the third party application\u2019s buyer protection program for sales you make through that forum.\nAny such protections may require you to take certain actions and may impact how claims are processed.</p>\n<p>We may allow you to authorise certain marketplaces to use your account to pay amounts you owe to the marketplace or to the buyer (as the case may be) arising from a claim under the terms of the marketplace\u2019s own resolution process (\u201c<strong>Marketplace Due Amounts</strong>\u201d).\nIf you give such an authorisation and the marketplace notifies us of the claim, you instruct us to process payments of all and any Marketplace Due Amounts relating to that claim from your PayPal account to that marketplace or to the buyer (as the case may be) according to the marketplace\u2019s instructions to us.\nWe may treat your instruction for the payment of any given Marketplace Due Amount as cancelled if we decide that the claim would have been determined in your favour had it been filed as a claim with us.\nYou can also cancel this instruction by contacting us.\nAll claims filed directly with the marketplace are governed by the marketplace\u2019s own policy only.\nThe terms of the PayPal Seller Protection Programme do not cover you for claims filed by your buyers directly with the marketplace.</p> Accepting billing agreement payments <p>If we allow you to accept payments from a payer under a billing agreement, when you present to us a payment request under that billing agreement, you:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>warrant to us that the amounts you present have been agreed and consented to by the payer whose account will be deducted (including changes to those amounts) and that you will give prior notice of the deduction to the payer.\nand</li>\n<li>agree that you will notify the payer at least 4 weeks in advance of the amount they will collect if that amount has increased in such a manner that the payer could not have reasonably expected to pay such an amount, taking into account the payer\u2019s previous spending patterns and the circumstances of the payment and that you are liable to us for any refunds of that payment in accordance with the terms of this user agreement.</li>\n</ul> Refunds and reversals of payments <p>When you receive a payment, it could be refunded or reversed.\nWe may allow you to send to the payer a refund of the payment.\nWe may carry out a reversal of your payment in certain circumstances.\nSee the rest of this section for more details.</p>Refunds <p>You alone are (and PayPal is not) responsible for:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>your legal and contractual obligations towards the payer for any amount you return to the payer.\nand</li>\n<li>any difference between the cost to the payer of making the original payment and the value of the amount returned to the payer (for instance, as a result of transaction exchange rate fluctuations) except to the extent that the refund is an incorrect payment (see the section on Resolving Problems).<br>\n<br>See our fees for details of the fees you paid to us as the recipient of the original payment which we retain when you use the special commercial transaction refund functionality in your PayPal account, as we may allow from time to time.\nexcept to the extent that the refund is an incorrect payment (see the section on Resolving Problems).</li>\n</ul>Reversals <p>If you receive a payment in your account, you owe us the full amount of the payment and our losses arising from processing the payment.\nThis can include our liability (including any fees, charges and penalties) towards any third party (including the payer and the payer\u2019s funding source provider).</p>\n<p>A reversal happens when we exercise our right to set off the above amounts from your account under the section Reimbursement for your liability in this user agreement.\nIf your PayPal balance for a particular currency is insufficient to cover the amount you owe us in that currency, we may perform a currency conversion from any PayPal balance in another currency to cover the shortfall and you will be charged for the currency conversion.\nThis means that, for example, if you are a seller, amounts of payments received in your account may be removed from your account after you have delivered any goods or services sold.</p>\n<p>A reversal can happen when:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>we reimburse the payer in respect of a PayPal Buyer Protection claim the payer made against you.</li>\n<li>we compensate the payer or the payer\u2019s funding source provider (or both) because we receive a claim from the payer or their funding source provider for the payment amount under the reversal process used by that funding source provider.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>For instance:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>if the payer used a card to fund the payment to you the payer could pursue a \u201cchargeback\u201d with the card issuer.\nThe card issuer, not us, determines whether the payer is successful when they pursue a chargeback.\nYou can find out more about chargebacks by reviewing our Chargeback Guide, accessible via the PayPal Security Centre and the section called: \u201cSelling Safely\u201d.\nThe PayPal Security Centre is accessed via the PayPal website.\nWe charge you a fee for receiving a chargeback claim.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>If the payer used a bank account to fund the payment the payer or the bank could pursue a bank reversal.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The amount claimed may be greater than the original amount you received due to currency exchange rate fluctuations between the time of payment and the time of the claim.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>we may have to compensate your payer when they claimed that there was a problem with their payment (including that their payment was unauthorised or incorrect or that their billing agreement payment was not expected) \u2013 see Resolving Problems.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>we are entitled to carry out the reversal for any other reason under this user agreement, including the provision Actions We May Take if You Engage in Any Restricted Activities.</li>\n</ul> Impact of PayPal Buyer Protection on sellers <p> You should read our Buyer Protection Policy and if you sell goods and services to buyers with PayPal accounts in countries other than your own, you also should be familiar with the purchase protection made available by PayPal to buyers in each of those countries as buyers\u2019 rights under these programs may impact you as a seller.\nYou can find information about the PayPal Buyer Protection on the Legal Agreements page by selecting your buyer\u2019s location at the top of the page and referring to the corresponding PayPal Buyer Protection listed on that page or in the corresponding user agreement.\n</p>\n<p>If you lose a claim under&nbsp;PayPal Buyer Protection&nbsp.\nin any country:</p>\n<p>\u00b7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nYou must forfeit the full purchase price of the item plus the original shipping cost.\nIn some cases you may not receive the item back.</p>\n<p>\u00b7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nYou will not receive a refund of the PayPal fees that you paid in connection with the sale.</p>\n<p>\u00b7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nIf the claim was that the item received was Significantly Not as Described, you may not receive the item back, or you may be required to accept the item back plus pay for return shipping costs.</p>\n<p>\u00b7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nIf the claim was that the item received was Significantly Not as Described and related to an item you sold that is counterfeit, you will be required to provide a full refund to the buyer and you may not receive the item back.</p>\n<p>If you accept PayPal payments from buyers for goods or services you sell through eBay, then you need to read and understand the eBay Money Back Guarantee program.\nUnless you opt out by calling eBay, PayPal will treat eBay\u2019s decisions in favor of your buyers under that program as a basis for reversing a PayPal payment made to you.\nIf the balance in your cash account or business PayPal account is insufficient to cover the amount, we may:</p>\n<p>\u00b7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nplace a&nbsp;hold&nbsp;on your PayPal account until sufficient funds become available in your PayPal account to cover the amount.\nor</p>\n<p>create a negative balance in your PayPal account.</p> PayPal Seller Protection What\u2019s eligible <p>If you have received more than \u20ac100,000 per month at least once over a consecutive period of 6 months on your PayPal Account and/or if you are applying surcharge for the use of PayPal (when the law applicable to you allows you to apply surcharge), you are not eligible for PayPal seller protection and this section applies to you unless otherwise agreed between you and PayPal.\nPayPal will review your eligibility for seller protection in October and April of each calendar year.</p>\n<p>If you sell something to a buyer and the transaction is later disputed or reversed under Reversals, Claims or Chargebacks,&nbsp;you may be eligible for reimbursement under PayPal Seller Protection.\nWhen it applies, PayPal Seller Protection entitles you to retain the full purchase amount.\nThere is no limit on the number of payments for which you can receive coverage.\nBy accessing the transaction details page in your PayPal account you can determine whether or not your transaction is eligible for protection under this program</p>\n<p>PayPal Seller Protection may apply when a buyer claims that:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>They did not authorize, or benefit from, funds sent from their PayPal account (referred to as an \u201cUnauthorized Transaction\u201d claim) and the Unauthorized Transaction occurs in an environment hosted by PayPal.\nor</li>\n<li>They didn\u2019t receive the item from you (referred to as an \u201cItem Not Received\u201d claim).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>PayPal Seller Protection may also apply when a transaction is reversed because of a successful chargeback by a buyer or when a bank funded payment is reversed by the buyer\u2019s bank.</p>\n<p>This section describes PayPal Seller Protection as it applies to you, but you should also be familiar with the Impact of various PayPal Buyer protection processes on sellers.</p> Basic requirements <p>To be eligible for PayPal Seller Protection, all of the following basic requirements must be met, as well as any applicable additional requirements:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The primary address for your PayPal account must be in the Netherlands.</li>\n<li>The item must be a physical, tangible good that can be shipped, except for items subject to the&nbsp;<strong>Intangible Goods Additional Requirements</strong>.\nTransactions involving items that you deliver in person in connection with payment made in your physical store, may also be eligible for PayPal Seller Protection so long as the buyer paid for the transaction in-person by using a PayPal goods and services QR code.</li>\n<li>You must ship the item to the shipping address on the transaction details page in your PayPal account for the transaction.\nIf you originally ship the item to the recipient's shipping address on the transaction details page but the item is later redirected to a different address, you will not be eligible for PayPal Seller Protection.\nWe therefore recommend not using a shipping service that is arranged by the buyer, so that you will be able to provide valid proof of shipping and delivery.</li>\n<li>The shipping requirement does not apply to eligible transactions involving items that you deliver in person, provided, however, that you agree to provide us with alternative evidence of delivery, or such additional documentation or information relating to the transaction that we may request.</li>\n<li>You must respond to PayPal's requests for documentation and other information in a timely manner as requested in our email correspondence with you or in our correspondence with you through the&nbsp;<strong>Resolution Center</strong>.&nbsp;If you do not respond to PayPal\u2019s request for documentation and other information in the time requested, you may not be eligible for Seller Protection.</li>\n<li>If the sale involves pre-ordered or made-to-order goods, you must ship within the timeframe you specified in the listing.\nOtherwise, it is recommended that you ship all items within 7 days after receipt of payment.</li>\n<li>Provide proof of shipment or delivery.</li>\n<li>The payment must be marked \"eligible\" or \"partially eligible\" in the case of Unauthorized Transaction claims, or \u201celigible\u201d in the case of Item Not Received claims for PayPal Seller Protection on the \"Transaction Details\" page.</li>\n<li>You must accept a single payment from one PayPal Account for the purchase (partial payment and/or payment in installments are excluded).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>PayPal determines, in its sole discretion, whether your claim qualifies for the Seller Protection program.\nPayPal will make a decision, in its sole discretion, based on the coverage and eligibility requirements, any information or documentation provided during the resolution process or any other information PayPal deems relevant and appropriate under the circumstances.</p>Item Not Received additional requirements <p>To be eligible for PayPal\u2019s Seller Protection program for a buyer\u2019s Item Not Received claim, you must meet both the basic requirements&nbsp.\nlisted above and the additional requirements listed below:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Where a buyer files a chargeback with the issuer for a card-funded transaction, the payment must be marked \u201celigible\u201d for PayPal\u2019s Seller Protection on the Transaction Details page.</li>\n<li>You must provide proof of delivery as described below.</li>\n</ul> Intangible Goods additional requirements <p>For the sale of intangible goods and services to be eligible for PayPal\u2019s Seller Protection, the sale must meet the basic requirements and the following additional requirements:&nbsp;</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Integration requirements</li>\n<li>Where you have integrated a PayPal checkout product, you must be using the current version of that product if you are accepting payments directly via a website or mobile optimized website.\nor</li>\n<li>Ensure you are passing session information to PayPal at checkout if you are integrated with PayPal via a third party or if you have a native app integration.</li>\n<li>Other integration requirements may apply depending on your business model.\nWe will let you know those requirements ahead of time, if needed.</li>\n<li>If the transaction is a payment for digital goods or licenses for digital content, you must have paid Standard Transaction Fees on the sale (this does not apply to payments for other Intangible Goods).</li>\n<li>Delivered the item and provide Proof of delivery for Intangible Goods.</li>\n</ul> Establishing proof of delivery or proof of shipment <p>\n<strong>Physical Goods</strong>\n</p>\n<p>The following is required as:</p>\n<p>Proof of shipment</p>\n<p>Proof of delivery</p>\n<p>Online or physical documentation from a shipping company that includes:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Date of shipment</li>\n<li>An address for the recipient that matches the shipping address on the Transaction Details page, or</li>\n<li>An address for the recipient showing at least the city/state, city/country, or zip/postal code (or international equivalent).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Online or physical documentation from a shipping company that includes:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Date of delivery and \u2018delivered\u2019 status</li>\n<li>An address for the recipient that matches the shipping address on the Transaction Details page</li>\n<li>An address for the recipient showing at least the city/state, city/country, or zip/postal code (or international equivalent).</li>\n<li>Signature confirmation when the full amount of the payment (including shipping and taxes) exceeds the amount (based on the currency of the payment) listed in the&nbsp;<strong>signature confirmation threshold table</strong>.\nSignature confirmation is online documentation, viewable at the shipping company\u2019s website, indicating that the item was signed for.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>IMPORTANT:</strong> Your choice of carrier and shipment options with that carrier can have a big impact on your ability to meet the proof of delivery requirements.\nPlease ensure, especially when shipping goods internationally, that your carrier can provide \u2018delivered\u2019 status at the correct address, or your Seller Protection claim may be denied.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Intangible Goods</strong>\n</p>\n<p>The following is required as proof of delivery for intangible goods:</p>\n<p>\n<strong>QR Code Transactions</strong>\n</p>\n<p>The following is required as proof of shipment or proof of delivery:</p>\n<p>For intangible or digital goods, proof of shipment or delivery means compelling evidence to show the item was delivered or the purchase order was fulfilled.\nCompelling evidence could include a system of record showing the date the item was sent and that it was either:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Electronically sent to the recipient, including the recipient\u2019s address (email, IP, etc.), where applicable.\nor</li>\n<li>Received or accessed by the recipient</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>For QR code transactions you may be required to provide us with alternative evidence of delivery, or such additional documentation or information to the transaction.</p>\n<p>Signature confirmation currency thresholds</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Currency</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Transaction value</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Currency</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Transaction value</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Australian Dollar:</p>\n<p>850.00 AUD</p>\n<p>New Zealand Dollar:</p>\n<p>950.00 NZD</p>\n<p>Brazilian Real:</p>\n<p>1,750.00 BRL</p>\n<p>Norwegian Krone:</p>\n<p>4,600.00 NOK</p>\n<p>Canadian Dollar:</p>\n<p>850.00 CAD</p>\n<p>Philippine Peso:</p>\n<p>34,000.00 PHP</p>\n<p>Czech Koruna:</p>\n<p>15,000.00 CZK</p>\n<p>Polish Zloty:</p>\n<p>2,300.00 PLN</p>\n<p>Danish Krone:</p>\n<p>4,100.00 DKK</p>\n<p>Russian Ruble:</p>\n<p>48,000.00 RUB</p>\n<p>Euro:</p>\n<p>550.00 EUR</p>\n<p>Singapore Dollar:</p>\n<p>950.00 SGD</p>\n<p>Hong Kong Dollar:</p>\n<p>6,000.00 HKD</p>\n<p>Swedish Krona:</p>\n<p>4,950.00 SEK</p>\n<p>Hungarian Forint:</p>\n<p>170,000.00 HUF</p>\n<p>Swiss Franc:</p>\n<p>700.00 CHF</p>\n<p>Israeli Shekel:</p>\n<p>2,700.00 ILS</p>\n<p>Taiwan New Dollar:</p>\n<p>23,000.00 TWD</p>\n<p>Japanese Yen:</p>\n<p>77,000.00 JPY</p>\n<p>Thai Baht:</p>\n<p>24,500.00 THB</p>\n<p>Malaysian Ringgit:</p>\n<p>3,100.00 MYR</p>\n<p>U.K.\nPounds Sterling:</p>\n<p>450.00 GBP</p>\n<p>Mexican Peso:</p>\n<p>10,000.00 MXN</p>\n<p>U.S.\nDollar:</p>\n<p>750.00 USD</p> Ineligible items and transactions <p>Your sale&nbsp;<strong>\n<em>is not</em>\n</strong>&nbsp;eligible for coverage under PayPal Seller Protection if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The buyer claims (either with us or their card issuer) that the item you sent isn\u2019t what was ordered (referred to as a \u201cSignificantly Not as Described\u201d claim).</li>\n<li>It involves an item that PayPal determines, in its sole discretion, is a counterfeit item.</li>\n<li>It involves an item that you deliver in person, including in connection with a payment made in your physical store, unless the buyer paid for the transaction in-person by using a PayPal goods and services QR code.</li>\n<li>It involves sales that are not processed either through a buyer\u2019s PayPal account or&nbsp;a PayPal guest checkout transaction.\nFor example, if the payment was received as a direct card payment (including through Zong and Virtual Terminal or PayPal advanced credit and debit card payments (if available), then it is not eligible for coverage..&nbsp;</li>\n<li>It involves items equivalent to cash including gift cards.</li>\n<li>It involves&nbsp;a donation.</li>\n<li>It relates to the purchase of a financial product or investment of any kind.</li>\n<li>It involves&nbsp;a Personal payment.</li>\n<li>It involves a payment made using PayPal Payouts and Mass Pay.</li>\n<li>The item is a vehicle, including, but not limited to a motor vehicle, motorcycle, recreational vehicle, aircraft or boat.</li>\n<li>Payments made in respect of gold (whether in physical form or in exchange-traded form).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n</p> Merchant rate <p>Merchant rate status is subject to eligibility, application and approval by us.\nWe may evaluate applications on a case-by-case basis, including, without limitation, on the following criteria: qualifying monthly sales volume, size of average shopping cart and an account in good standing.</p>\n<p>To be eligible to apply for (and retain) our volume-based tiered merchant rate status your account must:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>at all times be in good standing and not under investigation.\nand</li>\n<li>have received more than the Tier 1 ceiling amount (in the original opening currency of your account) in commercial transaction payments in the previous calendar month.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may downgrade your account to the standard rate at any time if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>the above conditions are not met;</li>\n<li>there are unresolved chargebacks against the PayPal account.\nor</li>\n<li>you breach any of our Rules about surcharging.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we downgrade your account you will need to apply to us again for your account to get merchant rate status.</p>\n<p>You may apply to receive the merchant rate using the dedicated online application form when logged into your account.\nIf your application is rejected, you may only submit another application after thirty days.</p>\n<p>Merchant rates do not apply to commercial transaction payments received through functionality provided under the terms of the PayPal Online Card Payment Services Agreement.</p> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nRESTRICTED ACTIVITIES AND HOLDS Restricted Activities <p>In connection with your use of our websites, your PayPal account, the PayPal services, or in the course of your interactions with PayPal, other PayPal customers, or third parties, you must not:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Breach this user agreement, the PayPal&nbsp;<strong>Acceptable Use Policy</strong>, the&nbsp;<strong>Commercial Entity Agreements</strong>&nbsp;(if they apply to you), or any <strong>other agreement</strong>&nbsp;between you and us;</li>\n<li>Violate any law, statute, ordinance, or regulation (for example, those governing financial services, consumer protections, unfair competition, anti-discrimination or false advertising);</li>\n<li>Infringe PayPal\u2019s or any third party's copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret or other intellectual property rights, or rights of publicity or privacy;</li>\n<li>Sell counterfeit goods;</li>\n<li>Act in a manner that is defamatory, trade libelous, threatening or harassing;</li>\n<li>Provide false, inaccurate or misleading information;</li>\n<li>Send or receive what we reasonably believe to be potentially fraudulent or unauthorized funds;</li>\n<li>Refuse to cooperate in an investigation or provide confirmation of your identity or any information you provide to us;</li>\n<li>Attempt to \u201cdouble dip\u201d during the course of a dispute by receiving or attempting to receive funds from both PayPal and the seller, bank or card issuer for the same transaction;</li>\n<li>Control an account that is linked to another account that has engaged in any of these restricted activities;</li>\n<li>Conduct your business or use the PayPal services in a manner that results in or may result in.\n<ul>\n<li>complaints;</li>\n<li>requests by buyers (either filed with us or card issuers) to invalidate payments made to you;</li>\n<li>fees, fines, penalties or other liability or losses to PayPal, other PayPal customers, third parties or you;</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Use your PayPal account or the PayPal services in a manner that PayPal, Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover or any other electronic funds transfer network reasonably believes to be an abuse of the card system or a violation of card association or network rules;</li>\n<li>Allow your PayPal account to have a balance reflecting an amount owing to us;</li>\n<li>Provide yourself a cash advance from your credit card (or help others to do so);</li>\n<li>Access the PayPal services from a country that is not included on our&nbsp;<strong>permitted countries list</strong>;</li>\n<li>Take any action that imposes an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf or the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>Facilitate any viruses, trojan horses, malware, worms or other computer programming routines that attempts to or may damage, disrupt, corrupt, misuse, detrimentally interfere with, surreptitiously intercept or expropriate, or gain unauthorized access to any system, data, information or PayPal services;</li>\n<li>Use an anonymizing proxy.\nuse any robot, spider, other automatic device, or manual process to monitor or copy our websites without our prior written permission.\nor use any device, software or routine to bypass our robot exclusion headers;</li>\n<li>Interfere or disrupt or attempt to interfere with or disrupt our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, any of the PayPal services or other users\u2019 use of any of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>Take any action that may cause us to lose any of the services from our Internet service providers, payment processors, or other suppliers or service providers;</li>\n<li>Use the PayPal services to test credit card behaviors;</li>\n<li>Circumvent any PayPal policy or determinations about your PayPal account such as temporary or indefinite suspensions or other account holds, limitations or restrictions, including, but not limited to, engaging in the following actions: attempting to open new or additional PayPal account(s) when an account has a negative balance or has been restricted, suspended or otherwise limited.\nopening new or additional PayPal accounts using information that is not your own (e.g.\nname, address, email address, etc.).\nor using someone else\u2019s PayPal account.\nor</li>\n<li>Harass and/or threaten our employees, agents, or other users.</li>\n<li>Abuse (as either a buyer or seller) of our online dispute resolution process and/or PayPal Buyer Protection;</li>\n<li>Cause us to receive a disproportionate number of claims that have been closed in favour of the claimant regarding your PayPal account or business;</li>\n<li>Have a credit score from a credit reporting agency that indicates a high level of risk associated with your use of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>Use a credit card with your PayPal account to provide yourself with a cash advance (or help others to do so);</li>\n<li>Disclose or distribute another user\u2019s information to a third party, or use such information for marketing purposes unless you receive the user\u2019s express consent to do so;</li>\n<li>Send unsolicited email to a user or use the PayPal services to collect payments for sending, or assisting in sending, unsolicited email to third parties;</li>\n<li>Copy, reproduce, communicate to any third party, alter, modify, create derivative works, publicly display or frame any content from the PayPal website(s) without our or any applicable third party\u2019s written consent;</li>\n<li>Reveal your account password(s) to anyone else, nor may you use anyone else's password.\nWe are not responsible for losses incurred by you including, without limitation, the use of your account by any person other than you, arising as the result of misuse of passwords;</li>\n<li>Do, or omit to do, or attempt to do or omit to do, any other act or thing which may interfere with the proper operation of the PayPal service or activities carried out as part of PayPal services or otherwise than in accordance with the terms of this user agreement;</li>\n<li>Request or send a personal transaction payment for a commercial transaction;</li>\n<li>Allow your use of the PayPal service to present to PayPal a risk of non-compliance with PayPal\u2019s anti-money laundering, counter terrorist financing and similar regulatory obligations (including, without limitation, where we cannot verify your identity or you fail to complete the steps to lift your sending, receiving or withdrawal limit or where you expose PayPal to the risk of any regulatory fines by European, US or other authorities for processing your transactions);</li>\n<li>Integrate or use any of the PayPal services without fully complying with all mandatory requirements communicated to you by way of any integration or programmers\u2019 guide or other documentation issued by PayPal from time to time;</li>\n<li>Advertise, promote, introduce or describe PayPal Credit or any PayPal co-branded credit based payment instrument to your customers without: (1) obtaining the necessary regulatory permission to do so&nbsp;in advance.\nand (2) the prior written permission of PayPal and (if not PayPal) the issuer of the credit to do so;</li>\n<li>Suffer (or cause us to determine that there is a reasonable likelihood of) a security breach of your website or systems that could result in the unauthorized disclosure of customer information.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You agree that engaging in the above restricted activities diminishes your or our other customers\u2019 safe access and/or use of your account and our services generally.</p> Actions We May Take if You Engage in Any Restricted Activities <p>If we believe that you\u2019ve engaged in any of these activities, we may take a number of actions to protect PayPal, its customers and others at any time in our sole discretion.&nbsp.\nThe actions we may take include, but are not limited to, the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Terminate this user agreement, limit your account, and/or close or suspend your account, immediately and without penalty to us;</li>\n<li>Refuse to provide the PayPal services to you in the future;</li>\n<li>At any time and without liability, suspend, limit or terminate your access to our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, your PayPal account or any of the PayPal services, including limiting your ability to pay or send money with any of the payment methods linked to your PayPal account, restricting your ability to send money or make withdrawals;</li>\n<li>Hold your money to the extent and for so long as reasonably needed to protect against the risk of liability.\nYou acknowledge that, as a non-exhaustive guide:</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>PayPal\u2019s risk of liability in respect of card-funded payments that you receive can last until the risk of a chargeback closing in favour of the payer/buyer (as determined by card scheme rules) has passed.\nThis depends on certain factors, including, without limitation: <ul>\n<li>a.\nThe type of goods or services for which you receive payment.\nor</li>\n<li>b.\nThe timeframe for delivery of the goods or performance of the services for which you receive payment (e.g.\nsales of event tickets months in advance of the event date can present a higher and more enduring risk of chargebacks than sales of most other items or services);</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>PayPal\u2019s risk of liability in respect of a claim or dispute arising from a payment that you receive can last for the time that it takes for the parties to close the claim or dispute and all appeals associated with that claim or dispute in accordance with PayPal Buyer Protection</li>\n<li>PayPal\u2019s risk of liability in respect of any event of insolvency that you suffer can last for as long as and to the extent that laws applicable to your insolvency restrict PayPal from taking legal action against you.\nand</li>\n<li>If you allow your PayPal account to have a balance reflecting an amount owing to PayPal, PayPal\u2019s risk of liability can last for the time and to the extent that you owe that amount to PayPal.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Block your PayPal account and/or hold any funds in the reserve account (including, without limitation, for more than 180 days if so required by PayPal, where PayPal\u2019s rights arise from your engagement in the restricted activity);</li>\n<li>Refuse any particular payment transaction at any time for any reason and will only be required to make available the fact of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal and how you may resolve the problem, where possible, upon request and provided it is not prohibited by law;</li>\n<li>Reverse <strong>a payment</strong>&nbsp;(including, if appropriate, to the sender\u2019s funding source);</li>\n<li>Take legal action against you.</li>\n<li>Suspend your eligibility for Buyer Protection and/or&nbsp.\nSeller Protection (including in retrospect);</li>\n<li>Contact third parties and disclose details of the restricted activities in the manner set out in our Privacy Statement;</li>\n<li>Request or update inaccurate information you provided us;</li>\n<li>Request information or documents from you in order to verify your identity and/or with regard to the goods or services you provided based on a transaction;</li>\n<li>If you\u2019ve violated our&nbsp;<strong>Acceptable Use Policy</strong>, then you\u2019re also responsible for damages to PayPal caused by your violation of this policy,</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you use your PayPal account primarily for the purposes of your trade, business, craft or profession and you violate the Acceptable Use Policy, then:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>in addition to being subject to the above actions you will be liable to PayPal for the amount of PayPal's damages caused by your violation of the Acceptable Use Policy;</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>you acknowledge and agree that USD 2,500.00 (or the prevailing equivalent in the currency of the country in which you reside) per violation of the Acceptable Use Policy is: <ul>\n<li>a reasonable minimum estimate of PayPal's actual damages considering all currently existing circumstances, including the relationship of the sum to the range of harm to PayPal that reasonably could be anticipated;</li>\n<li>reasonable and proportionate in its application to the provision of the Services to you.\nand</li>\n<li>necessary, but no more than sufficient, to protect PayPal\u2019s legitimate interest in your compliance with the Acceptable Use Policy.\nand</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>PayPal may deduct such damages directly from any existing balance in any PayPal account you control.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Please also see the section below on <u>Your liability</u>.</p>\n<p>Unless otherwise directed by us, you must not use or attempt to use your account while it is suspended or has been closed.\nYou must ensure that all agreements with sellers or other third parties that involve third party initiated payments (including billing agreement payments) set up from your account are cancelled immediately upon the termination, suspension or closure of your account.\nYou remain liable under this user agreement in respect of all charges and other amounts incurred through the use of your account at any time, irrespective of termination, suspension or closure.</p> Holds, Limitations, and Reserves What are holds, limitations and reserves? <p>Under certain circumstances, in order to protect PayPal and the security and integrity of the network of buyers and sellers that use the PayPal services, PayPal may take account-level or transaction-level actions.\nIf we take any of the actions described here, we will normally notify you of our actions, but we may, if it is reasonable to do so (for example if you are in breach of this user agreement or we consider it advisable for security reasons), take any of these actions without prior notice to you.</p>\n<p>To request information in connection with an account limitation, hold or reserve, you should visit the Resolution Centre or follow the instructions in our email notice with respect to the limitation, hold or reserve.</p>\n<p>You acknowledge and agree that any funds held under this user agreement may be placed in your reserve account and that you will provide to us any information as we may reasonably request to allow us to determine whether the risk has passed.</p>Holds <p>A hold is an action that PayPal may take under certain circumstances either at the transaction level or the account level.&nbsp.\nWhen PayPal places a hold on a payment amount, the money is not available to either the sender or the recipient.\n&nbsp;PayPal reviews many factors before placing a hold on a payment, including: account tenure, transaction activity, business type, past customer disputes, and overall customer satisfaction.\nSome common situations where PayPal will hold payments include where we have reason to believe that:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Transactions are higher risk, this can be where the transaction involves the sale of goods or services in a high risk category, or other facts known to us typically resulting in an increased number of chargebacks, other claims or disputes or to be often involved in fraud or illegal activity;</li>\n<li>There is a sudden and abnormal change in a PayPal account holder\u2019s selling activity including an increase in the number of chargebacks, reversals, or buyer complaints received in relation to such PayPal account;</li>\n<li>Any PayPal account is being used in relation to restricted activities;</li>\n<li>A PayPal account involved in the transaction may have been compromised, or that stolen financial details (bank or credit card) are used for the payment, or otherwise a transaction has not been properly authorised;</li>\n<li>A user is trying to send or withdraw funds they received fraudulently;</li>\n<li>A user has not provided sufficient Information to us to enable us to verify their identity or the identity of their business and/or the user has a limited trading history with PayPal;</li>\n<li>A payment sent to you as a seller is challenged as a payment that should be invalidated and reversed.</li>\n<li>Your buyer files a chargeback, reversal or PayPal Buyer Protection claim on a payment you received.&nbsp;</li>\n<li>Your buyer files a claim under a marketplace's resolution process.</li>\n<li>There is a risk of reversal of funds in your account to your funding source.</li>\n<li>There is a risk of liability (a non-exhaustive list of examples of such risk is set out in the section Actions We May Take If You Engage In Any Restricted Activities above).</li>\n</ul>Payment review <p>When we identify a potentially high-risk transaction, we review the transaction more closely before allowing it to proceed.\nThis may be because we have the reasonable suspicion that the payer\u2019s PayPal account is being used in relation to restricted activities or for other reasons as determined by us in our reasonable discretion.&nbsp.\nThis may include where there is a risk of liability (a non-exhaustive list of examples of such risk is set out in the section Actions We May Take If You Engage In Any Restricted Activities above).</p>\n<p>If a payment is subject to payment review, we may:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>execute the payment order initiated by the buyer;</li>\n<li>in our discretion, immediately upon such execution restrict the payer\u2019s account;</li>\n<li>place a hold on the payment [in the payer\u2019s account].\nand/or</li>\n<li>notify the recipient to delay the delivery of the purchase paid for by the payment.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>As a buyer, this may delay your receipt of the item you purchased.\nIf we clear the transaction, we will notify the seller and direct them to ship the item.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<p>If we don\u2019t clear the transaction, we will cancel it and return the funds to you, unless we are legally required to take other action.</p>\n<p>All payments that complete payment review are still subject to being reversed under the terms of this user agreement but will be Seller Protection eligible if they meet the Seller Protection requirements.\nPayPal will provide notices to you by email and/or in the transaction history tab of your PayPal account.\nA payment subject to payment review is a review of the payment only and is implemented to reduce the risk of PayPal users receiving high risk transactions.\nA payment subject to payment review is neither a review nor a representation by PayPal as to the commercial dealings, character or reputation of a party to the payment transaction and should not be considered as a lessening of the respect of any person.</p>Holds related to your instructions <p>Certain PayPal functionality may allow you (whether directly or via someone you permit to act on your behalf, like an online marketplace platform on which you transact as a seller) to instruct us to hold your funds (including the proceeds of payments you receive using PayPal) in your reserve account.</p>\n<p>In such a case we will show you the availability status of those funds in your balance \u2013 the status descriptions may differ according to the functionality you used to instruct us to place the hold.\nWe will release the hold on the funds according to the instruction that you (or the entity that you have permitted to act on your behalf) give to us, subject to the rest of this user agreement.</p> Account Limitations <p>Limitations are implemented to help protect PayPal, buyers and sellers when we notice&nbsp;<strong>restricted activities</strong>, an increased financial risk, or activity that appears to us as unusual or suspicious.&nbsp.\nLimitations also help us collect information necessary for keeping your PayPal account open.</p>\n<p>There are several reasons why your PayPal account could be limited, including where we have reason to believe that:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Someone could be using your PayPal account without your knowledge, then we\u2019ll limit it for your protection and look into the fraudulent activity.</li>\n<li>Someone has used your card or bank account without your permission, for example if your debit or credit card issuer or bank alerts us to this.</li>\n<li>You have breached this user agreement or violated the&nbsp;<strong>Acceptable Use Policy.</strong>\n</li>\n<li>Your performance as a seller indicate your PayPal account is high risk.\nExamples include: indications of poor selling performance because you\u2019ve received an unusually high number of claims and chargebacks, selling an entirely new or high-cost product type, or if your typical sales volume increases rapidly.</li>\n<li>There is a risk of liability (a non-exhaustive list of examples of such risk is set out in the section Actions We May Take If You Engage In Any Restricted Activities&nbsp;above).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may also limit your PayPal account in order to comply with applicable law.</p>\n<p>You will need to resolve any issues with your account before a limitation can be removed.\nNormally, this is done after you provide us with the information we request.\nHowever, if we reasonably believe a risk still exists after you have provided us that information, we may take action to protect PayPal, our users, a third party, or you from reversals, fees, fines, penalties, legal and/or regulatory risks and any other liability.</p>Reserves <p>We may place a reserve on your PayPal account at any time if we believe there may be a high level of risk associated with you, your PayPal account, your business model, or your transactions.&nbsp.\nWhen we place a reserve on your PayPal account, it means that all or some portion of the funds in your PayPal account is reserved as unavailable for withdrawal in order to protect against the risk of transactions made by you being reversed or invalidated or any other risk related to your PayPal account or use of the PayPal services.&nbsp;&nbsp.\nWe make decisions about whether to place a reserve based on a number of factors, including information available to us from both internal sources and from third parties.</p>\n<p>PayPal considers a list of non-exclusive factors and whether and how these factors have changed over time, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>How long you have been in business.</li>\n<li>Whether your industry has a higher likelihood of chargebacks.</li>\n<li>Your payment processing history with PayPal and other providers.</li>\n<li>Your business and/or personal credit history.</li>\n<li>Your delivery time frames.</li>\n<li>Whether you have higher than average number of returns, chargebacks, claims or disputes.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>There are two types of reserves that may be placed on your PayPal account, and one or both may be applied at the same time:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>A \u201crolling reserve\u201d</strong>&nbsp;is a reserve where a percentage of each transaction you receive each day is held and then released later on a scheduled basis.\nFor example, your reserve could be set at 10% and held for a 90-day rolling period \u2013 meaning 10% of the money you receive on day 1 is held and then released on day 91, 10% of the money you receive on day 2 is held until day 92, etc.\nRolling reserves are the most common type of reserve.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>A \u201cminimum reserve\u201d</strong>&nbsp;is a specific minimum amount of funds that you\u2019re required to keep available in your balance at all times.\nThe minimum reserve is either taken as an upfront amount deposited all at once or is established on a rolling basis from percentages of sales until the minimum reserve is achieved, much like a rolling reserve.&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we place a reserve on funds in your PayPal account, the money will be moved to your reserve account and shown as \u201cpending\u201d and we\u2019ll notify you about it.</p>\n<p>If we change the reserve due to a change in our risk assessment, we\u2019ll notify you about it as well.</p>\n<p>You will undertake, at your own expense, any further action required to establish a reserve or other form of security in a manner reasonably determined by us.&nbsp.\nThis can involve executing any necessary documents and registering any form of document reasonably required by us to allow us to perfect any form of security interest.</p> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nRESOLVING PROBLEMS <strong>\n<p>We strongly recommend that you monitor your account closely on a regular basis.</p>\n</strong> If you find a problem\u2026 <p>If you have any reason to believe that there is a problem with your account or our service, follow these steps:</p> Step 1: Take a few moments to identify the type of problem: <ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Unexpected billing agreement payment</u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<p>This is where you entered into a billing agreement but a payment was sent from your account to another PayPal account under that billing agreement where:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>you didn\u2019t agree with the recipient in advance the exact payment amount.\nand</li>\n<li>the payment amount ended up being more than you could reasonably have expected to pay based on previous charges and the other circumstances.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Incorrect payment</u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<p>This is where a payment sent from your account to another PayPal account was not sent as you specified when you asked us to make it (e.g.\nfor the wrong amount, delayed, wrong recipient) or you received such a payment.</p>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Security / Fraud problem</u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Unauthorised payment</u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<p>This is where a payment sent from your account wasn\u2019t authorised by you (or anyone who\u2019s authorised to make payments for you).</p>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Another type of security / fraud problem</u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<p>This is where there was another security or fraud problem, such as:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>there was some other unauthorised access to your account.</li>\n<li>your password or PIN was compromised.</li>\n<li>a device you have used to access our services was lost, stolen or deactivated.</li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<p>Follow the steps in the section \u201c<strong>What to do in case of a security problem</strong>\u201d in the <strong>\n<u>Key Payment and Service Information</u>\n</strong>&nbsp;as soon as possible before contacting us.</p>\n</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>Another type of problem </u>\n</strong>\n<br>\n<p>This is where there was another type of problem with your account or with our service which is not mentioned above.\nFor instance, we may have made a factual, computational or mathematical error related to your PayPal when you added money to or withdrew money from your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>If a purchase that you paid for with PayPal was not as described or you have not received the purchase, the PayPal Buyer Protection Policy, not this section, may apply.&nbsp.\nPlease see the PayPal Buyer Protection Policy&nbsp;for how to deal with these particular problems.</p>\n</li>\n</ul> Step 2: Tell us about the problem <p>\n<strong>\n<u>Contact us&nbsp;as soon as possible</u>\n</strong> to tell us about the problem (including the type of problem you are contacting us about so that we can help you as quickly as we can).</p>\n<p>You must give us all the information we reasonably request as to the circumstances of the problem and take all reasonable steps we request to assist us in our investigation.</p>\n<p>If you tell us about your problem orally, we may require that you report your problem in writing within 10&nbsp;<strong>Business Days</strong> after that.</p>\n<p>We may provide third parties with information we consider relevant in such circumstances in accordance with our <strong>\n<u>Privacy Policy</u>\n</strong>&nbsp;(alternatively known as our Privacy Statement).</p> How we will help...\n<p>Subject to the rest of this user agreement, we aim to investigate the problem and work with you to resolve it within 60 days.\nIn addition, if your problem is:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>an unexpected billing agreement payment, </u>\n</strong>&nbsp;within 10 Business Days after telling us about it we will either: <ul>\n<li>reimburse you for the payment amount.\nor</li>\n<li>explain why we cannot reimburse you.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>an incorrect payment to another Paypal account, </u>\n</strong>we will:</li>\n<ul>\n<li>make immediate efforts to trace the payment and notify you of the outcome without charge to you;</li>\n<li>compensate you as soon as possible (and in any event no later than the end of the Business Day after you tell us about the problem) by putting your account in the state it would have been in had the incorrect payment been sent as actually specified by the sender.\nThis means: <ul>\n<li>If the incorrect payment resulted in you having less money than you would have had if the payment had been made as actually specified, we will credit your account for the difference.</li>\n<li>If the incorrect payment resulted in you having more money than you would have had if the payment had been made as actually specified, we may debit the extra funds from your&nbsp;account.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>reimburse you in your account for your losses or damages directly and reasonably foreseeably caused by the incorrect payment.</li>\n</ul>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>\n<u>an unauthorised payment to another PayPal account, </u>\n</strong>as soon as possible (and in any event no later than the end of the Business Day after you tell us about the problem) we will put your account back to where it would have been had the payment never happened.&nbsp.\nThis can include a <u>reimbursement</u> of your payment.</li>\n</ul> When we can\u2019t compensate you...\n<p>You are not entitled to any financial compensation from us as outlined above and you will owe to us (and we may reverse from your account) any compensation you have already received from us if:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You do not give us all the information we reasonably requested as to the circumstances of the problem (including, if you tell us about your problem orally, you fail to comply with our request that you tell us about your problem in writing within 10&nbsp;<strong>Business Days</strong>);</li>\n<li>You do not take all reasonable steps that we request to assist us in our investigation;</li>\n<li>We can show that you acted fraudulently;</li>\n<li>We can show that circumstances beyond our control (such as fire or flood or loss of internet connection) caused the problem, despite our reasonable precautions;</li>\n<li>We have reason to believe otherwise that there is no problem which entitles you to compensation.\nor</li>\n<li>In respect of the following specific problems:</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>\n<u>Unexpected billing agreement payment</u>\n</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>\n<u>Incorrect payment</u>\n</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>\n<u>Unauthorised payment</u>\n</strong>\n</p>\n<p>It takes you longer than 8 weeks after the payment was made to tell us about the problem.\nor</p>\n<p>You agreed for us to make your payment and the details were made available to you by us or the merchant at least 4 weeks before the payment was made.</p>\n<p>It takes you longer than 13 months after the payment was made to tell us about the problem.\nor</p>\n<p>We can show that you gave us the wrong payment details.\nor</p>\n<p>We can show that the payment was sent as the payer specified when the payer asked us to make it.\nor</p>\n<p>Through no fault of ours, you did not have enough PayPal balance to complete the payment.\nor</p>\n<p>We can show our system was not working properly and you knew about the breakdown when you started the transaction.\nor</p>\n<p>A delay which you claimed caused the incorrect payment actually resulted from PayPal applying&nbsp;a <strong>hold, limitation or reserve </strong>\n<strong>under this user agreement</strong>\n</p>\n<p>It takes you longer than 13 months after the payment was made to tell us about the problem.\nor</p>\n<p>We can show that the payment was made because you did not keep your account safe either intentionally or with gross negligence (for instance, you very carelessly chose to share your PayPal ID and/or password/PIN with someone else).\nor</p>\n<p>There was <strong>another security /fraud problem</strong> and you didn\u2019t tell us about it.\nWe will not pay you compensation for any unauthorised payments made from your account before you told us about that problem.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Sometimes we might spot the problem first.&nbsp.\nIf we need to notify you about the problem, we will ordinarily do so through the Secure Messaging Centre, which you need to log into your account to access.\nIf you should take action urgently, we may also use other means such as email to request action.</p>\n<p>If a payment was made from us to your funding source by way of mistake, we may correct the mistake by debiting or crediting (as the case may be) your appropriate funding source(s).</p> Complaints Reporting disputes between you and PayPal regarding our services<p>Contact us&nbsp;to report disputes between you and PayPal regarding our services.</p>\n<p>If a dispute arises between you and PayPal, our goal is to learn about and address your concerns and, if we are unable to do so to your satisfaction, to provide you with a neutral and cost-effective means of resolving the dispute quickly.</p>If you\u2019re not happy with the outcome of the complaint process...\n<p>If the outcome of any complaint about our services, after completing the complaint escalation process, is not to your satisfaction, you can escalate it by contacting one of the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>European Consumer Centre (<strong>ECC-Net</strong>).\nYou may obtain further information regarding the ECC-Net and how to contact them at (<strong>https://ec.europa.eu/info/live-work-travel-eu/consumers/resolve-your-consumer-complaint/european-consumer-centres-network_en</strong>).</li>\n<li>Commission de Surveillance du Secteur Financier (CSSF).\nThe CSSF is the authority responsible for the prudential supervision of companies in the financial sector in Luxembourg, like us.\nYou can contact the CSSF at 283 Route d\u2019Arlon, L-1150 Luxembourg.\nYou may obtain further information regarding the CSSF and how to contact them at:&nbsp;<strong>https://www.cssf.lu</strong>&nbsp;or by visiting the EU\u2019s Online Dispute Resolution site at&nbsp;<strong>https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr</strong>.</li>\n</ul> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nOther Legal Terms Communications Between You and Us Contact us <p>You can contact us by:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>writing to us by post at our head office:&nbsp.\nPayPal (Europe) S.\u00e0 r.l.\net Cie, S.C.A.\nAttention: Legal Department, 22-24 Boulevard Royal L-2449, Luxembourg.\nor</li>\n<li>visiting our Contact Us page where you can: <ul>\n<li>click the \"Email Us\" link to contact us online.\nor</li>\n<li>click the \u201cCall Us\u201d link for our telephone number if you want to call us.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You must send legal notices in connection with this user agreement to us by postal mail.</p>Notices to you <p>You agree that we may provide notice or other information to you by posting it on the PayPal website(s) (including the posting of information which is only accessed by you by logging into your account), emailing it to the email address listed in your account, mailing it to the street address listed in your account, calling you by phone, or sending you a \u201ctext\u201d / SMS message.\nYou must have internet access and an e-mail account to receive communications and information relating to our services.\nWith the exception of amendments to this user agreement, such notice shall be considered to be received by you within 24 hours of the time it is posted to the PayPal website(s) or emailed to you.\nIf the notice is sent by mail, we will consider it to have been received by you three Business Days after it is sent.\nWe reserve the right to close your PayPal account if you withdraw your consent to receive electronic communications.</p> Disclosure of reasons for our actions <p>Our decision about holds, limitations, reserves and any other actions we take under this user agreement whether they restrict or extend your access to our service, our infrastructure, our websites, our software or our systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of our services) whether operated by us or on our behalf (including, without limitation, any blockages, limitations, suspensions, terminations, holds and reserves) may be based on confidential criteria that are essential to our management of risk and the protection of PayPal, our customers and/or service providers.&nbsp.\nWe may use proprietary fraud and risk modeling when assessing the risk associated with your PayPal account.&nbsp.\nIn addition, we may be restricted by regulation or a governmental authority from disclosing certain information to you about such decisions.&nbsp.\nWe have no obligation to disclose the details of our risk management or security procedures to you.</p> Our Rights Security interest <p>To secure your performance of this user agreement, you grant to us a legal claim against the funds in your PayPal account as security for any amount you may owe to us.\nThis is known in legal terms as a \u201clien\u201d on and \u201csecurity interest\u201d in your PayPal account.</p> Your liability <p>You are responsible for all reversals, chargebacks, claims, fees, fines, penalties and other liability incurred by PayPal, any PayPal user, or any third party caused by or arising out of your breach of this user agreement and/or your use of PayPal services irrespective of termination, suspension or closure You agree to reimburse PayPal, a user, or a third party for any and all such liability.&nbsp;</p> Reimbursement for your liability <p>You agree that we may set off any of the amounts held in accounts held or controlled by you with any fees, charges or other amounts you owe us and any such amounts you owe to our affiliates as defined in the Indemnification and Limitation of Liability section below (including, without limitation, in respect of any services provided by any such affiliate).\nIn simple terms, our right to set off means that we may deduct such fees, charges or other amounts mentioned in this section from a balance in a PayPal account held or controlled by you.</p>\n<p>If there are insufficient funds in your balance to cover your liability, we reserve the right to collect the amount you owe us by deducting the amount (or any part of it) from any payments received in or money you add to your PayPal account.&nbsp.\nOtherwise you agree to reimburse us through other means.\nWe may also recover amounts you owe us through legal means, including, without limitation, through the use of a debt collection agency.</p> Assumption of rights <p>If PayPal invalidates and reverses a payment that you made to a recipient (either at your initiative or otherwise), you agree that PayPal assumes your rights against the recipient and third parties related to the payment, and may pursue those rights directly or on your behalf, in PayPal\u2019s discretion.&nbsp.\nThis is known in legal terms as your \u201csubrogation\u201d or \u201cassignment\u201d to PayPal of your rights against the recipient and third parties related to the payment.</p> No waiver <p>Our failure to act with respect to a breach of any of your obligations under this user agreement by you or others does not waive our right to act with respect to subsequent or similar breaches.</p> Information about you <p>We may request information from you as we reasonably require to enable us to facilitate our actions described in this user agreement, reduce the risk of fraud or comply with our regulatory (including anti-money laundering) obligations.\nYou must comply with these requests in a timely fashion.\nThis may involve you faxing, emailing or otherwise providing to us at your own expense identification documents and information about your finance and operations (such as your most recent financial statements and merchant processing statements).</p> Indemnification and Limitation of Liability <p>In this section and the Intellectual Property section, we use the term \u201cPayPal\u201d to refer to us (PayPal (Europe) S.\u00e0 r.l.\net Cie, S.C.A.), our parent PayPal Holdings, Inc., our affiliates, and anybody who works for us or them or who is authorised to act on our or their behalf.&nbsp.\nOur affiliates include each entity that we control, we are controlled by or we are under common control with.\nAnybody who works for us or our affiliates or who is authorised to act on our or their behalf includes each of our or their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, joint venturers, service providers and suppliers.</p>Indemnification <p>You&nbsp;must indemnify PayPal for actions related to your PayPal account and your use of the PayPal services.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You agree to defend, indemnify and hold PayPal harmless from any claim or demand (including reasonable legal fees) made or incurred by any third party due to or arising out of:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>your breach of this user agreement;</li>\n<li>your improper use of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>your violation of any law or the rights of a third party.\nand/or</li>\n<li>the actions or inactions of any third party to whom you grant permissions to use your PayPal account or access our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, or any of the PayPal services on your behalf.</li>\n</ul> Limitation of liability <p>\n<strong>PayPal\u2019s&nbsp;liability is limited with respect to your PayPal account and your use of the PayPal services.&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>In no event shall PayPal be liable for:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>direct or indirect lost profits.\nor</li>\n<li>any special, incidental or consequential damages (including without limitation damages for loss of data or loss of business),</li>\n</ul>\n<p>arising out of or in connection with our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, any of the PayPal services, or this user agreement (however arising, including negligence), unless and to the extent prohibited by law.</p>\n<p>Our liability to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>you.\nor</li>\n<li>any third parties,</li>\n</ul>\n<p>in any circumstance is limited to the actual amount of direct damages (excluding direct loss of profits), unless and to the extent prohibited by law.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>In addition, to the extent permitted by applicable law, PayPal is not liable, and you agree not to hold PayPal responsible, for any damages or losses (including, but not limited to, loss of money, goodwill, or reputation, profits, or other intangible losses or any special, indirect, or consequential damages) resulting directly or indirectly from:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>your use of, or your inability to use, our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, or any of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>delays or disruptions in our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf and any of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>viruses or other malicious software obtained by accessing our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf or any of the PayPal services or any website or service linked to our websites, software &nbsp;or any of the PayPal services;</li>\n<li>glitches, bugs, errors, or inaccuracies of any kind in our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf or any of the PayPal services or in the information and graphics obtained from them;</li>\n<li>the content, actions, or inactions of third parties;</li>\n<li>a suspension or other action taken with respect to your PayPal account.\nand/or</li>\n<li>your need to modify your practices, content, or behavior, or your loss of or inability to do business, as a result of changes to this user agreement or PayPal\u2019s policies.</li>\n</ul> No warranty <p>The PayPal services are provided \u201cas-is\u201d and without any representation or warranty, whether express, implied or statutory.&nbsp.\nPayPal specifically disclaims any implied warranties of:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>title;</li>\n<li>merchantability;</li>\n<li>fitness for a particular purpose.\nand</li>\n<li>non-infringement.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>PayPal does not have any control over the products or services provided by sellers who accept PayPal as a payment method, and PayPal cannot ensure that a buyer or a seller you are dealing with will actually complete the transaction or is authorised to do so.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<p>PayPal does not guarantee continuous, uninterrupted or secure access to any part of the PayPal services.</p>\n<p>Operation of our websites, software, or systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf may be interfered with by numerous factors outside of our control.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<p>PayPal will make reasonable efforts to ensure that requests for electronic debits and credits involving bank accounts, debit cards, credit cards, and cheque issuances are processed in a timely manner but PayPal makes no representations or warranties regarding the amount of time needed to complete processing because the PayPal services are dependent upon many factors outside of our control, such as delays in the banking system or international mail service.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Some countries do not allow the disclaimer of implied warranties, so the foregoing disclaimers may not apply to you.</p>\n<p>We cannot guarantee the accuracy of information contained in our correspondence, reports, on the website(s) and given verbally by our directors, officers and staff in all circumstances and contexts, and no reliance should be placed on such information by you.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You must check all correspondence between us carefully and tell us as soon as possible if it includes something which appears to you to be wrong or not made in accordance with your instructions.</p> Release of PayPal consequential),</li>\n</ul>\n<p>of every kind and nature, known and unknown, arising out of or in any way connected with such disputes.</p>\n<p>In entering into this release you expressly waive any protections that would otherwise limit the coverage of this release to include only those claims which you may know or suspect to exist in your favour at the time of agreeing to this release.</p>\n<p>You alone (not PayPal) are responsible for understanding and complying with any and all laws, rules and regulations of your specific jurisdiction that may be applicable to you in connection with your use of our services (for example, in relation to regulated activity, licensed activity, export or import activity, taxes or foreign currency transactions).</p> Intellectual licensors.</p> License grants, generally <p>If you are using PayPal software such as an API, developer's toolkit or other software application, which may include software provided by or integrated with software, systems or services of our service providers, that you have downloaded or otherwise accessed through a web or mobile platform, then PayPal grants you a revocable, non-exclusive,
