may have (1) integrated certain third party materials and technology into any web or other application, including its software, and/or (2) accessed and used certain third party materials and technology to facilitate providing you with the PayPal Services, you have not been granted and do not otherwise retain any rights in or to any such third party materials.&nbsp.\nYou agree not to modify, alter, tamper with, repair, copy, reproduce, adapt, distribute, display, publish, reverse engineer, translate, disassemble, decompile or otherwise attempt to create any source code that is derived from the software or any third party materials or technology, or otherwise create any derivative works from any of the software or third party materials or technology.\n&nbsp;You acknowledge that all rights, title and interest to PayPal\u2019s software are owned by PayPal and any third-party materials integrated therein are owned PayPal\u2019s third party service providers.\n&nbsp;Any other third-party software application you use on PayPal\u2019s websites is subject to the license you agreed to with the third party that provides you with this software.\n&nbsp;You acknowledge that PayPal does not own, control nor have any responsibility or liability for any such third party software application you elect to use on any of our websites, software and/or in connection with the PayPal services.</p> License grant from you to PayPal.\nintellectual property warranties <p>PayPal does not claim ownership of the content that you provide, upload, submit or send to PayPal.\n&nbsp;Nor does PayPal claim ownership of the content you host on third-party websites or applications that use PayPal services to provide payments services related to your content.&nbsp.\nSubject to the&nbsp;next paragraph, when you provide content to the PayPal companies or post content using PayPal services, you grant PayPal (and parties that we work with) a non-exclusive, irrevocable, royalty-free, transferable, and worldwide license to use your content and associated intellectual property and publicity rights to help us improve, operate and promote our current services and develop new ones.&nbsp.\nPayPal will not compensate you for any of your content.\n&nbsp;You acknowledge that PayPal\u2019s use of your content will not infringe any intellectual property or publicity rights.\n&nbsp;Further, you acknowledge and warrant that you own or otherwise control all of the rights of the content you provide, and you agree to waive your moral rights and promise not to assert such rights against PayPal.</p> License grant from sellers to PayPal <p>Notwithstanding the provisions of the&nbsp;prior paragraph, if you are a seller using the PayPal services to accept payments for goods and services, you hereby grant PayPal a worldwide, non-exclusive, transferable, sublicensable (through multiple tiers), and royalty-free, fully paid-up, right to use and display publicly, during the term of this user agreement, your trademark(s) (including but not limited to registered and unregistered trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, domain names and other designations owned, licensed to or used by you) for the purpose of (1) identifying you as a merchant that accepts a PayPal service as a payment form, and (2) any other use to which you specifically consent.</p> Miscellaneous Assignment <p>You may not transfer or assign any rights or obligations you have under this user agreement without PayPal\u2019s prior written consent.&nbsp.\nPayPal may transfer or assign this user agreement or any right or obligation under this user agreement at any time.</p> Governing law <p>This user agreement and the relationship between us is governed by the laws of England and Wales.&nbsp.\nThis does not affect your mandatory rights under the laws of the country in which you reside, such as your rights as a consumer.</p>\n<p>If you bring a claim against us in court, you submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.\nThis means that if you were able to bring a claim arising from this user agreement against us in court, for example, an acceptable court would be a court located in England or Wales, but if the law allows you to do so, you can bring the claim in the court of another country instead, such as the country in which you reside.</p> Privacy <p>Protecting your privacy is very important to us.&nbsp.\nPlease review our&nbsp;Privacy Statement&nbsp;in order to better understand our commitment to maintaining your privacy, as well as our use and disclosure of your information.</p> Languages and translation of agreement <p>We will communicate with you in in the language(s) in which we have made available this user agreement to you.</p>\n<p>This user agreement is concluded in Dutch only.\nAny translation of this user agreement is provided solely for your convenience and is not intended to modify the terms of this user agreement.\n</p> Your use of information.\nData protection laws <p>If you receive information about another PayPal customer, you must keep the information confidential and only use it in connection with the PayPal services.&nbsp.\nYou may not disclose or distribute any information about PayPal users to a third party or use the information for marketing purposes unless you receive that user\u2019s express consent to do so.&nbsp.\nYou may not send unsolicited emails to a PayPal customer or use the PayPal services to collect payments for sending, or assist in sending, unsolicited emails to third parties.</p>\n<p>To the extent that you (as a seller) process any personal data about a PayPal customer pursuant to this user agreement, you agree to comply with the requirements of any applicable privacy and data protection laws.\nYou have your own, independently determined privacy policy, notices and procedures for any such personal data that you hold as a data controller, including a record of your activities related to processing of personal data under this user agreement.</p>\n<p>The privacy and data protection laws that may apply include any associated regulations, regulatory requirements and codes of practice applicable to the provision of the services described in this user agreement.\nIf you process personal data from Europe pursuant to this user agreement, you must comply with the EU Directive 95/46 EC or the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR).</p>\n<p>In complying with such laws, you will:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>implement and maintain all appropriate security measures for the processing of personal data;</li>\n<li>maintain a record of all processing activities carried out under this user agreement.\nand</li>\n<li>not knowingly do anything or permit anything to be done which might lead to a breach of any privacy data protection laws by PayPal.</li>\n</ul> Complete agreement and third party rights <p>This user agreement sets forth the entire understanding between you and us with respect to our service.</p>\n<p>If any provision of this user agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be struck out and the remaining provisions shall be enforced.</p>\n<p>A person who is not a party to this user agreement has no rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 to rely upon or enforce any term of this user agreement (except for the third parties&nbsp.\nfalling under the definition of \u201cPayPal\u201d in the <strong>\n<u>Indemnification and Limitation of Liability</u>\n</strong>&nbsp;section above, in respect of their rights as specified in this user agreement) but this does not affect any right or remedy of third parties which exists or is available apart from that act.</p> PayPal as Login Method <p>We may allow you to authenticate with PayPal when you log into certain external websites or mobile apps.\nIf we do so, we may share your login status with any third party enabling you to log in in this way, as well as the personal and other account information that you consent to being shared so that the third party can recognise you.\nPayPal will not give the third party access to your account and will only make payments from your account to that third party with your specific authorisation and instruction.</p>\n<p>If you enable visitors to authenticate with PayPal when they log into your website, app, or your customer accounts, you must agree to any specific terms applicable when this functionality is made available to you, and comply with any specifications in any integration manual or guideline.\nWe do not guarantee or otherwise represent the identity of any user of this login method.\nWe will not share with you the personal and other account information of the user (including login status) held by PayPal unless the user has consented to our disclosure of that information to you.</p> Corporate customers&nbsp.\n<p>When we refer to \u201cPSD2\u201d in this section we mean the Second EU Payment Services Directive ((EU)2015/2366).</p>\n<p>We consider you to be a \u201cCorporate Customer\u201d if, on the date you entered into this user agreement, you are not:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>a consumer, (being an individual acting for purposes other than a trade, business or profession).\nand</li>\n<li>a micro-enterprise (being an enterprise which employs fewer than 10 persons and has an annual balance sheet that does not exceed 2 million EUR).</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We may Agreement <br>\n<p>Last Update: Mar 08, 2007</p> Print <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>PARTIES TO THIS AGREEMENT</strong>\n<p>This eBay Billing Agreement (\"Billing Agreement\") is between PayPal, Inc., PayPal CA Limited, and PayPal Pte.\nLtd.\n(collectively \"PayPal\"), eBay Inc.\n(\"eBay\") and you.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>AUTHORIZATION TO CHARGE YOUR PAYPAL ACCOUNT FOR EBAY FEES</strong>\n<p>By agreeing to these terms, you are giving eBay permission to charge your PayPal account on a one-time, sporadic, or recurring basis to collect fees that you owe eBay, unless and until you cancel your Billing Agreement.\nYou authorize PayPal to pay from your PayPal account the full amount of fees presented by eBay.\nPayPal will not initiate payments on its own under this Billing Agreement.\nit will only pay out charges initiated by eBay.\neBay will present you with an invoice at least 10 days in advance of charging your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>PayPal will become your payment method on file with eBay for automatic payment of your eBay selling fees.\nIf you previously had another payment method on file for automatic payment of fees, PayPal will replace that method.</p>\n<p>If you change the website of registration of your eBay account (for example, you change registration from eBay.com to eBay.ca), this Billing Agreement will be cancelled.\nIf you change the currency of your eBay account, you will need to again specify PayPal as your automatic payment method for your account in the new currency.\nIf this Billing Agreement is cancelled, or if the payment of your eBay fees through PayPal cannot be completed for any reason, you remain obligated to pay eBay for all unpaid fees, and eBay may charge a payment method previously on file with eBay for payment of your selling fees, such as a credit card or checking account.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>FUNDING SOURCE USE</strong>\n<p>When eBay charges your PayPal account, PayPal will always attempt to withdraw funds from your PayPal balance first.\nIf funds in your balance are insufficient, PayPal will look for and attempt to charge a Preferred Funding Source that you have set up for this Billing Agreement.\nIf the Preferred Funding Source fails (for example, a credit card expires), then PayPal will use other available funding sources within your PayPal account.\nYou will have the ability to disable funding sources for use with this Billing Agreement, with the exception that if you have one or more credit or debit cards linked to your PayPal account, then at least one of those cards must be enabled for billing.</p>\n<p>You will be able to select or deselect a Preferred Funding Source, and to enable or disable other funding sources, both within the enrollment flow, and at any time through the Direct Payments link under the Account Profile tab when you log in to the PayPal website.</p>\n</li>\n</ol> ", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:28:10.902Z", "updated_at": "2019-05-12T22:28:11.945Z"}, {"id": "1289", "name": "PayPal Receive Funds and Automatic Transfer Agreement", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/sg/webapps/mpp/ua/recpymt-full", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/section", "text": " PayPal Receive Funds and Automatic Transfer Agreement &nbsp.\n<p>&gt;&gt.\nView all legal agreements</p> PayPal Receive Funds and Automatic Transfer Agreement <p>Last Update: October 8, 2014</p> Print <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This policy applies to users in the following countries: Albania, Algeria, Antigua and Barbuda, Barbados, Belize, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dominica, Egypt, Fiji, French Polynesia, Grenada, Lesotho, Malawi, New Caledonia, Palau, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Seychelles, Trinidad and Tobago, Turks and Caicos.</p>\n<p>This PayPal Receive Funds and Automatic Transfer Agreement (\"Agreement\") is a contract between you and PayPal.\nThis Agreement applies to you in addition to the User Agreement and other applicable agreements.\nAll capitalized terms shall have the definitions provided in this Agreement, or if a definition is not provided in this Agreement, the definition in the User Agreement shall apply.\nYou must read, agree with and accept all of the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement.\nWe may amend this Agreement at any time by posting a revised version on our website.\nThe revised version will be effective at the time we post it.\nIn addition, if the revised version includes a Substantial Change, we will provide you with 30 Days' prior notice of Substantial Change by posting notice on the \"Policy Updates\" page of our website.</p>\n<p>PayPal Receive Funds and Automatic Transfer allows you to receive payments into your PayPal account and have those amounts automatically transferred to your linked US bank account or Visa credit card.\nAll payments that you receive are subject to a 30-day hold period.\nPlease read these terms and conditions to understand PayPal\u2019s requirements for receiving payments.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 1.\nEligibility: <ol>\n<li>In order to receive payments into your PayPal account, you must link your US bank account or Visa credit card to your PayPal account and complete PayPal\u2019s credit card and/or bank account verification process.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 2.\nAutomatic Transfer: <ol>\n<li>On a regular basis, PayPal will automatically transfer the amounts from your available PayPal Balance to your US bank account or Visa credit card.</li>\n<li>The automatic transfer will occur within the first 3 days of each month, quarter, or applicable period in the country in which you reside.</li>\n<li>There is no fee for automatic transfers to your US bank account or Visa credit card.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 3.\nManual Transfer and Fee: <ol>\n<li>If you do not want to wait for the automatic transfer, you may manually transfer the amounts in your available PayPal balance to your US bank account or Visa credit card.\n<ol>\n<li>Manual transfers to your Visa credit card will incur a $5.00 USD (or equivalent) fee.</li>\n<li>Manual transfers to your US bank account are free.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 4.\nPayment Hold Period: <ol>\n<li>All payments that you receive will be subject to an initial 30 day hold period and will be placed in a pending balance.\nThis means that you will not have access to your funds for at least 30 days.</li>\n<li>After the initial 30 day hold period, your funds will be released to your available balance unless PayPal is holding the amounts for another reason as specified in the PayPal User Agreement, or other agreement that you have entered into with PayPal.</li>\n<li>PayPal, in its sole discretion, may determine that you are no longer subject to an initial 30 day hold period.\nIn such an event, payments you receive into your PayPal account will appear in your available balance soon after you receive the payment.\nPayPal will base its decision to remove the 30 day hold period on a number of factors including but not limited to the following: the length of time you have been a PayPal customer, the type of goods or services that you sell, and the number of customer complaints that you receive.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 5.\nWithdrawal Limits: <ol>\n<li>Automatic transfers to your Visa credit card are limited to $10,000 USD (or equivalent) per transfer.</li>\n<li>Manual transfers to a Visa credit card are limited to $500 USD (or equivalent) per day.</li>\n<li>The daily limit of transfers to your Visa credit card (total of automatic and manual transfers) is $10,000 USD (or equivalent).</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 6.\nFinancial Instruments (linked US bank account or Visa credit card): <ol>\n<li>If you have more than one financial instrument linked to your PayPal account, PayPal will use the first financial instrument that you linked to your PayPal account for automatic transfers.\n<ol>\n<li>This means that if you link a Visa credit card to your PayPal account one day, and then link a second Visa credit card to your account the next day, PayPal will use the first Visa credit card for the automatic transfer.</li>\n<li>You may change this by going to the \u201cProfile\u201d page, selecting \u201cManage Automatic Transfer\u201d, and following the instructions to select your preferred financial instrument for automatic transfers.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>If you remove your US bank account and/or Visa credit card, PayPal will request that you add a new financial instrument to your PayPal account.\nIf you do not do so, you will lose the ability to receive payments.</li>\n<li>If PayPal is unable to transfer your balance to your US bank account and/or Visa credit card for any reason, then PayPal will give you a limited amount of time to add a new financial instrument to your PayPal account.\nIf you do not do so, you will lose the ability to receive payments.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 7.\nRestriction on Sending Payments: <ol>\n<li>You may use your credit card to send payments.\nYou may not use your PayPal balance or US bank account to send payments.\nAll amounts in your available PayPal balance must be withdrawn from your PayPal account through automatic and/or manual transfer.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> 8.\nTransaction Fees for Receiving Payments: <ol>\n<li>Transaction Fees: Standard Rate and Merchant Rate <p>\n<strong>Monthly Payment Volume</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Fee</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Rate Category</strong>\n</p> $0.01 - $3,000.00 USD (or equivalent) 4.9% + Fixed Fee Standard Rate $3,000,01 - $10,000.00 USD (or equivalent) 4.4% + Fixed Fee Merchant Rate $10,000.01 - $100,000.00 USD (or equivalent) 4.2% + Fixed Fee Merchant Rate $100,000.01 and over USD (or equivalent) 3.9% + Fixed Fee Merchant Rate </li>\n<li>Fixed Fee <p>\n<strong>Currency</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Fixed Fee</strong>\n</p> Australian Dollar: $0.30 AUD Brazilian Real: R$0.60 BRL Canadian Dollar: $0.30 CAD Czech Koruna: 10.00 CZK Danish Kroner: 2.60 DKK Euro: \u20ac0.35 EUR Hong Kong Dollar: $2.35 HKD Hungarian Forint: 90 HUF Israeli Shekel: 1.20 ILS Japanese Yen: \u00a540 JPY Malaysian Ringgit: 2.00 MYR Mexican Peso: 4.00 MXN New Zealand Dollar: $0.45 NZD Norwegian Krone: 2.80 NOK Philippine Peso: 15.00 PHP Polish Zlotych: 1.35 PLN Singapore Dollar: $0.50 SGD Swedish Krona: 3.25 SEK Swiss Franc: 0.55 CHF New Taiwan Dollar: $10 TWD Thai Baht: 11 THB U.K.\nPounds Sterling: \u00a30.20 GBP U.S.\nDollar: $0.30 USD </li>\n<li>The Transaction Fee applies to all amounts you receive into your PayPal account for commercial transactions, including amounts that are placed in a pending balance.\nThe Transaction Fee is a percentage of the transaction plus a fixed amount based on the currency of the payment you receive.</li>\n<li>To receive the Merchant Rate, you must submit an application to PayPal through a link on the PayPal website, maintain qualifying monthly payment volume, and be in good standing with PayPal.\nIf you do not submit an application for the Merchant Rate, you will continue to pay the Standard Rate even if you have qualifying monthly payment volume.</li>\n<li>The fees in this section do not apply to Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Egypt.\nIn these countries, the Fees for receiving commercial transactions as listed in the User Agreement shall apply.</li>\n</ol> ", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:28:39.677Z", "updated_at": "2019-05-12T22:32:17.930Z"}, {"id": "1287", "name": "COMMERCIAL ENTITY AGREEMENT FOR PAYPAL PAYMENT CARD FUNDED PROCESSING SERVICES", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/sg/webapps/mpp/ua/ceagreement-full", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/section/div", "text": " COMMERCIAL ENTITY AGREEMENT FOR PAYPAL PAYMENT CARD FUNDED PROCESSING SERVICES &nbsp.\n<p>This Commercial Entity Agreement for PayPal Payment Card Funded Processing Services (\u201cCommercial Entity Agreement\u201d or \"CEA\") is agreed with all PayPal Users that are Commercial Entities (as defined by Visa Europe, Visa Inc, Visa International, Mastercard Worldwide, UK Maestro, Solo and/or International Maestro (together the \"Associations\")).\nEach such PayPal User is referred to as \u201cMerchant\u201d and may be referred to herein as \u201cyou\u201d and/or \u201cyour\u201d.\nThis CEA constitutes your separate legally binding contract for credit and debit card processing for PayPal transactions between you and the Acquirer (as defined below).</p>\n<p>For the purposes of this CEA, \"Acquirer\" shall mean (a) Worldpay (UK) Limited if Merchant is based in Europe.\nand/or (b) Worldpay PTE Ltd if Merchant is based in Singapore.\nand/or (c) Worldpay (HK) Limited if Merchant is based in Hong Kong.\nand/or (d) Citizens Bank, N.A.\nif Merchant is based in the United States and/or (d) Worldpay PTY.\nLtd if Merchant is based in Australia.\nIn this CEA \"we\", \"us\" and \"our\" refer to Acquirer.</p>\n<p>In accordance with the provisions of this CEA, Acquirer may terminate its provision of credit and debit card processing services and require PayPal to enforce any of the provisions of Merchant\u2019s agreement(s) with PayPal (\"PayPal Agreement\"), agreed by and between Merchant and PayPal.</p>\n<p>Merchant agrees to the terms and conditions of this CEA.\nMerchant further agrees that this CEA forms a legally binding contract between Merchant and Acquirer.\nPayPal is not a party to this contract and acts only as Acquirer\u2019s agent in connection with it.\nIf we propose to change this CEA in a substantial manner, PayPal will provide you on our behalf with at least 30 days' (or such minimum period as is required by law) prior notice of such a change.\nAfter the notice period elapses, you will be deemed to have agreed to all such amendments to the CEA.\nTo amend this CEA but not in a substantial manner, PayPal will post on our behalf a revised version of the CEA on the PayPal website(s), and the revised version will be effective at the time PayPal posts it.\n&nbsp;If you disagree with any proposed amendments, you may close your PayPal account before the expiry of the notice &nbsp;period provided in the notice and otherwise in accordance with the terms of the PayPal Agreement, and this CEA will terminate on the closure of your account.\nA change to this CEA will be considered to be made in a \u201csubstantial manner\u201d if the change involves a reduction to your rights or increases your responsibilities.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Purpose of this CEA.</strong> When your customers pay you through PayPal, they have the option of paying you through a funding source supported by PayPal including a card.\nIn most instances, you will not know the funding source that your customer selected.\nSince you may be the recipient of a card funded payment, the Associations require that you enter into a direct contractual relationship with an acquirer who is a member of the Associations.\nBy entering into this CEA, you are fulfilling such Association requirement and you are agreeing to comply with Association rules as they pertain to payments you receive through the PayPal service.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Obligations of Acquirer.&nbsp.\n</strong>\n<ol>\n<li>Acquirer\u2019s obligations under this CEA are limited exclusively to the processing of Merchant's card transactions in the territory in which the Merchant is based and the receipt and disbursement of related funds to PayPal for the account of the Merchant (the \u201cAcquiring Services\u201d).&nbsp.\nAll other obligations relating to the provision of the services under the PayPal Agreement are the responsibility of PayPal and any issue, dissatisfaction, dispute and/or service dispute of the Merchant relating to any services provided to the Merchant should be notified to and brought against PayPal in the first instance.</li>\n<li>Subject to the terms of this CEA and the PayPal Agreement, Acquirer will initiate a payment to the designated account (as made known to Acquirer by PayPal) of an amount equal to the value of card transactions processed by Acquirer for the Merchant under this CEA (less deductions for refunds, fines, assessments, chargebacks, chargeback costs, fees or other Merchant liabilities (whether actual or anticipated) under this CEA or the PayPal Agreement).\n&nbsp;Any obligation of Acquirer to remit funds under this CEA is subject to any rights of Acquirer under its agreement with PayPal.</li>\n<li>Merchant agrees that any payment made to PayPal by Acquirer under this CEA will be deemed good receipt by Merchant of the sums due from Acquirer to Merchant in relation to Acquirer\u2019s liability to Merchant under this CEA.\nMerchant shall indemnify Acquirer and keep Acquirer indemnified against all losses, costs, claims, demands, expenses (including legal expenses) and liabilities of any nature (including any re-settlement obligations under the Association rules) arising from or relating to the payment of funds by Acquirer into an account in the name of PayPal in accordance with the terms of this CEA.</li>\n<li>Throughout the term of this CEA and after its termination for any reason, Acquirer shall be entitled to defer (for such period as it shall in its reasonable discretion consider appropriate) the date upon which the payment of funds in respect of card transactions would (but for this clause) be due in order to protect its position with respect to actual or anticipated chargebacks, fines, assessments, refunds, chargeback costs, fees, fraud, illegal activity or any other liability of Merchant or relating to any card transactions or under this CEA or the PPA, whether actual or anticipated.&nbsp.\nAmounts so deferred may be set-off against any actual chargebacks, fines, assessments, refunds, chargeback costs, fees or any other liability of Merchant.&nbsp;&nbsp.\nThe Merchant understands and acknowledges that during the term of this CEA and after its termination for any reason whatsoever, the Merchant shall continue to bear total responsibility for all chargebacks, chargeback costs, refunds, fines, assessments, fees, fraud and illegal activity resulting in any way from card transactions processed pursuant to this CEA and all other amounts then due or which thereafter may become due under this CEA or the PayPal Agreement.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Association Rules.</strong>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Deposit Transactions.</strong> Merchant agrees that it shall only accept payments through PayPal processing services for bona fide transactions between the Merchant and its customer for the sale of goods or services.\nMerchant shall not submit a transaction for the refinance or transfer of an existing obligation that was uncollectible.\nMerchant acknowledges that for Visa and Mastercard payments, PayPal shall obtain an authorization for transaction amounts prior to completing the transaction.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Split Transactions.</strong> Merchant agrees not to split the sale into two (or more) separate amounts in order to avoid obtaining authorization for the full amount.\nExcept, however in an instance where the Merchant and cardholder agree on a partial shipment of product, or where the transaction qualifies for delayed delivery or special order deposits (such as partial shipments based on inventory on hand), a sale may be split into multiple transactions.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Minimum or Maximum/Surcharges.</strong> Merchant agrees that it shall not set minimum or maximum transaction amounts or impose surcharges as a condition of honoring Visa and Mastercard cards, unless otherwise permitted in the particular jurisdiction of a transaction.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Visa and Mastercard Marks.</strong> Merchant is authorized to and must use the Visa and Mastercard logos or marks on Merchant\u2019s promotional materials and website to indicate that Visa and Mastercard cards are accepted as funding sources for PayPal transactions.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Discrimination.</strong> Merchant agrees that it shall not engage in any acceptance practice that discriminates against or discourages the use of Visa or Mastercard in favour of any other card brand unless otherwise permitted in the particular jurisdiction of a transaction.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Access to Cardholder Data.</strong> Merchant acknowledges that where it has access to Cardholder Data (defined as the cardholder\u2019s card number, expiration date, and CVV2) it will abide by any data security standards of the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council (or any replacement body), Visa or Mastercard, including the Payment Card Industry SSC Standards.\nIn addition you agree to comply with the data security standards required by PayPal under the PayPal Agreement, as may be amended from time to time.&nbsp.\n.\nIn the event that Merchant receives Cardholder Data in connection with the PayPal processing services, Merchant agrees that it will not use the Cardholder Data for any purpose that it knows or should know to be fraudulent or in violation of any Association rules.\nMerchant also agrees that it will not sell, purchase, provide or exchange in any manner or disclose Cardholder Data to anyone other than its acquirer, Visa or Mastercard (as applicable) or in response to a government request.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Merchant Identification.</strong> Merchant agrees to prominently and unequivocally inform the cardholder of the identity of the Merchant at all points of interaction including the location (physical address) of the Merchant to enable the cardholder to easily determine whether the transaction will be a domestic transaction or a cross-border transaction.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Chargebacks.</strong> Merchant shall use all reasonable methods to resolve disputes with the cardholder.\nShould a chargeback dispute occur, Merchant shall promptly comply with all requests for information from PayPal.\nMerchant shall not attempt to recharge a cardholder for an item that has been charged back to the cardholder, unless the cardholder has authorized such actions.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Merchant\u2019s Refund Policy must be on Merchant\u2019s Website.</strong> If Merchant limits refund/exchange terms or other specific conditions for Card sales, Merchant\u2019s policy must be clearly provided to the cardholder prior to the sale and Merchant must conform with all applicable laws and the Association rules.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Audit</strong>.&nbsp.\nUpon Acquirer\u2019s request, the Merchant must promptly disclose to Acquirer such information as Acquirer reasonably requires in order to enable Acquirer to perform its obligations, and/or assess its financial and insurance risks in connection with the services provided, and/or to assess the Merchant\u2019s compliance with the terms of the CEA and/or the Association rules.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Term and Termination.</strong> This CEA is effective upon the date the PayPal Agreement between Merchant and PayPal comes into force and continues so long as the PayPal Agreement remains in force between Merchant and PayPal but shall automatically terminate without notice on termination of such PayPal Agreement for any reason, provided that those terms which by their nature are intended to survive termination (including without limitation, indemnification obligations and limitations of liability) shall survive.\nThis CEA may be terminated by Acquirer at any time in the event of a breach of any of Merchant\u2019s obligations under this CEA or the PayPal Agreement, or by Merchant in the event of a breach of any of Acquirer\u2019s obligations under this CEA, or by Acquirer in the event of the termination of the acquiring services agreement entered into between PayPal (or its applicable group company) and Acquirer as notified to the Merchant.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Indemnification.</strong> Merchant agrees to indemnify and hold Acquirer harmless from and against all losses, liabilities, damages and expense: (a) resulting from any breach of any warranty, covenant or agreement or any misrepresentation by Merchant under this CEA.\n(b) arising out of Merchant\u2019s or its employees\u2019 negligence or willful misconduct, (c) arising in connection with Card transactions or otherwise arising from Merchant\u2019s provision of goods and services to Cardholders or customers.\n(d) arising out of Merchant\u2019s use of the PayPal Service.\nor (e) resulting from any fines or arising out of any third party indemnifications&nbsp;Acquirer is obligated to make as a result of Merchant\u2019s actions (including indemnification of any Association or Card issuing bank).</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Assignment/Amendments.</strong> This CEA may not be assigned by Merchant without the prior written consent of Acquirer.\nAcquirer may assign its rights under this CEA without Merchant\u2019s consent.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Warranty Disclaimer.</strong> This CEA is a service agreement.\nAcquirer disclaims all representations or warranties, express or implied, made to Merchant or any other person, including without limitation, any warranties regarding quality, suitability, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose or otherwise of any services or any goods provided incidental to the services provided under this CEA to the extent permitted by law.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Limitation of Liability.</strong> Notwithstanding anything in this CEA to the contrary, in no event shall Acquirer, or any of its directors, officers, employees, agents or subcontractors, be liable under any theory of tort, contract, strict liability or other legal theory for lost profits, lost revenues, lost business opportunities, exemplary, punitive, special, incidental, indirect or consequential damages, each of which is hereby excluded by agreement of the parties, regardless of whether such damages were foreseeable or whether Acquirer has been advised of the possibility of such damages.\nNotwithstanding anything in this CEA to the contrary, in no event shall Acquirer be liable or responsible for any delays or errors in its performance of the services caused by its service providers or other parties or events outside of Acquirer\u2019s reasonable control, including PayPal.\nNotwithstanding anything in this CEA to the contrary, Acquirer\u2019s cumulative liability for all losses, claims, suits, controversies, breaches or damages for any cause whatsoever arising out of or related to this CEA and regardless of the form of action or legal theory and whether or not arising in contract or tort (including negligence) shall not exceed the total volume of all transactions, expressed as a U.S.\ndollar amount processed by the Merchant under this CEA via PayPal.\nNothing in this CEA shall exclude or limit any liability of any party for death or personal injury caused by negligence or fraud, deceit or fraudulent misrepresentation, howsoever caused.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Waiver.</strong> The failure of a party to assert any of its rights under this CEA, including, but not limited to, the right to terminate this CEA in the event of breach or default by the other party, will not be deemed to constitute a waiver by that party of its right to enforce each and every provision of this CEA in accordance with its terms.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Relationship between the Parties.</strong> No agency, partnership, joint venture or employment relationship is created between Merchant and Acquirer by way of this CEA.\nIn the performance of their respective obligations hereunder, the parties are, and will be, independent contractors.\nNothing in this CEA will be construed to constitute either party as the agent for the other for any purpose whatsoever.\nNeither party will bind, or attempt to bind, the other party to any contract or the performance of any obligation, and neither party will represent to any third party that it has any right to enter into any binding obligation on the other party's behalf.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>No Illegal Use of Services.</strong> Merchant will not access and/or utilize the Acquiring Services for illegal purposes and will not interfere or disrupt networks connected with the Acquiring Services.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Severability.</strong> Whenever possible, each provision of this CEA will be interpreted in such a manner as to be effective and valid under applicable law, but if any provision hereof will be prohibited by or determined to be invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, such provision will be ineffective to the extent of such prohibition or invalidity, without invalidating the remainder of such provision or the remaining provisions of this CEA.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Governing Law.</strong> This CEA (and the relationships referred to or contemplated by it) shall be governed and construed in accordance with English law and the parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales with respect to any dispute hereunder.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Date:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp.\nJuly 2017</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> ", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:27:24.672Z", "updated_at": "2019-05-12T22:27:26.047Z"}, {"id": "1286", "name": "PayPal Shops Policy ", "url": <br>\n<p>Last Update: Mar 08, 2007</p> Print <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>The terms below apply specifically to use of the PayPal Shops feature, which enables Users to display information about their website to other Users through the www.paypal.com website.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Accuracy of website registration information.</strong> All information you provide at the time of PayPal Shops registration must be truthful, including the website's title, description, category, and all other requested information.\nIf any change occurs in your PayPal Shops registration information, you must promptly update the information through the PayPal website.\nFailure to comply will result in the removal of any mention of your website from the PayPal website, and may result in permanent ineligibility from registering a website with PayPal.\nProvision of deceptive information may result in the locking or closing of your PayPal account.\nYou grant PayPal the right to access your site through manual observation or automated \"spidering\" or other automated search techniques in order to confirm the accuracy of your registration information.\nPayPal is under no obligation to monitor the accuracy of your site.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Eligibility.<br>\n<br>\n</strong>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>U.S.\nUsers.</strong> U.S.\nUsers who meet the following conditions are eligible to register a website in PayPal Shops:<ol>\n<li>The User has a Verified Premier or Business</li>\n<li>The User maintains a registered credit card with their PayPal account.</li>\n<li>The User has opened a PayPal Money Market Fund account.</li>\n</ol> If at any time the owner of a registered Shop no longer meets one or more of the requirements listed above that website will cease to be listed in the PayPal Shops directory.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Canadian Users.</strong> Canadian Users who meet the following conditions are eligible to register a website in PayPal Shops:<ol>\n<li>The User has a Verified Premier or Business Account.</li>\n<li>The User has been in the PayPal system for no less than 90 days.</li>\n<li>The User has a Seller Reputation Number of at least 10.</li>\n</ol> If at any time the owner of a registered Shop no longer meets one or more of the requirements listed above, that website will cease to be registered with PayPal and listed in the PayPal Shops directory.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Non-U.S.\nor Canadian Users.</strong> Users outside the U.S.\nand Canada may not register a new Shop for PayPal Shops.\nUsers with existing Shops may continue to have their Shop listed and should contact customer service to make modifications to their Shop.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Website must accept PayPal payments.</strong> This website must accept PayPal payments.\nIf an investigation of your website shows that it does not accept PayPal payments, it may be removed from the PayPal Shops Directory.\nYou may re-register your website for PayPal Shops when it accepts PayPal payments.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Other.</strong> By registering for PayPal Shops, you grant PayPal the right to run a credit check on you or your business at any time.\nPayPal reserves the right to remove the listing of any website from the PayPal Shops directory at any time, for any reason.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>License to Use Your Information.</strong> You remain the owner of the Website registration information that you provide to PayPal, but by providing such information to PayPal, you are granting PayPal permission to use the information in connection with the PayPal Shops service.\nSpecifically, you grant PayPal a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, royalty-free license to copy, publish and display your Website registration information on the PayPal website or in e-mail messages related to your PayPal transactions, subject to compliance with PayPal's Privacy Policy.\nThis license will end upon termination of your membership in PayPal Shops, whether such termination is caused by you or by PayPal.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>No Endorsement.</strong> PayPal's presentation of website registration information is not an endorsement of the website or of any goods or services offered on the website.\nAny attempt to state or imply PayPal's endorsement of your goods or services constitutes grounds for immediate termination of your participation in PayPal Shops.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>No Illegal Websites or Websites which violate the PayPal Acceptable Use Policy.</strong> You may not register a website that promotes or facilitates illegal actions, including but not limited to the sale of goods or services that infringe on the intellectual property of a third party.\nYou also may not register a website that violates the rules outlined in the PayPal Acceptable Use Policy.\nAny such registration constitutes ground for immediate termination of your participation in PayPal Shops and immediate closure of your PayPal account.\nAll such actions may also violate your Wells Fargo requirements and/or Mastercard/VISA regulations or policy and as such constitute grounds for termination of your card accounts with these organizations.\nSuch termination may result in you being prohibited against registering a new account with any Mastercard or VISA acquiring Bank.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Shopping at Websites Registered with PayPal.</strong> Website registration information is provided by the owner of the website, and PayPal is not responsible for any errors or misrepresentations in such information.\nPayPal specifically disclaims all warranties with respect to website registration information, including but not limited to the warranty of merchantability and the warranty of accuracy of informational content.\nPayPal does not guarantee any level of security in shopping at third-party websites registered with PayPal, nor does PayPal guarantee the quality of goods or services offered on these websites.\nFor more information on security in Web shopping, please visit our Security Tips page.<br>\n<br>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Fees.</strong> Placement in PayPal Shops is currently free.\nFees may be introduced in the future, but no changes will be made without first notifying you.</li>\n</ol> ", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:26:03.032Z", "updated_at": "2019-05-12T22:26:04.157Z"}, {"id": "1285", "name": "PayPal Local Payment Methods Terms", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/sg/webapps/mpp/ua/lpm-tnc", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/section/div", "text": "", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:25:00.278Z", "updated_at": "2020-12-14T22:08:31.533Z"}, {"id": "1284", "name": "Privacy Statement", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/sg/webapps/mpp/ua/privacy-full", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/section/div", "text": "<p>&gt;&gt.\nView all legal agreements</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Privacy Statement <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Effective Date: July 24, 2020</p> Print <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>Overview</p>\n<p>What Personal Data Do We Collect?</p>\n<p>Why Do We Retain Personal Data?</p>\n<p>How Do We Process Personal Data?&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Do We Share Personal Data?&nbsp;</p>\n<p>How Do We Work with Other Services and Platforms?&nbsp;</p>\n<p>How Do We Use Cookies and Tracking Technologies?</p>\n<p>What Privacy Choices Are Available To You?</p>\n<p>How Do We Protect Your Personal Data?</p>\n<p>Can Children Use Our Services?&nbsp;</p>\n<p>What Else Should You Know?</p>\n<p>Contact Us</p>\n<p>Definitions</p>\n<p>Additional Information</p>\n<p>\n<br> &nbsp;</p> 1.\nOverview <p>PayPal has developed this Privacy Statement to explain how we may collect, retain, process, share and transfer your Personal Data when you visit our Sites or use our Services.\nThis Privacy Statement applies to your Personal Data when you visit Sites or use Services, and does not apply to online websites or services that we do not own or control, including websites or services of other PayPal Users.</p>\n<p>This Privacy Statement is designed to help you obtain information about our privacy practices and to help you understand your privacy choices when you use our Sites and Services.\nPlease note that our Service offerings may vary by region.</p>\n<p>We have defined some terms that we use throughout the Privacy Statement.&nbsp.\nYou can find the meaning of a capitalized term in the Definitions section.</p>\n<p>Please contact us if you have questions about our privacy practices that are not addressed in this Privacy Statement.</p> 2.\nWhat Personal Data Do We Collect? <p>We may collect information about you when you visit our Sites or use our Services, including the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Registration and use information \u2013 </strong>When you register to use our Services by establishing an Account, we will collect Personal Data as necessary to offer and fulfill the Services you request.\n&nbsp;Depending on the Services you choose, we may require you to provide us with your name, postal address, telephone number, email address and identification information to establish an Account.\n&nbsp;We may require you to provide us with additional Personal Data as you use our Services.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Transaction and experience information \u2013</strong> When you use our Services or access our Sites, for example, to make purchases from merchants, to receive money, to process payments, or to send money to friends and family, we collect information about the transaction, as well as other information associated with the transaction such as amount sent or requested, amount paid for products or services, merchant information, including information about any funding instruments used to complete the transaction, Device Information, Technical Usage Data, and Geolocation Information.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Participant information \u2013</strong> When you use our Services or access our Sites, we collect Personal Data you provide us about the other participants associated with the transaction.<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Send or request money: &nbsp;</strong>When you send or request money through the Services, we collect Personal Data such as name, postal address, telephone number, and financial account information about the participant who is receiving money from you or sending money to you.\n&nbsp;The extent of Personal Data required about a participant may vary depending on the Services you are using to send or request money.\n&nbsp;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Pay or request someone else to pay a bill: </strong>&nbsp;If you use our Services to pay a bill for the benefit of someone else, or if you request a User to pay a bill for you, we collect Personal Data from you about the account holder such as name, postal address, telephone number, email address, and account number of the bill that you intend to pay or request to be paid.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Add value to your accounts: </strong>&nbsp;If you use our Services to add value to your Account or any other account you may have, or if you ask a User to add value to any of these accounts, we may collect Personal Data from you about the other party, or from the other party about you to facilitate the request.\n&nbsp;For example, if you use our Services to reload a mobile phone, or to request value be added to your mobile account, we may collect Personal Data and other information including mobile account number from the other participant.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Information about your public profile and your friends and contacts \u2013&nbsp;</strong>It may be easier for us to help you transact with your friends and contacts if you choose to connect your contact list information with your Account or if your Account profile is publicly available.\nIf you establish an account connection between your device or a social media platform and your Account, we will use your contact list information (such as name, address, email address) to improve your experience when you use the Services.\nWhen your Account profile is public, other users can find your profile to send you money by searching for you by name, username, email, or mobile number on PayPal and confirm it\u2019s you by viewing your photo.\nYou can make your Account profile private anytime in your PayPal.me settings.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Information that you choose to provide us to obtain additional Services or specific online Services \u2013 </strong>If you request or participate in an optional Site feature, or request enhanced Services or other elective functionality, we may collect additional information from you.&nbsp.\nWe will provide you with a separate notice at the time of collection, if the use of that information differs from the uses disclosed in this Privacy Statement.\n&nbsp;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Personal Data about you if you use unbranded Services \u2013 </strong>certain Services are available without being required to log in to or establish an Account.\nWe will collect Personal Data when you are interacting with and making payments to merchants using our card payment services that do not carry the PayPal brand and when you checkout with PayPal without logging into an account.\nFor our unbranded payment services, your interaction is with the merchant, on their platform.\nIf you are an Account holder, or create an Account at a later date, we may collect information about unbranded transactions and associate them with your Account to improve your customer experience as an Account holder and for compliance and analytics purposes.\nIf you are not an Account holder, we will collect and store all information you provide and use such information in accordance with this Privacy Statement.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Information about you from third-party sources \u2013 </strong>We obtain information from third-party sources such as merchants, data providers, and credit bureaus, where permitted by law.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Other information we collect related to your use of our Sites or Services \u2013</strong> We may collect additional information from or about you when you communicate with us, contact our customer support teams or respond to a survey.</li>\n</ul> 3.&nbsp;Why Do We Retain Personal Data? <p>We retain Personal Data to fulfill our legal or regulatory obligations and for our business purposes.\n&nbsp;We may retain Personal Data for longer periods than required by law if it is in our legitimate business interests and not prohibited by law.&nbsp.\nIf your Account is closed, we may take steps to mask Personal Data and other information, but we reserve our ability to retain and access the data for so long as required to comply with applicable laws.\n&nbsp;We will continue to use and disclose such Personal Data in accordance with this Privacy Statement.</p> 4.&nbsp;How Do We Process Personal Data? <p>We may Process your information for the following reasons:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>To operate the Sites and provide the Services</strong>, including to: <ul>\n<li>initiate a payment, send or request money, add value to an account, or pay a bill;</li>\n<li>authenticate your access to an Account;</li>\n<li>communicate with you about your Account, the Sites, the Services, or PayPal;</li>\n<li>create an account connection between your Account and a third-party account or platform.\nand</li>\n<li>perform creditworthiness and other financial standing checks, evaluate applications, and compare information for accuracy and verification purposes.</li>\n<li>keep your Account and financial information up to date.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To manage our business needs</strong>, such as monitoring, analyzing, and improving the Services and the Sites\u2019 performance and functionality.&nbsp.\nFor example, we analyze User behavior and perform research about the way you use our Services.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To manage risk and protect the Sites, the Services and you from fraud by verifying your identity</strong>.\nPayPal\u2019s risk and fraud tools use Personal Data, Device Information, Technical Usage Data and Geolocation Information from our Sites and websites that offer PayPal Services to help detect and prevent fraud and abuse of the Services.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To market to you</strong> about PayPal products and Services and the products and services of unaffiliated businesses.\nWe may also Process your Personal Data to uniquely tailor the marketing content and certain Services or Site experiences to better match your interests on PayPal and other third-party websites.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To provide personalized Services offered by PayPal on third-party websites and online services.</strong> &nbsp;We may use your Personal Data and other information collected in accordance with this Privacy Statement to provide a targeted display, feature, Services or offer to you on third-party websites.&nbsp.\nWe may use cookies and other tracking technologies to provide these online services and/or work with other third-parties such as merchant\u2019s, advertising or analytics companies to provide these online services.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To provide you with location-specific options, functionality or offers</strong> if you elect to share your Geolocation Information through the Services.&nbsp.\nWe will use this information to enhance the security of the Sites and Services and provide you with location-based Services, such as advertising, search results, and other personalized content.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To comply with our obligations and to enforce the terms of our Sites and Services, </strong>including to comply with all applicable laws and regulations.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To make it easier for you to find and connect with others.</strong> For instance, if you let us access your contacts or when your Account profile is public, we can suggest connections with people you may know and help others connect with you to send you money by letting them find your profile when they search for you by name, username, email, or mobile number on PayPal.\nWe may also associate information that we learn about you through your and your contacts\u2019 use of the Services, and information you and others provide, to suggest people you may know or may want to transact with through our Services.\nSocial functionality and features designed to simplify your use of the Services with others vary by Service.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>To respond to your requests, </strong>for example to contact you about a question you submitted to our customer service team<strong>.</strong>\n</li>\n</ul> 5.&nbsp;Do We Share Personal Data?<strong>&nbsp.\n</strong>\n<p>We may share your Personal Data or other information about you with others in a variety of ways as described in this section of the Privacy Statement.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We may share your Personal Data or other information for the following reasons:</p>\n<p>\n<strong>With other members of the PayPal corporate family:</strong> We may share your Personal Data with members of the PayPal family of entities to, among other things, provide the Services you have requested or authorized.\nto manage risk.\nto help detect and prevent potentially illegal and fraudulent acts and other violations of our policies and agreements.\nand to help us manage the availability and connectivity of PayPal products, Services, and communications.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>With other companies that provide services to us: </strong>We may share Personal Data with third-party service providers that perform services and functions at our direction and on our behalf.\nThese third-party service providers may, for example, provide you with Services, verify your identity, assist in processing transactions, send you advertisements for our products and Services, or provide customer support.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n<strong>With other financial institutions: </strong>We may share Personal Data with other financial institutions that we have partnered with to jointly create and offer a product, such as with Synchrony Bank in connection with the PayPal Extras credit card.&nbsp.\nThese financial institutions may only use this information to market and offer PayPal-related products, unless you have given consent for other uses.&nbsp;We may also share Personal Data to process transactions, provide you with benefits associated with your eligible cards, and keep your financial information up to date.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>With the other parties to transactions when you use the Services, such as other Users, merchants, and their service providers: </strong>We may share information about you and your account with the other parties involved in processing your transactions.\nThis includes other Users you are sending or receiving funds frommerchants, and &nbsp;their service providers when you use the Services to pay for goods or services.\nThe information includes:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Personal Data and Account information necessary to facilitate the transaction;</li>\n<li>information to help other participant(s) resolve disputes and detect and prevent fraud.\nand</li>\n<li>aggregated data and performance analytics to help merchants better understand Users and to help merchants enhance Users\u2019 experiences.&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>With other third parties for our business purposes or as permitted or required by law: </strong>We may share information about you with other parties for PayPal\u2019s business purposes or as permitted or required by law, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>if we need to do so to comply with a law, legal process or regulations;</li>\n<li>law enforcement, regulators, government officials, or other third parties (in Singapore or elsewhere) in relation to a subpoena, court order, or other legal process or requirement under Singapore law or regulation, or the laws and regulations of other jurisdictions that are applicable to PayPal or one of its affiliates.\nwhen we need to do so to comply with such law or credit card rules.\nor when we believe, in our sole discretion, that the disclosure of Personal Data is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss.\nor to report suspected illegal activity or to investigate violations of a user agreement.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>to protect the vital interests of a person;</li>\n<li>to protect our property, Services and legal rights;</li>\n<li>to facilitate a purchase or sale of all or part of PayPal\u2019s business;</li>\n<li>in connection with shipping and related services for purchases made using a Service;</li>\n<li>to help assess and manage risk and prevent fraud against us, our Users and fraud involving our Sites or use of our Services, including fraud that occurs at or involves our business partners, strategic ventures, or other individuals and merchants, such as eBay, Inc.;</li>\n<li>to banking partners as required by card association rules for inclusion on their list of terminated merchants;</li>\n<li>to credit reporting and collection agencies;</li>\n<li>to companies that we plan to merge with or be acquired by.\nand</li>\n<li>to support our audit, compliance, and corporate governance functions.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>With your consent: </strong>We also will share your Personal Data and other information with your consent or direction, including if you authorize an account connection with a third-party account or platform.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>In addition, PayPal may provide aggregated statistical data to third-parties, including other businesses and members of the public, about how, when, and why Users visit our Sites and use our Services.&nbsp.\nThis data will not personally identify you or provide information about your use of the Sites or Services.\n&nbsp;We do not share your Personal Data with third parties for their marketing purposes without your consent.</p> 6.&nbsp;How Do We Work with Other Services and Platforms?<strong>&nbsp.\n</strong>\n<p>A significant benefit and innovation of PayPal\u2019s Services is that you can connect your Account with a third-party account or platform.\n&nbsp;For the purposes of this Privacy Statement, an \u201caccount connection\u201d with such a third-party is a connection you authorize or enable between your Account and a non-PayPal account, payment instrument, or platform that you lawfully control or own.&nbsp.\nWhen you authorize such a connection, PayPal and the third-party will exchange your Personal Data and other information directly.&nbsp.\nExamples of account connections include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>linking your Account to a social media account or social messaging service;</li>\n<li>connecting your Account to a third-party data aggregation or financial services company, if you provide such company with your Account log-in credentials.\nor</li>\n<li>using your Account to make payments to a merchant or allowing a merchant to charge your Account.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you choose to create an account connection, we may receive information from the third-party about you and your use of the third-party\u2019s service.&nbsp.\nFor example, if you connect your Account to a social media account, we will receive Personal Data from the social media provider via the account connection.&nbsp.\nIf you connect your Account to other financial accounts, directly or through a third-party service provider, we may have access to your account balance and transactional information, such as purchases and funds transfers.\n&nbsp;We will use all such information that we receive from a third-party via an account connection in a manner consistent with this Privacy Statement.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Information that we share with a third-party based on an account connection will be used and disclosed in accordance with the third-party\u2019s privacy practices.&nbsp.\nBefore authorizing an account connection, you should review the privacy notice of any third-party that will gain access to your Personal Data as part of the account connection.&nbsp.\nFor example, Personal Data that PayPal shares with a third-party account or platform such as a social media account may in turn be shared with certain other parties, including the general public, depending on the account\u2019s or platform\u2019s privacy practices.&nbsp;</p> 7.&nbsp;How Do We Use Cookies and Tracking Technologies?&nbsp.\n<p>When you visit our Sites, use our Services, or visit a third-party website for which we provide online Services, we and our business partners and vendors may use cookies and other tracking technologies (collectively, \u201cCookies\u201d) to recognize you as a User and to customize your online experiences, the Services you use, and other online content and advertising.\nmeasure the effectiveness of promotions and perform analytics.\nand to mitigate risk, prevent potential fraud, and promote trust and safety across our Sites and Services.&nbsp.\nCertain aspects and features of our Services and Sites are only available through the use of Cookies, so if you choose to disable or decline Cookies, your use of the Sites and Services may be limited or not possible.</p>\n<p>Do Not Track (DNT) is an optional browser setting that allows you to express your preferences regarding tracking by advertisers and other third-parties.\n&nbsp;We do not respond to DNT signals.</p>\n<p>Please review our Statement on Cookies and Tracking Technologies to learn more about how we use Cookies.</p> 8.&nbsp;What Privacy Choices Are Available To You? <p>You have choices when it comes to the privacy practices and communications described in this Privacy Statement.\nMany of your choices may be explained at the time you sign up for or use a Service or in the context of your use of a Site.\nYou may be provided with instructions and prompts within the experiences as you navigate the Services.\n&nbsp;</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to the Personal Data We Collect</strong>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<u>Personal Data</u>.\nYou may decline to provide Personal Data when it is requested by PayPal, but certain Services or all of the Services may be unavailable to you.&nbsp;</li>\n<li>\n<u>Location and other device-level information</u>.\nThe device you use to access the Sites or Services may collect information about you, including Geolocation Information and User usage data that PayPal may then collect and use.\nFor information about your ability to restrict the collection and use of such information, please use the settings available in the device.<br> &nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to Our Use of Your Personal Data</strong>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<u>Personalized Services offered by PayPal on third-party websites and services</u>.\nYou may manage your preferences for other PayPal Services that are personalized and offered to you on third-party websites from your Account.\nWe may also provide you with instructions and prompts on how to manage your preferences within the Service experience.</li>\n<li>\n<u>Finding and connecting with others</u>.\nIf available, you may manage your preferences for finding and connecting with others from your account of the Service you use.<br> &nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to Account Connections</strong>\n<ul>\n<li>If you authorize an account connection to a third-party account or platform, such as a social media account, you may be able to manage your connection preferences from your Account or the third-party account or platform.\nPlease refer to the privacy notice that governs the third-party platform for more information on the choices you may have.<br> &nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to Cookies</strong>\n</li>\n<li>You may have options available to manage your cookies preferences.\nFor example, your browser or internet device may allow you delete, disable, or block certain cookies and other tracking technologies.\nYou can learn more by visiting AboutCookies.org.\nYou may choose to enable these options, but doing so may prevent you from using many of the core features and functions available on a Service or Site.\n</li>\n<li>You may have an option regarding the use of cookies and other tracking technologies when you use a Service or visit parts of a Site.\nFor example, you may be asked if you want the Service or Site to \u201cremember\u201d certain things about you, and we will use cookies and other tracking technologies to the extent that you permit them.</li>\n<li>You can learn more about our cookies and tracking technologies by visiting the Statement on Cookies and Tracking Technologies page.<br> &nbsp;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to Your Registration and Account Information</strong>\n<ul>\n<li>If you have an Account, you generally may review and edit Personal Data by logging in and updating the information directly or by contacting us.\nContact us if you do not have an Account or if you have questions about your Account information or other Personal Data.<br> &nbsp.\n</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Choices Relating to Communication</strong>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Notices, Alerts and Updates from Us: </strong>&nbsp.\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Marketing:</strong> We may send you marketing content about our Sites, Services, products, products we jointly offer with financial institutions, as well as the products and services of unaffiliated third parties and members of the PayPal corporate family through various communication channels, for example, email, text, pop-ups, push notifications, and messaging applications.\n&nbsp;You may opt out of these marketing communications by following the instructions in the communications you receive.\n&nbsp;If you have an Account with us, you may also adjust your communication preferences in your Account settings.\n&nbsp;For messages sent via push notifications, you may manage your preferences in your device.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Informational and Other:</strong> We will send communications to you that are required or necessary to send to Users of our Services, notifications that contain important information and other communications that you request from us.\nYou may not opt out of receiving these communications.&nbsp.\nHowever, you may be able to adjust the media and format through which you receive these notices.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul> 9.&nbsp;How Do We Protect Your Personal Data? <p>We maintain technical, physical, and administrative security measures designed to provide reasonable protection for your Personal Data against loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, and alteration.\nThe security measures include firewalls, data encryption, physical access controls to our data centers, and information access authorization controls.&nbsp.\nWhile we are dedicated to securing our systems and Services, you are responsible for securing and maintaining the privacy of your password(s) and Account/profile registration information and verifying that the Personal Data we maintain about you is accurate and current.\n&nbsp;We are not responsible for protecting any Personal Data that we share with a third-party based on an account connection that you have authorized.</p> 10.&nbsp;Can Children Use Our Services? <p>The Sites and Services are not directed to children under the age of 13.\n&nbsp;We do not knowingly collect information, including Personal Data, from children or other individuals who are not legally able to use our Sites and Services.\nIf we obtain actual knowledge that we have collected Personal Data from a child under the age of 13, we will promptly delete it, unless we are legally obligated to retain such data.\nContact us if you believe that we have mistakenly or unintentionally collected information from a child under the age of 13.</p> 11.&nbsp;What Else Should You Know? <p>\n<strong>Changes to This Privacy Statement</strong>.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We may revise this Privacy Statement from time to time to reflect changes to our business, the Sites or Services, or applicable laws.&nbsp.\nThe revised Privacy Statement will be effective as of the published effective date.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>If the revised version includes a substantial change, we will provide you with 30 days prior notice by posting notice of the change on the \u201cPolicy Update\u201d page of our website.\n&nbsp;We also may notify Users of the change using email or other means.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Transfers of Your Personal Data to Other Countries</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Our operations are supported by a network of computers, cloud-based servers, and other infrastructure and information technology, including, but not limited to, third-party service providers.\n&nbsp;We and our third-party service providers store and Process your Personal Data in the United States of America and elsewhere in the world.\n&nbsp;We will protect your information as described in this Privacy Statement if your Personal Data is transferred to other countries.\n&nbsp;By using our Sites and Services, you consent to your Personal Data being transferred to other countries, including countries that have different data protection rules than your country.&nbsp.\nWe do not represent that our Sites and Services are appropriate or available in any particular jurisdiction.&nbsp;</p> 12.&nbsp;Contact Us <p>You may contact us if you have general questions about our Privacy Statement and practices or questions about your Account information or Personal Data.</p>\n<p>We want to make sure your questions go to the right place:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<p>Click here to contact us about your PayPal account or transaction, or a card payment made to a merchant.</p>\n</li>\n<li>Click here to contact us about your Xoom account</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<strong>\n</strong>13.&nbsp;Definitions <p>\n<strong>Account </strong>means a PayPal or Xoom member account.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Device Information</strong> means data that can be automatically collected from any device used to access the Sites or Services.\n&nbsp;Such information may include, but is not limited to, your device type.\nyour device\u2019s network connections.\nyour device\u2019s name.\nyour device\u2019s IP address.\ninformation about your device\u2019s web browser and the internet connection being used to access the Site or Services.\nGeolocation Information.\ninformation about apps downloaded to your device.\nand biometric data (e.g., Touch ID/Fingerprint to verify your identity).</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Geolocation Information </strong>means information that identifies with reasonable specificity your location by using, for instance, longitude and latitude coordinates obtained through GPS, Wi-Fi, or cell site triangulation.&nbsp.\nSome of our Services may ask you for permission to share your current location.\n&nbsp;Some of the Sites and Services require this information to provide a specific product or online Service.\n&nbsp;If you do not agree to our collection of the geolocation information, our Sites or Services may not function properly when you try to use them.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>PayPal </strong>means PayPal Pte.\nLtd.\nand subsidiaries or affiliates.\n&nbsp;In this Privacy Statement, PayPal is sometimes referred to as \u201cwe,\u201d \u201cus,\u201d or \u201cour,\u201d depending on the context.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Personal Data</strong> means personal information that can be associated with an identified or identifiable person.\n&nbsp;\u201cPersonal Data\u201d can include name, postal address (including billing and shipping addresses), telephone number, email address, payment card number, other financial account information, account number, date of birth, and government-issued credentials (e.g., driver\u2019s license number, national ID, passport, Social Security number and Taxpayer ID).\n&nbsp;Personal Data does not include information that does not identify a specific User.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Process </strong>means any method or way that we handle Personal Data or sets of Personal Data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, and consultation, disclosure by transmission, disseminating or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction of Personal Data.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Services</strong> means any products, services, content, features, technologies, or functions, and all related websites, applications and services offered to you by PayPal.\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Sites </strong>means the websites, mobile apps, official social media platforms, or other online properties through which PayPal offers the Services and which has posted or linked to this Privacy Statement.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Technical Usage Data</strong> means information we collect from your phone, computer or other device that you use to access the Sites or Services.&nbsp.\nTechnical Usage Data tells us how you use the Sites and Services, such as what you have searched for and viewed on the Sites and the way you use our Services, including your IP address, statistics regarding how pages are loaded or viewed, the websites you visited before coming to the Sites and other usage and browsing information collected through Cookies.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>User</strong> means an individual who uses the Services or accesses the Sites.</p>\n<p> &nbsp;</p> 14.\nAdditional Information <p>The information provided in this section may be specific to customers depending on your region or is provided to PayPal from third parties whom you may interact with when using the Services.\nYou can contact us if you have any questions about the details in this section.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Google ReCaptcha </strong>\n</p>\n<p>PayPal uses ReCaptcha on the Sites and Services.\nYour use of ReCaptcha is subject to the Google&nbsp;Privacy Policy&nbsp;and&nbsp;Terms of Use.</p>\n<p>ReCaptcha is only used to fight spam and abuse.</p> ", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:24:28.675Z", "updated_at": AGREEMENT About Your Account <p>This user agreement will be effective for all users as of October 31, 2020.</p> Welcome to PayPal! <p>This user agreement is a contract between you and PayPal Pte.\nLtd., a Singaporean company governing your use of your PayPal account and the PayPal services.\nIf you are an individual, you must be a resident of one of the countries/regions listed on the <strong>PayPal Worldwide</strong> page and at least 18 years old, or the age of majority in your country/region of residence to open a PayPal account and use the PayPal services.\nIf you are a business, the business must be organized in, operating in, or a resident of one of the countries/regions listed on the <strong>PayPal Worldwide</strong> page to open a PayPal account and use the PayPal services.</p>\n<p>By opening and using a PayPal account, you agree to comply with all of the terms and conditions in this user agreement.\nYou also agree to comply with the following additional policies and each of the other agreements on the Legal Agreements page that apply to you, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Acceptable Use Policy</li>\n<li>Alternative Payment Methods Terms</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Please read carefully all of the terms and conditions of this user agreement, the terms of these policies and each of the other agreements that apply to you.\n</p>\n<p>We may amend this user agreement and any of the policies listed above from time to time.\nThe revised version will be effective at the time we post it on our website, unless otherwise noted.\nIf our changes reduce your rights or increase your responsibilities we will post a notice on the Policy Updates page of our website and provide you with at least 14 days notice.\nAll future changes set out in the
