services from a country that is not included on PayPal's permitted countries list;</li>\n<li>Take any action that imposes an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf or the PayPal services.\nfacilitate any viruses, trojan horses, malware, worms or other computer programming routines that attempts to or may damage, disrupt, corrupt, misuse, detrimentally interfere with, surreptitiously intercept or expropriate, or gain unauthorized access to any system, data, information or PayPal services.\nuse an anonymizing proxy.\nuse any robot, spider, other automatic device, or manual process to monitor or copy our websites without our prior written permission.\nuse any device, software or routine to bypass our robot exclusion headers.\nor interfere or disrupt or attempt to interfere with or disrupt our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, any of the PayPal services or other users' use of any of the PayPal services.</li>\n<li>Take any action that may cause us to lose any of the services from our Internet service providers, payment processors, or other suppliers or service providers.</li>\n<li>Use the PayPal services to test credit card behaviors.</li>\n<li>Circumvent any PayPal policy or determinations about your PayPal account such as temporary or indefinite suspensions or other account holds, limitations or restrictions, including, but not limited to, engaging in the following actions: attempting to open new or additional PayPal account(s) when an account has a negative PayPal balance or has been restricted, suspended or otherwise limited.\nopening new or additional PayPal accounts using information that is not your own (e.g.\nname, address, email address, etc.).\nor using someone else's PayPal account;</li>\n<li>Harass and/or threaten our employees, agents, or other users.</li>\n<li>Abuse (as either a buyer or seller) of our online dispute resolution process and/or PayPal Buyer Protection.</li>\n<li>Cause us to receive a disproportionate number of claims that have been closed in favour of the claimant regarding your PayPal account or business.</li>\n<li>Have a credit score from a credit reporting agency that indicates a high level of risk associated with your use of the PayPal services.</li>\n<li>Disclose or distribute another user's information to a third party, or use such information for marketing purposes unless you receive the user's express consent to do so.</li>\n<li>Send unsolicited emails to users or use the PayPal services to collect payments for sending, or assisting in sending, unsolicited emails to third parties.</li>\n<li>Copy, reproduce, communicate to any third party, alter, modify, create derivative works, publicly display or frame any content from the PayPal websites without our or any applicable third party's written consent.</li>\n<li>Reveal your account password(s) to anyone else, nor use anyone else's password.\nWe are not responsible for losses incurred by you including, without limitation, the use of your account by any person other than you, arising as the result of misuse of passwords.</li>\n</ul> Actions We May Take if You Engage in Any Restricted Activities <p>If we believe that you've engaged in any of these activities, we may take a number of actions to protect PayPal, its customers and others at any time in our sole discretion.\nThe actions we may take include, but are not limited to, the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Terminate this user agreement, limit your PayPal account, and/or close or suspend your PayPal account, immediately and without penalty to us;</li>\n<li>Refuse to provide the PayPal services to you now and in the future;</li>\n<li>Limit your access to our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, your PayPal account or any of the PayPal services, including limiting your ability to pay or send payments with any of the payment methods linked to your PayPal account, restricting your ability to send payments or make withdrawals;</li>\n<li>Hold your PayPal balance if reasonably needed to protect against the risk of liability to PayPal or a third party, or if you have violated our Acceptable Use Policy;</li>\n<li>Suspend your eligibility for PayPal's Buyer Protection program and/or PayPal's Seller Protection program;</li>\n<li>Contact buyers who have purchased goods or services from you using PayPal, your bank or credit card issuer, other impacted third parties or law enforcement about your actions;</li>\n<li>Update inaccurate information you provided us;</li>\n<li>Take legal action against you;</li>\n<li>Hold, apply or transfer the funds in your PayPal account as required by judgments and orders which affect you or your PayPal account, including judgments and orders issued by courts in Singapore or elsewhere and directed to PayPal or its affiliates;</li>\n<li>If you've violated our Acceptable Use Policy, then you're also responsible for damages to PayPal caused by your violation of this policy.\nor</li>\n<li>If you violate the Acceptable Use Policy, then in addition to being subject to the above actions you will be liable to PayPal for the amount of PayPal's damages caused by your violation of the Acceptable Use Policy.\nYou acknowledge and agree that $2,500 USD (or equivalent) per violation of the Acceptable Use Policy is presently a reasonable minimum estimate of PayPal's actual damages considering all currently existing circumstances, including the relationship of the sum to the range of harm to PayPal that reasonably could be anticipated because, due to the nature of the violations of the Acceptable Use Policy, actual damages would be impractical or extremely difficult to calculate.\nPayPal may deduct such damages directly from any existing PayPal balance in any PayPal account you control.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we close your PayPal account or terminate your use of the PayPal services for any reason, we'll provide you with notice of our actions and make any unrestricted funds held in your PayPal account available for withdrawal.</p>\n<p>You are responsible for all reversals, chargebacks, claims, fees, fines, penalties and other liability incurred by PayPal, any PayPal customer, or a third party caused by or arising out of your breach of this user agreement, and/or your use of the PayPal services.</p> Holds, Limitations and Reserves What are holds, limitations and reserves <p>Under certain circumstances, in order to protect PayPal and the security and integrity of the network of buyers and sellers that use the PayPal services, PayPal may take account-level or transaction-level actions.\nUnless otherwise noted, if we take any of the actions described here, we'll provide you with notice of our actions, but we retain the sole discretion to take these actions.\nTo request information in connection with an account limitation, hold or reserve, you should visit the Resolution Centre or follow the instructions in our email notice with respect to the limitation, hold or reserve.</p>\n<p>Our decision about holds, limitations and reserves may be based on confidential criteria that are essential to our management of risk and the protection of PayPal, our customers and/or service providers.\nWe may use proprietary fraud and risk modeling when assessing the risk associated with your PayPal account.\nIn addition, we may be restricted by regulation or a governmental authority from disclosing certain information to you about such decisions.\nWe have no obligation to disclose the details of our risk management or security procedures to you.</p>\n<p>In order to facilitate PayPal\u2019s actions described above and allow us to assess the level of risk associated with your PayPal account, you agree to cooperate with PayPal\u2019s reasonable requests for financial statements and other documentation or information in a timely fashion.</p>\nHolds<p>A hold is an action that PayPal may take under certain circumstances either at the transaction level or the account level.\nWhen PayPal places a temporary hold on a payment, the funds shall not be available to either the sender or the recipient.\nPayPal reviews many factors before placing a hold on a payment, including: account tenure, transaction activity, business type, past customer disputes, and overall customer satisfaction.\nSome common situations where PayPal will hold payments include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>New sellers or sellers who have limited selling activity.</li>\n<li>Payments for higher-risk categories like electronics or tickets.</li>\n<li>Sellers who have performance issues, or a high rate of buyer dissatisfaction or disputes.</li>\n</ul>\nHolds based on PayPal\u2019s risk decisions<p>We may place a hold on payments sent to your PayPal account if, in our sole discretion, we believe that there may be a high level of risk associated with you, your PayPal account, or your transactions or that placing such a hold is necessary to comply with regulatory requirements.\nWe make decisions about whether to place a payment hold based on a number of factors, including information available to us from both internal sources and third parties.\nWhen we place a hold on a payment, the funds will appear in your PayPal account with an indication that they are unavailable or pending.\nWe'll notify you, either through your PayPal account or directly by phone or email, whenever we place a hold.\n</p>\n<p>Risk-based holds generally remain in place for up to 30 days from the date the payment was received into your PayPal account unless PayPal has a reason to continue to hold the payment.\nWe may release the hold earlier under certain circumstances (for example, if you've uploaded shipment tracking information related to the transaction), but any earlier release is at our sole discretion.\nThe hold may last longer than 30 days if the payment is challenged as a payment that should be invalidated and reversed based on a disputed transaction as discussed in the following paragraph below.\nIn this case, we'll hold the payment in your PayPal account until the matter is resolved.</p>\nHolds related to Marketplace transactions<p>If you're a seller on a marketplace or through a third-party application where PayPal is offered, a hold may be placed on a payment sent to you at the instruction of the applicable marketplace or third-party.\nThis is done once you have granted us permission to have your funds held and will be in accordance with your agreement with the third-party.\nThese holds will appear in your PayPal account.\nIf you have questions about why the applicable marketplace or third party instructed PayPal to put these holds in place, you will need to contact the marketplace or third-party directly.</p>\nHolds based on disputed transactions<p>If a payment sent to you as a seller is challenged as a payment that should be invalidated and reversed, we may place a temporary hold on the funds in your PayPal account to cover the amount that could be reversed.\nAny of the situations described under Refunds, Reversals and Chargebacks are situations that could result in us placing a hold on a payment.\nIf we determine the transaction should not be reversed, we'll lift the temporary hold.\nIf we determine the transaction should be reversed, we'll remove the funds from your PayPal account.</p>\nAccount Limitations<p>Limitations prevent you from completing certain actions with your PayPal account, such as withdrawing, sending or receiving payments.\nThese limitations are implemented to help protect PayPal, buyers and sellers when we notice restricted activities, an increased financial risk, or activity that appears to us as unusual or suspicious.\nLimitations also help us collect information necessary for keeping your PayPal account open.</p>\n<p>There are several reasons why we may limit your access to your PayPal account or the PayPal services, and/or limit access to your funds, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>If we suspect someone could be using your PayPal account without your knowledge, we'll limit it for your protection and look into the fraudulent activity.</li>\n<li>If your debit or credit card issuer alerts us that someone has used your card without your permission.\nSimilarly, if your bank lets us know that there have been unauthorized transfers between your PayPal account and your bank account.</li>\n<li>In order to comply with applicable law.</li>\n<li>If we reasonably believe you have breached this agreement or violated the Acceptable Use Policy.</li>\n<li>Seller performance indicating your PayPal account is high risk.\nExamples include: indications of poor selling performance because you've received an unusually high number of claims and chargebacks selling an entirely new or high cost product, or if your typical sales volume increases rapidly.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we limit access to your PayPal account, we'll provide you with notice of our actions and the opportunity to request restoration of access if, in our sole discretion, we deem it appropriate.</p>\n<p>You will need to resolve any issues with your account before a limitation can be removed.\nNormally, this is done after you provide us with the information we request.\nHowever, if we reasonably believe a risk still exists after you have provided us that information, we may take action to protect PayPal, our users, a third party, or you from reversals, fees, fines, penalties, legal and/or regulatory risks and any other liability.</p>\nReserves<p>We may place a reserve on your PayPal account if we believe there may be a high level of risk associated with you, your PayPal account, your business model, or your transactions.\nWhen we place a reserve on your PayPal account, it means that all or some of the transactions will be shown as \"pending\" in your PayPal balance, and you will not be able to withdraw funds in a \"pending\" status, in order to protect against the risk of transactions made by you being reversed or invalidated or any other risk related to your PayPal account or use of the PayPal services.\nWe make decisions about whether to place a reserve based on a number of factors, including information available to us from both internal sources and from third parties.</p>\n<p>PayPal considers a list of non-exclusive factors, and whether and how these factors have changed over time, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>How long you have been in business.</li>\n<li>Whether your industry has a higher likelihood of chargebacks.</li>\n<li>Your payment processing history with PayPal and other providers.</li>\n<li>Your business and/or personal credit history.</li>\n<li>Your delivery time frames.</li>\n<li>Whether you have higher than average number of returns, chargebacks, claims or disputes.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we place a reserve on funds in your account, we'll notify you of our actions and the terms of the reserve.</p>\n<p>There are two types of reserves that may be placed on your PayPal account, and one or both may be applied at the same time:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<strong>A Rolling reserve</strong> is a reserve where a percentage of each transaction you receive each day is held and then released later on a scheduled basis.\nFor example, your reserve could be set at 10% and held for a 90-day rolling period \u2013 meaning 10% of the funds you receive on day 1 are held and then released on day 91, 10% of the funds you receive on day 2 are held until day 92, etc.\nRolling reserves are the most common type of reserve.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>A Minimum reserve</strong> is a specific minimum amount that you're required to keep available in your PayPal balance at all times.\nThe minimum reserve is either taken as an upfront amount deposited all at once or is established on a rolling basis from percentages of sales until the minimum reserve is achieved, much like a rolling reserve.\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we change the terms of the reserve due to a change in our risk assessment, we'll notify you of the new terms.\n</p> Court Orders, Regulatory Requirements or Other Legal Process <p>If we are notified of a court order or other legal process (including garnishment or any equivalent process) affecting you, or if we otherwise believe we are required to do so in order to comply with applicable law or regulatory requirements, we may be required to take certain actions, including holding payments to/from your PayPal account, placing a reserve or limitation on your PayPal account, or releasing your funds.\nWe will decide, in our sole discretion, which action is required of us.\nUnless the court order, applicable law, regulatory requirement or other legal process requires otherwise, we will notify you of these actions.\nWe do not have an obligation to contest or appeal any court order or legal process involving you or your PayPal account.\nWhen we implement a hold, reserve or limitation as a result of a court order, applicable law, regulatory requirement or other legal process, the hold, reserve or limitation may remain in place as long as reasonably necessary as determined by PayPal.</p> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nLiability for Unauthorized Transactions Protection from Unauthorized Transactions <p>To protect yourself from unauthorized activity in your PayPal account, you should regularly log into your PayPal account and review your PayPal account statement.\nPayPal will notify you of each transaction by sending an email to your primary email address on file.\nYou should review these transaction notifications to ensure that each transaction was authorized and accurately completed.</p>\n<p>PayPal will protect you from unauthorized activity in your PayPal account.\nWhen this protection applies, PayPal will cover you for the full amount of the unauthorized activity as long as you cooperate with us and follow the procedures described below.\n</p>\nWhat is an Unauthorized Transaction<p>An \"Unauthorized Transaction\" occurs when a payment is sent from your PayPal account that you did not authorize and that did not benefit you.\nFor example, if someone steals your password, uses the password to access your PayPal account, and sends a payment from your PayPal account, an Unauthorized Transaction has occurred.</p>\nWhat is not considered an Unauthorized Transaction<p>The following are NOT considered Unauthorized Transactions:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>If you give someone access to your PayPal account (by giving them your login information) and they use your PayPal account without your knowledge or permission.\nYou are responsible for transactions made in this situation.</li>\n<li>Invalidation and reversal of a payment as a result of the actions described under Refunds, Reversals and Chargebacks.</li>\n</ul>\nReporting an Unauthorized Transaction<p>You should contact PayPal customer service immediately if you believe:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>there has been an Unauthorized Transaction sent from your account;</li>\n<li>there has been unauthorized access to your account;</li>\n<li>your PayPal login information has been lost or stolen.\nor</li>\n<li>any device you have used to access your PayPal account has been lost, stolen or deactivated.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You must give us all the available information relating to circumstances of any Unauthorized Transactions, and/or misappropriated or unauthorized use of your account, and take all reasonable steps requested to assist PayPal in its investigation.</p>\n<p>If you notify us of an Unauthorized Transaction within 60 days of the transaction and we are satisfied that it was an Unauthorized Transaction, you will be eligible for 100% protection for the Unauthorized Transaction.</p> Error Resolution What is an Error<p>An \"Error\" means the following:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>a processing error made by PayPal or its suppliers in which your PayPal account is mistakenly debited or credited, or when a transaction is incorrectly recorded in your PayPal account.</li>\n<li>You send a payment and the incorrect amount is debited from your PayPal account.</li>\n<li>A transaction is missing from or not properly identified in your PayPal account statement.</li>\n<li>We make a computational or mathematical error related to your PayPal account.</li>\n</ul>\nWhat is not considered an Error<p>The following are NOT considered errors:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>If you give someone access to your PayPal account (by giving them your login information) and they use your PayPal account without your knowledge or permission.\nYou are responsible for transactions made in this situation.</li>\n<li>Invalidation and reversal of a payment as a result of the actions described under Refunds, Reversals and Chargebacks.</li>\n<li>If you erroneously send a payment to the wrong party, or send a payment for the wrong amount (based on a typographical error, for example).\n(Your only recourse in this instance will be to contact the party to whom you sent the payment and ask them to refund the payment.\nPayPal will not reimburse you or reverse a payment that you have made in error.)</li>\n</ul>\nIn case of errors or questions about your electronic transfers<p>Contact us at our Resolution Centre.</p>\n<p>Notify us as soon as you can, if you think your statement or receipt is wrong or if you need more information about a transfer listed on the statement or receipt.\nWe must hear from you no later than 60 days after we sent the FIRST statement on which the problem or error appeared.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Tell us your name, email address and account number (if any).</li>\n<li>Describe the error or the transfer you are unsure about, and explain as clearly as you can why you believe it is an error or why you need more information.</li>\n<li>Tell us the dollar amount of the suspected error.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you tell us orally, we may require that you send us your complaint or question in writing within 10 Business Days.\nWe will complete our investigation within 10 Business Days after we receive your notification of the suspected error.\nIf we need more time, however, we may take up to 45 days to investigate your complaint or question.\nIf we decide to do this, we will credit your PayPal account within 10 Business Days for the amount you think is in error, so that you will have the provisional credit during the time it takes us to complete our investigation.\nWe will notify you of the provisional credit within 2 Business Days of the crediting.\nIf we ask you to put your complaint or question in writing and we do not receive it within 10 Business Days, we may not provisionally credit your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>For errors involving new PayPal accounts, point-of-sale transactions, or foreign-initiated transactions, we may take up to 90 days to investigate your complaint or question.\nFor new PayPal accounts (the first transaction from your account was less than 30 Business Days from the date you notify us), we may take up to 20 Business Days to complete the investigation.</p>\n<p>We will tell you the results within 3 Business Days after completing our investigation.\nIf we decide that there was no error, we will send you a written explanation of our decision.\nIf you received a provisional credit, we will remove it from your account and notify you of the date and amount of the debit.\nYou may ask for copies of the documents that we used in our investigation.</p>\n<p>If we determine that there was an error, we will promptly credit the full amount into your account within 1 Business Day of our determination.\nOr, if you have already received a provisional credit, you will be allowed to retain those amounts.</p> Processing Errors <p>We will rectify any processing error that we discover.\nIf the error results in:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You receive less than the correct amount to which you were entitled, then we will credit your PayPal account for the difference between what you should have received and what you actually received.</li>\n<li>You receive more than the correct amount to which you were entitled, then we will debit your PayPal account for the difference between what you actually received and what you should have received.</li>\n<li>Our not completing a transaction on time or in the correct amount, then we will be responsible to you for your losses or damages directly caused by this failure, unless: <ul>\n<li>through no fault of ours, you did not have enough available funds to complete the transaction;</li>\n<li>our system was not working properly and you knew about the breakdown when you started the transaction.\nor</li>\n<li>the error was due to extraordinary circumstances outside our control (such as fire, flood or loss of Internet connection), despite our reasonable precautions.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Processing errors are not:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Delays that result from PayPal applying holds, limitations or reserves.</li>\n<li>Delays based on a payment review.</li>\n<li>Delays described under How to buy something related to the time it may take for a purchase transaction to be completed in some situations.</li>\n<li>Your errors in making a transaction (for example, mistyping an amount that you are sending).</li>\n</ul> PAYPAL USER AGREEMENT\nOther Legal Terms Communications Between You and Us <p>You agree that PayPal and its affiliates may contact you by email for marketing purposes.\nYou may opt-out of receiving marketing communications when you open a PayPal account, by changing your account preferences or by clicking on the unsubscribe link in any PayPal email or receipt you receive from us.\nPlease allow up to 10 Business Days for the opt-out to take effect.\nWe will provide factual information about your account or the PayPal services, even if you have opted-out of receiving marketing communications.</p>\n<p>If you provide us your mobile phone number, you agree that PayPal and its affiliates may contact you at that number using autodialed or prerecorded message calls or text messages to: (i) inform you about your use of the PayPal services and/or service your PayPal accounts, (ii) investigate or prevent fraud, or (iii) collect a debt.\nWe will not use autodialed or prerecorded message calls or texts to contact you for marketing purposes unless we receive your prior consent.\nWe may share your mobile phone number with service providers with whom we contract to assist us with the activities listed above, but will not share your mobile phone number with third parties for their own purposes without your consent.\nYou do not have to agree to receive autodialed or prerecorded message calls or texts to your mobile phone number in order to use and enjoy the products and services offered by PayPal.\nYou can decline to receive autodialed or prerecorded message calls or texts to your mobile phone number in several ways, including, via an email transaction receipt, in your account settings, or by contacting PayPal Customer Service.\nHowever, we may still call you directly using other means if we need to speak with you.\nStandard telephone minute and text charges may apply.</p>\n<p>PayPal may communicate with you about any PayPal account or transaction information and the PayPal services electronically.\nIt is your responsibility to keep your primary email address up to date so that PayPal can communicate with you electronically.\nYou understand and agree that if PayPal sends you an electronic communication but you do not receive it because your primary email address on file is incorrect, out of date, blocked by your service provider, or you are otherwise unable to receive electronic communications, PayPal will be deemed to have provided the communication to you effectively.</p>\n<p>Please note that if you use a spam filter that blocks or re-routes emails from senders not listed in your email address book, you must add PayPal to your email address book so that you will be able to view the communications we send to you.</p>\n<p>You can update your primary email address or street address at any time by logging into the PayPal website.\nIf your email address becomes invalid such that electronic communications sent to you by PayPal are returned, PayPal may deem your account to be inactive, and you will not be able to transact any activity using your PayPal Account until we receive a valid, working primary email address from you.</p>\n<p>PayPal reserves the right to close your account if you withdraw your consent to receive electronic communications.</p>\n<p>You will be considered to have received a communication from us, if it's delivered electronically, 24 hours after the time we post it to our website or email it to you.\nYou will be considered to have received a communication from us, if it's delivered by mail, 3 Business Days after we send it.</p>\n<p>Unless you're communicating with us about a matter where we've specified another notice address (for example, our Liability for Unauthorized Transactions and Other Errors process), written notices to PayPal must be sent by postal mail to: PayPal Pte.\nLtd., Attention: Legal Department, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01, Suntec Tower Five, Singapore 038985.</p>\n<p>You understand and agree that, to the extent permitted by law, PayPal may, without further notice or warning, monitor or record telephone conversations you or anyone acting on your behalf has with PayPal or its agents for quality control and training purposes or for our own protection.\nYou acknowledge and understand that while your communications with PayPal may be overheard, monitored, or recorded not all telephone lines or calls may be recorded by PayPal, and PayPal does not guarantee that recordings of any particular telephone calls will be retained or retrievable.</p> PayPal's Rights PayPal suspension and termination rights <p>PayPal, in its sole discretion, reserves the right to suspend or terminate this user agreement, access to or use of its websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf or some or all of the PayPal services for any reason and at any time upon notice to you and, upon termination of this user agreement, the payment to you of any unrestricted funds held in your PayPal balance.</p> Security interest <p>As security for the performance of your obligations under this user agreement, you grant to PayPal a lien on, and security interest in and to, your PayPal balance in the possession of PayPal.</p>\nAmounts owed to PayPal <p>If your PayPal balance becomes negative for any reason, that negative PayPal balance represents an amount that you owe to PayPal.\nPayPal may set off these amounts from funds that are subsequently added to your PayPal account, either by you or from payments you receive.\nIf you have more than one PayPal account, we may set off a negative PayPal balance in one PayPal account against a PayPal balance in your other PayPal account(s).\nIf you continue using your PayPal account when it has a negative balance, you authorize PayPal to combine the negative balance with any debit or transaction sent from your account when that combination is disclosed to you in advance of initiating the debit or transaction.</p>\n<p>If you hold funds in a PayPal account in multiple currencies, and the balance for one of the currencies becomes negative for any reason, PayPal may set off the negative PayPal balance by using funds you maintain in a different currency.\nIf you have a negative balance in non-relevant currency for a period of 21 days or longer, PayPal will convert this negative balance to relevant currency.\nIn either case, a currency conversion will be necessary, and PayPal's transaction exchange rate (including our currency conversion fee) will be used.</p>\n<p>In addition to the above, if you have a past due amount owed to PayPal, our affiliates, or eBay, PayPal may debit your PayPal account to pay any amounts that are past due.\nThis includes amounts owed by using our various products such as Xoom or Braintree.</p>\nInsolvency proceedings<p>If any proceeding by or against you is commenced under any provision of any bankruptcy or insolvency law, we'll be entitled to recover all reasonable costs or expenses (including reasonable legal fees and expenses) incurred in connection with the enforcement of this user agreement.</p>\nAssumption of rights<p>If PayPal invalidates and reverses a payment that you made to a recipient (either at your initiative or otherwise), you agree that PayPal assumes your rights against the recipient and third parties related to the payment, and may pursue those rights directly or on your behalf, in PayPal's discretion.</p>\nNo waiver<p>Our failure to act with respect to a breach of any of your obligations under this user agreement by you or others does not waive our right to act with respect to subsequent or similar breaches.</p> Indemnification and Limitation of Liability <p>In this section, we use the term \"PayPal\" to refer to PayPal Pte.\nLtd.\nand our affiliates, and each of their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, joint ventures, service providers and suppliers.\nOur affiliates include each entity that we control, we are controlled by or we are under common control with.</p>\nIndemnification<p>You must indemnify PayPal for actions related to your PayPal account and your use of the PayPal services.\nYou agree to defend, indemnify and hold PayPal harmless from any claim or demand (including reasonable legal fees) made or incurred by any third party due to or arising out of your breach of this user agreement, your improper use of the PayPal services, your violation of any law or the rights of a third party and/or the actions or inactions of any third party to whom you grant permissions to use your PayPal account or access our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, or any of the PayPal services on your behalf.</p>\nLimitation of liability<p>\n<strong>PayPal's liability is limited with respect to your PayPal account and your use of the PayPal services.</strong> In no event shall PayPal be liable for lost profits or any special, incidental or consequential damages (including without limitation damages for loss of data or loss of business) arising out of or in connection with our websites, software, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) operated by us or on our behalf, any of the PayPal services, or this user agreement (however arising, including negligence), unless and to the extent prohibited by law.</p>\n<p>Our liability to you or any third parties in any circumstance is limited to the actual amount of direct damages.\nIn addition, to the extent permitted by applicable law, PayPal is not liable, and you agree not to hold PayPal responsible, for any damages or losses (including, but not limited to, loss of money, goodwill, or reputation, profits, or other intangible losses or any special, indirect, or consequential damages) resulting directly or indirectly from: (1) your use of, or your inability to use, our websites, software, systems operated by us or on our behalf (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) or any of the PayPal services.\n(2) delays or disruptions in our websites, software, systems operated by us or on our behalf (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services), and any of the PayPal services.\n(3) viruses or other malicious software obtained by accessing our websites, software, systems operated by us or on our behalf (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services), any of the PayPal services, or any website or service linked to our websites.\n(4) glitches, bugs, errors, or inaccuracies of any kind in our websites, software, systems operated by us or on our behalf (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services), any of the PayPal services, or in the information and graphics obtained from them.\n(5) the content, actions, or inactions of third parties.\n(6) a suspension or other action taken with respect to your PayPal account.\nor (7) your need to modify your practices, content, or behavior, or your loss of or inability to do business, as a result of changes to this user agreement or PayPal's policies.</p> Disclaimer of Warranty and Release No warranty <p>\n<strong>The PayPal services are provided \"as-is\" and without any representation or warranty, whether express, implied or statutory.\nPayPal specifically disclaims any implied warranties of title, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement.</strong>\n</p>\n<p>PayPal does not have any control over the products or services provided by sellers who accept PayPal as a payment method, and PayPal cannot ensure that a buyer or a seller you are dealing with will actually complete the transaction or is authorized to do so.\nPayPal does not guarantee continuous, uninterrupted or secure access to any part of the PayPal services, and operation of our websites, software, or systems operated by us or on our behalf (including any networks and servers used to provide any of the PayPal services) may be interfered with by numerous factors outside of our control.\nPayPal will make reasonable efforts to ensure that requests for electronic debits and credits involving bank accounts, debit cards, credit cards, and cheque issuances are processed in a timely manner but PayPal makes no representations or warranties regarding the amount of time needed to complete processing because the PayPal services are dependent upon many factors outside of our control, such as delays in the banking system or mail service.\nThis paragraph gives you specific legal rights and you may also have other legal rights that vary from country/region to country/region.</p>Release of PayPal<p>If you have a dispute with any other PayPal account holder, you release PayPal from any and all claims, demands and damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, arising out of or in any way connected with such disputes.\nIn entering into this release you expressly waive any protections that would otherwise limit the coverage of this release to include only those claims which you may know or suspect to exist in your favour at the time of agreeing to this release.</p> Disputes with PayPal Contact PayPal First <p>If a dispute arises between you and PayPal, acting as either a buyer or a seller, our goal is to learn about and address your concerns.\nIf we are unable to do so to your satisfaction, we aim to provide you with a neutral and cost effective means of resolving the dispute quickly.\nDisputes between you and PayPal regarding the services may be reported to PayPal Customer Service.</p> Arbitration <p>For any claim (excluding claims for injunctive or other equitable relief) where the total amount of the award sought is less than $10,000 USD (or other currency equivalents), you may elect to resolve the dispute in a cost effective manner through binding non-appearance-based arbitration.\nIf you elect arbitration, you will initiate such arbitration through an established alternative dispute resolution (\"ADR\") provider mutually agreed upon by you and us.\nThe ADR provider and the parties must comply with the following rules: (a) the arbitration shall be conducted by telephone, online and/or be solely based on written submissions, the specific manner shall be chosen by you.\n(b) the arbitration shall not involve any personal appearance by the parties or witnesses unless otherwise mutually agreed by the parties.\nand (c) any judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction.</p> Intellectual Property PayPal's trademarks <p>\"PayPal.com,\", \"PayPal,\" and all logos our prior written consent.\nYou may use HTML logos provided by PayPal for the purpose of directing web traffic to the PayPal services.\nYou may not alter, modify or change these HTML logos in any way, use them in a manner that mischaracterizes PayPal or the PayPal services or display them in any manner that implies PayPal's sponsorship or endorsement.\nAll right, title and interest in and to the PayPal websites, any content thereon, the PayPal services, the technology related to the PayPal services, and any and all technology and any content created or derived from any of the foregoing is the in Singapore or where the defendant is located.\nYou agree to irrevocably submit to the non\u00ad-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located within Singapore for the purpose of any suit, action or filed claim, and you have failed to promptly withdraw the claim.</p>\nIdentity authentication<p>You authorize PayPal, directly or through third parties, to make any inquiries we consider necessary to region at the point of signing up for a PayPal account), if you refund (partially or fully) a transaction to a buyer or a donation to a donor, we will retain the fixed fee portion of the fees you paid as the seller.\nThe amount of the refunded payment will be deducted from your PayPal account.</p>\n<p>In case of any disputes, demands, actions, proceedings (\"Disputes\") between you and a Service obligations.</p>\n<p>PayPal shall not be responsible for any loss or damage incurred or suffered by you on account of any (i) failure, interruption, defect, or negligent or willful misuse of a Third notice.</p>\n<p>Except to the extent amended by these terms and conditions, all other provisions of the user agreement shall remain in full force and effect.</p>\n<p>\n<u>Chargeback fees</u>\n</p>\n<p>If you receive a debit or credit card-funded payment through your PayPal account and the buyer pursues a chargeback for the transaction with their card issuer, PayPal will not assess you with a chargeback fee if the transaction is eligible for PayPal Seller Protection.\nHowever, if the transaction is ineligible for PayPal Seller Protection, PayPal will assess you with a chargeback fee (for facilitating the chargeback process) regardless of whether the buyer is successful in pursuing the chargeback with the card issuer.</p>\n<p>The applicable chargeback fee will be deducted from your PayPal account.\nThe chargeback fee is the amount specified on the Chargeback Fees table in the currency of the original transaction.\nIf you do not have the correct currency available in your PayPal balance at the time of the refund or reversal, a currency conversion will be required and a currency conversion fee will apply.</p>\n<p>If a buyer files a chargeback, the card issuer, not PayPal, will determine who wins the chargeback.</p>\nColombia <p>As of 1 September 2015, Colombian Resident PayPal users may only send and receive international payments.\nDomestic payments between two Colombian Resident PayPal users are unavailable.</p>\n<p>\"Colombian Resident\" is defined to mean:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>an individual, regardless of actual nationality, who has indicated Colombia as his/her country or region at the point of signing up for a PayPal account.\nand</li>\n<li>an entity, partnership, organization or association which has indicated Colombia as its country or region of registration at the point of signing up for a PayPal account.</li>\n</ol>\nMalaysia <p>PayPal has been approved by Bank Negara Malaysia to operate an e-Money business.\nTherefore, if you are a Malaysian customer and PayPal does not provide a prompt and efficient response to you in relation to PayPal's services pursuant to your use of the dispute resolution process set out in the Disputes with PayPal section of this user agreement or contacting PayPal's Customer Support, you may also contact Bank Negara through BNMLINK and BNMTELELINK.</p>\n<p>BNMTELELINK can be contacted notice to you: (i) if you breach this user agreement, the PayPal Acceptable Use Policy, the Commercial Entity Agreements (as they apply to you), or any other agreement between you and PayPal, or (ii) if we determine, acting reasonably, that we should do so due to other circumstances or reasons.\nOur determination shall be final and binding except in the case of manifest error or bad faith.\nUpon termination of this user agreement, PayPal shall arrange the payment to you of any unrestricted funds held in your PayPal balance.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Chargeback fees.</strong> If you receive a debit or credit card-funded payment through your PayPal account and the buyer pursues a chargeback for the transaction with their card issuer, PayPal will not assess you with a chargeback fee if the transaction is eligible for PayPal Seller Protection.\nHowever, if the transaction is ineligible for PayPal Seller Protection, PayPal will assess you with a chargeback fee (for facilitating the chargeback process) regardless of whether the buyer is successful in pursuing the chargeback with the card issuer.</p>\n<p>The applicable chargeback fee will be deducted from your PayPal account.\nThe chargeback fee is the amount specified on the Chargeback Fees table in the currency of the original transaction.\nIf you do not have the correct currency available in your PayPal balance at the time of the refund or reversal, a currency conversion will be required and a currency conversion fee will apply.</p>\n<p>If a buyer files a chargeback, the card issuer, not PayPal, will determine who wins the chargeback.</p>Morocco <p>Upon enablement of the withdrawal functionality to a Moroccan bank account with the bank partner of PayPal, you will be required to comply with Moroccan laws and regulations.\nThis means notably that if you receive amounts into your PayPal balance from a PayPal user, you must withdraw the amounts in your PayPal balance to your Moroccan bank account* within 30 Days of receipt of funds.</p>\n<p>* The bank partner of PayPal for the withdrawal functionality charges a fee for each withdrawal.\nUpon enablement of the receive and withdraw functionalities, PayPal will provide you with additional information.</p>\nThe Philippines <p>If you are using a service (\"Third Party Service\") offered by a PayPal partner bank, licensed foreign-exchange service provider, or for any other reason.</p>\n<p>(ii) you must withdraw the amounts in your PayPal balance to your South African bank account* within 30 Days of receipt of funds.</p>\n<p>2.\nIf you would like to send amounts to another PayPal user:</p>\n<p>(i) you must do so either with the credit card associated with your account, or by doing a top up to your PayPal balance from your FNB bank account*.</p>\n<p>(ii) For purchases using top up, you must do a separate top up for each purchase.</p>\n<p>* FNB charges a fee for each top up and withdrawal.\nPlease see the FNB website for more information.</p>\nSingapore <p>The PayPal services are offered by PayPal Pte.\nLtd., located at 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01, Suntec Tower Five, Singapore 038985.\nIf you are a Singapore resident, you Other Pricing Categories</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Micropayments Pricing.</strong> PayPal offers two micropayments pricing programs: (i) Micropayments Fees.\nand (ii) Micropayments for Digital Goods Fees.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>(i) Micropayments Fees</strong>.\nIf you have signed up for Micropayments Fees, then the following Fees apply to all the Commercial Payments you receive.\nIf you have both a Micropayments Fees enabled account and a standard pricing account, it is your responsibility to correctly route your payments to the appropriate account, and once a transaction is processed through the account you selected, you may not request that the transaction be processed through a different account.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Activity</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Country/Region</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Micropayments Fee</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Receiving Commercial Serbia</p>\n<p>If you refund (partially or fully) a transaction to a buyer or a donation to a donor, there are no fees to make the refund, but the fees you originally paid will not be returned to you.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Bank/Credit Card Fees</strong>.\nYour bank, credit or debit card company may charge you fees for sending or receiving funds through PayPal.\nFor example, you may be charged currency conversion fees, international transactions fees, or other fees even when your transaction is domestic, and does not require a currency conversion.\nPayPal is not liable for any fees charged to you by your bank, credit or debit card company or other financial institution based on your usage of PayPal.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\u00a9 1999\u20132020 "url": "https://www.paypal.com/sg/webapps/mpp/ua/acceptableuse-full", "xpath": "/html/body/div[1]/div/section", "text": " PayPal Acceptable Use Policy &nbsp.\n<p>&gt;&gt.\nView all legal agreements</p> PayPal Acceptable Use Policy <p>Last Update: March 19, 2020</p> Print <p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You are independently responsible for complying with all applicable laws in all of your actions related to your use of PayPal's services, regardless of the purpose of the use.\nIn addition, you must adhere to the terms of this Acceptable Use Policy.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> Prohibited Activities <p>You may not use the PayPal service for activities that:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>violate any law, statute, ordinance or regulation.</li>\n<li>relate to transactions involving (a) narcotics, steroids, certain controlled substances or other products that present a risk to consumer safety, (b) drug paraphernalia, (c) cigarettes, (d) items that encourage, promote, facilitate or instruct others to engage in illegal activity, (e) stolen goods including digital and virtual goods, (f) the promotion of hate, violence, racial&nbsp;or other forms of intolerance that is discriminatory or the financial exploitation of a crime, (g) items that are considered obscene, (h) items that infringe or violate any copyright, trademark, right of publicity or privacy or any other proprietary right under the laws of any jurisdiction, (i) certain sexually oriented materials or services, (j) ammunition, firearms, or certain firearm parts or accessories, or (k) certain weapons or knives regulated under applicable law.</li>\n<li>relate to transactions that (a) show the personal information of third parties in violation of applicable law, (b) support pyramid or ponzi schemes, matrix programs, other \"get rich quick\" schemes or certain multi-level marketing programs, (c) are associated with purchases of annuities or lottery contracts, lay-away systems, off-shore banking or transactions to finance or refinance debts funded by a credit card, (d) are for the sale of certain items before the seller has control or possession of the item, (e) are by payment processors to collect payments on behalf of merchants, (f) are associated with the sale of traveler's checks or money orders, (g) involve currency exchanges or check cashing businesses, (h) involve certain credit repair, debt settlement services, credit transactions or insurance activities, or (i) involve offering or receiving payments for the purpose of bribery or corruption.</li>\n<li>involve the sales of products or services identified by government agencies to have a high likelihood of being fraudulent.</li>\n</ol> &nbsp.\nActivities Requiring Approval <p>PayPal requires pre-approval to accept payments for certain services as detailed in the chart below.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Service Requiring Pre-Approval</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Contact Information</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Airlines and scheduled or non-scheduled charters/jets/air taxi operators.\ncollecting donations as a charity or non-profit organization.\ndealing in jewels, precious metals and stones.\nacting as a money transmitter or selling stored value cards.\nselling stocks, bonds, securities, options, futures (forex) or an investment interest in any entity or property.\nor providing escrow services.</p>\n<p>Please send contact information, business website URL and a brief business summary to compliance@paypal.com</p>\n<p>Providing file sharing services or access to newsgroups.\nor selling alcoholic beverages, non-cigarette tobacco products, e-cigarettes or prescription drugs/devices.</p>\n<p>Please send contact information, business website URL and brief business summary to aup@paypal.com</p>\n<p>Activities involving gambling, gaming and/or any other activity with an entry fee and a prize, including, but not limited to casino games, sports betting, horse or greyhound racing, fantasy sports, lottery tickets, other ventures that facilitate gambling, games of skill (whether or not legally defined as gambling) and sweepstakes, if the operator and customers are located exclusively in jurisdictions where such activities are permitted by law.</p>\n<p>Please send contact information, business website URL and brief business summary to aup@paypal.com</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p> More Information <p>To learn more about the Acceptable <p>\n</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Notice of Amendment to PayPal Legal Agreements</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Issued: 14 October 2020</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Please read this document.</strong>\n</p>\n<p>We\u2019re making changes to the legal agreements that govern your relationship with PayPal.</p>\n<p>We encourage you to carefully review the notices below so that you are familiar with these upcoming changes.</p>\n<p>There is no further action needed from you as these changes will take place automatically on the Effective Date shown below.\nIn the event you would prefer to decline these changes and close your account, you can do so prior to the Effective Date.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Updates to the User Agreement for Asia Pacific, certain European and Latin American countries, Middle East and Africa</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Effective: October 31, 2020</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>(Residents of Mainland China, Malaysia, and Thailand will have an effective date of November 16, 2020.)</strong>\n</p>\n<p>We\u2019re making the following changes to our terms:</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Amendments to the PayPal Account User Agreement (Effective October 31, 2020) (Residents of Mainland China, Malaysia, and Thailand will have an effective date of November 16, 2020.)</strong>\n</p>\n<ul>\n<li>We are updating the policies with which you agree to comply when you open and use a PayPal account.</li>\n<li>We are clarifying the circumstances under which Commercial Entity Agreements apply to business and personal accounts.</li>\n<li>We are establishing a dispute fee and have added the applicable terms and conditions.\n(This will not apply to residents of Malaysia who hold a PayPal account and use the PayPal services.)</li>\n<li>We\u2019re updating PayPal\u2019s suspension and termination rights in relation to Malaysian customers.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>Amendments to the Fees (Effective October 31, 2020) (Residents of Mainland China, Malaysia, and Thailand will have an effective date of 16, November 2020.)</strong>\n</p>\n<ul>\n<li>We\u2019re removing the Merchant Rate for both domestic and international payments for merchants in Mainland China.\nMerchants domiciled in Mainland China will now pay our Standard Rate for transactions.</li>\n<li>We have changed the fee applicable to certain countries or regions for balance withdrawal to US bank account in the \u201cWithdrawing your Balance\u201d section.\nFrom the above Effective Date, balance withdrawal to US bank account by users in Kenya, New Zealand and Singapore will be subject to a 3.00% fee \u2013 and balance withdrawal to US bank account by users in Chile and the Dominican Republic will be subject to a 0.50% fee.</li>\n<li>We have changed the fees applicable to withdrawals you make to your card for users in Philippines.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n<strong>Amendments to the PayPal Advanced Credit and Debit Card Agreement (previously the PayPal Website Payments Pro Hosted Solution and Virtual Terminal) (Effective October 31, 2020) </strong>\n</p>\n<ul>\n<li>We have changed the name of the PayPal Website Payments Pro Hosted Solution and Virtual Terminal Agreement.\nThe new name of this agreement is the PayPal Advanced Credit and Debit Card Agreement.\nPayPal Website Payments Pro Hosted Solution will now be referred to as \u201cAdvanced Credit and Debit Card Payments.\u201d The new name of this agreement reflects this change.</li>\n<li>Please see the section \u201cAbout this Agreement\u201d at the start of the PayPal Advanced Credit and Debit Card Agreement for more information about the Products covered by the agreement.</li>\n<li>We are revising the notice provisions to better align with the PayPal User Agreement (including the amount of advance notice required for changes to the agreement).</li>\n<li>We are updating our data processing terms to reflect that PayPal is a data controller for payment processing and fraud services.</li>\n<li>Fraud Protection is now an optional additional service in the Advanced Credit and Debit Card suite of functionality.\nWe have set out the terms and conditions for our Fraud Protection product.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>To review the updated User Agreement, please click Here.</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Notice of Amendment to PayPal Legal Agreements</strong>\n</p>\n<p>Issued: 29 <p>&nbsp;</p>It is PayPal\u2019s policy to take appropriate action where necessary to remove from the PayPal services or to disallow the use of PayPal services in connection with material that is claimed to be infringing.\nIf you are an intellectual property rights owner and you believe a website or a webpage using PayPal services sells, offers for sale, makes available goods and/or services or otherwise includes content or materials that infringe your intellectual property rights, then please complete this Infringement Report in its entirety and fax it to 1-402-537-5774 or email it to infringementreport@paypal.com.\n", "created_at": "2019-05-12T22:29:39.711Z", "updated_at": "2019-05-12T22:31:54.902Z"}, {"id": "3089", "name": "Cookie Statement", "url": "https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/ua/cookie-full", "xpath": "", "text": "PayPalLog InSign Up<p>&gt;&gt.\nView all legal agreements</p>Statement on Cookies and Tracking Technologies<p>Last Update: 25 May 2018</p>\n<p>Print</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>When you visit or interact with our sites, services, applications, tools or messaging, we or our authorized service providers may use cookies, web beacons, and other similar technologies for storing information to help provide you with a better, faster, and safer experience and for advertising purposes.</p>\n<p>This page is designed to help you understand more about these technologies and our use of them on our sites and in our services, applications, and tools.\nBelow is a summary of a few key things you should know about our use of such technologies.\nYou can review the contents of our full User Cookie Notice below.</p>\n<p>Our cookies and similar technologies have different functions.\nThey are either necessary for the functioning of our services, help us improve our performance, give you extra functionalities, or help us to serve you relevant and targeted ads.\nWe use cookies and similar technologies that only remain on your device for as long as you keep your browser active (session) and cookies and similar technologies that remain on your device for a longer period (persistent).You are free to block, delete, or disable these cookies if your device permits so.\nYou can manage your cookies and your cookie preferences in your browser or device settings.</p>\n<p>Where possible, security measures are set in place to prevent unauthorized access to our cookies and similar technologies.\nA unique identifier ensures that only we and/or our authorized service providers have access to cookie data.</p>\n<p>Service providers are companies that help us with various aspects of our business, such as site operations, services, applications, advertisements and tools.\nWe use some authorized service providers to help us to serve you relevant ads on our services and other places on the internet.\nThese service providers may also place cookies on your device via our services (third party cookies).\nThey may also collect information that helps them identify your device, such as IP-address or other unique or device identifiers.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<strong>What are cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies?</strong>\n<p>Like most sites, we use technologies that are essentially small data files placed on your computer, tablet, mobile phone, or other devices (referred to collectively as a \u201cdevice\u201d) that allow us to record certain pieces of information whenever you visit or interact with our sites, services, applications, messaging, and tools.</p>\n<p>The specific names and types of the cookies, web beacons, and other similar technologies we use may change from time to time.\nIn order to help you better understand this Policy and our use of such technologies we have provided the following limited terminology and definitions:</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Cookies</strong>&nbsp;\u2013 Small text files (typically made up of letters and numbers) placed in the memory of your browser or device when you visit a website or view a message.\nCookies allow a website to recognize a particular device or browser.\nThere are several types of cookies:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Session cookies expire at the end of your browser session and allow us to link your actions during that particular browser session.</li>\n<li>Persistent cookies are stored on your device in between browser sessions, allowing us to remember your preferences or actions across multiple sites.</li>\n<li>First-party cookies are set by the site you are visiting.</li>\n<li>Third-party cookies are set by a third party site separate from the site you are visiting.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Cookies can be disabled or removed by tools that are available in most commercial browsers.\nThe preferences for each browser you use will need to be set separately and different browsers offer different functionality and options.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Web beacons</strong> \u2013 Small graphic images (also known as \u201cpixel tags\u201d or \u201cclear GIFs\u201d) that may be included on our sites, services, applications, messaging, and tools, that typically work in conjunction with cookies to identify our users and user behavior.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Similar technologies</strong>&nbsp;\u2013 Technologies that store information in your browser or device utilizing local shared objects or local storage, such as flash cookies, HTML 5 cookies, and other web application software methods.\nThese technologies can operate across all of your browsers, and in some instances may not be fully managed by your browser and may require management directly through your installed applications or device.\nWe do not use these technologies for storing information to target advertising to you on or off our sites.</p>\n<p>We may use the terms \u201ccookies\u201d or \u201csimilar technologies\u201d interchangeably in our policies to refer to all technologies that we may use to store data in your browser or device or that collect information or help us identify you in the manner described above.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>Why we use cookies</strong>\n<br> Our cookies and similar technologies have different functions.\nThey are either necessary for the functioning of our services, help us improve our performance, give you extra functionalities, or help us to serve you relevant and targeted ads.\nWe use both session and persistent cookies and similar technologies.</p>\n<p>\n<br> Generally, these technologies allow our sites, services, applications, and tools to store relevant information in your browser or device and later read that information in order to identify your device to our servers or internal systems.\nWhere applicable, we protect our cookies and other similar technologies to help ensure that only we and/or our authorized service providers can interpret them by assigning them a unique identifier that is designed for interpretation only by us.</p>\n<p>\n<br> Our uses of such technologies fall into the following general categories:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<strong>Essential</strong>.\nWe may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar technologies that are necessary to the operation of our sites, services, applications, and tools.\nThis includes technologies that allow you access to our sites, services, applications, and tools.\nthat are required to identify irregular site behavior, prevent fraudulent activity and improve security.\nor that allow you to make use of our functions such as shopping-carts, saved search, or similar functions;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Performance Related</strong>.\nWe may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar technologies to assess the performance of our websites, applications, services, and tools, including as part of our analytic practices to help us understand how our visitors use our websites, determine if you have interacted with our messaging, determine whether you have viewed an item or link, or to improve our website content, applications, services, or tools;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Functionality Related</strong>.\nWe may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar technologies that allow us to offer you enhanced functionality when accessing or using our sites, services, applications, or tools.\nThis may include identifying you when you sign into our sites or keeping track of your specified preferences, interests, or past items viewed so that we may enhance the presentation of content on our sites;</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Advertising or Targeting Related</strong>.&nbsp.\nWe may use first-party or third-party cookies and web beacons to deliver content, including ads relevant to your interests, on our sites or on third party sites.&nbsp.\nThis includes using technologies to understand the usefulness to you of the advertisements and content that have been delivered to you, such as whether you have clicked on an advertisement.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>\n<strong>\n<em>Any personal information that we collect and store through use of these technologies for categories 2 through 4 above are based on your consent, obtained through a conspicuous disclosure on our website during your first visit.&nbsp.\nYou can withdraw this consent through your browser settings as explained below.</em>\n</strong>\n</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>\n<strong>For browser-specific information on how to adjust cookie configurations on the following browsers, please click on the relevant link below:</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- Internet Explorer</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- Firefox</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- Chrome</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- Safari</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- OSX/Mac OS</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n<strong>- iOS</strong>\n</p>\n<p>&nbsp.\n</p>\n<strong>Use of these technologies by authorized third-party service providers</strong>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>We may work with third-party companies, commonly known as service providers, who are authorized to place third-party cookies, web beacons, or similar technologies for storing information on our sites or in our services, applications, and tools with our permission.\nThese service providers help us to provide you with a better, faster, and safer experience.</p>\n<p>These service providers may use these technologies to help us deliver our own content and advertising, and compile anonymous site metrics and analytics.\nWe do not permit any of these service providers to collect any of your personal information on our sites or in our services, applications, or tools for their own purposes.\nThese service providers are subject to confidentiality agreements with us and other legal restrictions on their use or collection of any personal information.\nThird party cookies are covered by the third-parties\u2019 privacy policy.</p>\n<p>With the exception of the use of such technologies by our service providers or other authorized third-parties, we do not permit any third-party content on sites (such as item listings, member-to-member communications, classified listings, comments, reviews, etc.) to include or utilize any cookies, web beacons, local storage, or similar technologies for tracking purposes or to collect your personal information.\nIf you believe a listing or other third-party content might be collecting personal information or using tracking technologies on one of our sites, please report it to&nbsp;spoof@paypal.com.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<strong>Ad networks and exchanges operated by authorized third parties for interest-based advertising</strong>\n<p>We may use third parties, such as advertising networks and exchanges, to allow us to serve you advertisements.\nThese third-party ad networks and exchange providers may use third-party cookies, web beacons, or similar technologies to collect information about your visit to our site and elsewhere on the Internet.\nThey may also collect your device identifier, IP address, or identifier for advertising (IDFA).\nThe information that these third parties collect may be used to provide you with more relevant advertising on our sites or elsewhere on the web.\nThird party cookies are covered by the third-parties\u2019 privacy policies.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>For more information on third-party advertising-related cookies, interest-based advertising, and how to opt-out of that practice by companies participating in industry self-regulation, please visit the relevant website below based on your country of origin:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Your Online Choices</li>\n<li>About Ads</li>\n<li>AboutCookies.org</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<strong>\u201cDo Not Track\u201d</strong>\n<p>California law requires us to let you know how we respond to web browser Do Not Track (DNT) signals.\nBecause there currently isn't an industry or legal standard for recognizing or honoring DNT signals, we don't respond to them at this time.\nWe await the result of work by the privacy community and industry to determine when such a response is appropriate and what form it should take.</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Help</li>\n<li>Contact</li>\n<li>Fees</li>\n<li>Security</li>\n<li>Apps</li>\n<li>Shop</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>About</li>\n<li>Newsroom</li>\n<li>Jobs</li>\n<li>Investor Relations</li>\n<li>Social Innovation</li>\n<li>Public Policy</li>\n<li>Sitemap</li>\n<li>Enterprise</li>\n<li>Partners</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>\u00a9 1999\u20132020 </li>\n<li>Accessibility</li>\n<li>Privacy</li>\n<li>Legal</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>We\u2019ll use cookies to improve and customize your experience if you continue to browse.\nIs it OK if we also use cookies to show you personalized ads? Learn more and manage your cookies</p>Yes, Accept Cookies&lt;img Account</li>\n<li>Link or Unlink a Payment Method</li>\n<li>Receiving, Holding, or Transferring Funds</li>\n<li>Multiple Currencies</li>\n<li>Account Statements</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Sending Money &amp.\nBuying <ul>\n<li>Sending Money to Friends or Family</li>\n<li>Fees for Sending Money to Friends and Family </li>\n<li>Buying or Returning from Sellers</li>\n<li>Payment Method Fees</li>\n<li>Refunds, Reversals &amp.\nChargebacks</li>\n<li>Seller Protection</li>\n<li>PayPal Advertising Program</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Restricted Activities &amp.\nHolds <ul>\n<li>Restricted Activities</li>\n<li>Actions We May Take</li>\n<li>Holds, Limitations, and Reserves</li>\n<li>Court Orders &amp.\nOther Legal Processes</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Unauthorized Transactions &amp.\nOther <ul>\n<li>Communications Between You &amp.\nUs</li>\n<li>PayPal\u2019s Rights</li>\n<li>Indemnification &amp.\nLimitation Of Liability</li>\n<li>Disclaimer of Warranty &amp.\nRelease</li>\n<li>Agreement to Arbitrate</li>\n<li>Intellectual Property</li>\n<li>Miscellaneous</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Download Printable PDF</li>\n</ul> Menu PayPal User Agreement PayPal User Agreement About Your Account <p>This user agreement will be effective for all users as of November 9, 2020.</p>\n<p>\n</p>\n<p>Welcome to PayPal!</p>\n<p>This user agreement is a contract between you and PayPal, Inc.\ngoverning your use of your PayPal account and the PayPal services.\nIt applies to U.S.\nPayPal accounts only.\nIf you are an individual, you must be a resident of the United States or one of its territories and at least 18 years old, or the age of majority in your state of residence to open a U.S.\nPayPal account and use the PayPal services.\nIf you are a business, the business must be organized in, operating in, or a resident of, the United States or one of its territories to open a U.S.\nPayPal account and use the PayPal services.</p>\n<p>By opening and using a PayPal account, you agree to comply with all of the terms and conditions in this user agreement.\nThe terms include an agreement to resolve disputes by arbitration on an individual basis.\nYou also agree to comply with each of the other agreements on the Legal Agreements page that apply to you and the following additional policies:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Acceptable Use Policy</li>\n<li>Electronic Communications Delivery Policy (E-Sign Disclosure and Consent)</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Please read carefully all of the terms and conditions of this user agreement, terms of these policies and each of the other agreements that apply to you.</p>\n<p>We may revise this agreement and any of the policies listed above from time to time.\nThe revised version will be effective at the time we post it, unless otherwise noted.\nIf our changes reduce your rights or increase your responsibilities we will post a notice on the Policy Updates page of our website and provide you at least 21 days advance notice for personal accounts and at least 5 days advance notice for business accounts.\nBy continuing to use our services after any changes to this user agreement, you agree to abide and be bound by those changes.\nIf you do not agree with any changes to this user agreement, you may close your account.</p> Opening a PayPal Account <p>We offer two types of PayPal accounts: personal PayPal accounts and business PayPal accounts, both covered by this user agreement.</p>\n<p>All PayPal accounts let you do things like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Send and receive money.</li>\n<li>Buy things online, using mobile devices or in stores.</li>\n<li>Make payments using your credit card, debit card, bank account, or other payment options, including funds held as balance in a business PayPal account (if we have verified the required identifying information you provide to us) or funds held in a PayPal Cash or a PayPal Cash Plus account linked to a personal PayPal account if you choose to open a PayPal Cash or a PayPal Cash Plus account.\nThe term \u201cCash Account\u201d in this user agreement will be used to refer to either a PayPal Cash or a PayPal Cash Plus account.\nMore information about Cash Accounts can be found in the PayPal Cash and PayPal Cash Plus Account Terms and Conditions.</li>\n<li>Accept credit card, debit card, bank account, Cash Account and other payment methods from others.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You are responsible for maintaining adequate security and control of any and all IDs, passwords, personal identification numbers, or any other codes that you use to access your PayPal account and the PayPal services.\nYou must keep your mailing address, email address and other contact information current in your PayPal account profile.</p>\n<p>\n</p> Personal PayPal accounts <p>If you primarily need to make purchases and send money to family and friends, a personal PayPal account is probably right for you.\nWith a personal PayPal account you can do things like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Send and request money from friends and family.</li>\n<li>Buy goods and services.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>You can also use a personal PayPal account to receive money for the sale of goods and services and hold that money in a linked Cash Account or transfer it to a linked bank account or debit card if you do not open a Cash Account, but if you plan to use your personal PayPal account primarily to sell things, you should open a business PayPal account.\nYou can also convert your personal PayPal account to a business PayPal account should circumstances change.</p>\n<p>\n</p> Business PayPal accounts <p>We recommend business PayPal accounts for people and organizations that primarily use PayPal to sell goods or services or accept donations, even if your business is not incorporated.\nWith a business PayPal account, you can do things like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Use a company or business name as the name on your business PayPal account.</li>\n<li>Allow employees access to some of the features of your business PayPal account.</li>\n<li>Sign up for PayPal products that meet your business needs.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Business PayPal accounts may be subject to fees that differ from the fees applicable to personal accounts.</p>\n<p>\n<strong>By opening up a business PayPal account or converting a personal PayPal account to a business PayPal account, you certify to us that you are using it primarily for a business or commercial purpose.\nYou also consent to PayPal obtaining your personal and/or business credit report from a credit reporting agency at account opening and whenever we reasonably believe there may be an increased level of risk associated with your business PayPal account.</strong>\n</p>\n<p>\n</p> Commercial Entity Status <p>If the activity through any type of PayPal account you hold reaches certain thresholds or involves certain business segments or activities, you are required by the card networks to agree to a Commercial Entity Agreement to allow you to continue accepting Visa and MasterCard payments.\nIn this case, these Commercial Entity Agreements will apply to any payment processed by PayPal on your behalf and will form part of this user agreement.</p>\n<p>\n</p> Closing Your PayPal Account <p>You may close your PayPal account and terminate your relationship with us at any time without cost, but you will remain liable for all obligations related to your PayPal account even after the PayPal account is closed.\nWhen you close your PayPal account, we will cancel any scheduled or incomplete transactions.\nIf you have a Cash Account linked to a personal PayPal account, you must withdraw or transfer any funds held in your Cash Account before closing your personal PayPal account, and closing a personal PayPal account will result in PayPal automatically closing any linked Cash Account.\nIf you have a business PayPal account, you must withdraw or transfer any balance from your business PayPal account before closing it, and if you have not provided the required identifying information to us, or if we are unable to verify the required identifying information you provide, you must transfer any balance in your business PayPal account to a linked bank account or debit card.\nYou cannot withdraw or transfer digital gift certificates/cards that are purchased through PayPal Digital Gifts and linked to your personal or business PayPal account as payment methods.\nHowever, even without your PayPal account, you can still use the codes you received by email when you purchased the gift certificates/cards to make purchases.</p>\n<p>In certain cases, you may not close your PayPal account, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>To evade an investigation.</li>\n<li>If you have a pending transaction or an open dispute or claim.</li>\n<li>If your PayPal account has a negative balance.</li>\n<li>If your PayPal account is subject to a hold, limitation or reserve.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n</p> Link or Unlink a Payment Method
