{"name": "Symbaloo", "documents": [{"id": "7312", "name": "Privacy Policy", "url": "https://blog.symbaloo.com/disclaimer/disclaimer_us.html", "xpath": "//body", "text": " Symbaloo\u2019s Privacy Policy <p>Symbaloo cares deeply about privacy, and we recognize that it is important to the educators, students, and parents we serve.\nSymbaloo is committed to following both its legal obligations and the best practices with regard to the gathering, usage, sharing, and storage of information in support of your institution.</p>\n<p>The following privacy policy applies to personal data collected at www.symbaloo.com or other Symbaloo websites, and data collected through the provision of Symbaloo\u2019s products or services.\nBecause Symbaloo gathers certain types of information from its users, it is important to us that you fully understand the terms and conditions regarding the information that we gather, store, and use.</p>\n<p>Symbaloo collects personal data to operate, provide, and maintain Symbaloo\u2019s products and services.\nCollection of personal data allows Symbaloo to, for example, communicate with, support, and engage with its end-users, to provide customer support and service, to manage, improve, and develop existing and new products and services, and to inform end-users of new or improved products, services, or features.\nSuch informing may include informing end-users via promotional e-mail.\nEnd-users may opt out of being informed via promotional e-mail in the future by following the unsubscribed procedure indicated in the e-mail.</p> Privacy and your Institution <p>Symbaloo offers many products and services that are provided to end users in connection with educational, corporate, or government institutions, which may have its own privacy guidelines.\nIf you are and end user using a Symbaloo product or service in connecting with your institution, Symbaloo recommends that you consult with your institution first in order to address any questions or concerns you may have.\nIn many cases, Symbaloo\u2019s products or services are provided to the end user in a manner that is customized or customizable by your institution in order to permit your institution to best meet its needs and to best implement and comply with its own privacy guidelines.</p>\n<p>If you are using Symbaloo\u2019s services through your institution, please note that this policy does not supersede the terms of any agreement Symbaloo\u2019s may have with your institution, nor does it affect the terms of any agreement between your institution and yourself or with any other third party.\nPlease make sure that you read the terms of any privacy policy or any other agreement that you enter into with any party, including with your institution, as that policy or agreement may explain how your personal information will be collected, stored, and used.\nIf you have any questions about any agreement between yourself and your institution, or between your institution and a party other than Symbaloo, those questions should be directed to your institution.</p> Information Symbaloo Collects <p>You are free to use many of Symbaloo\u2019s products or services without providing personal information.\nHowever, in order to use certain Symbaloo products or services, or would like to customize certain aspects of Symbaloo\u2019s products or services, you may be required to register with Symbaloo.\nWhen you register with Symbaloo, you will be asked to provide certain personal information, including but not limited to your name, your e-mail address, your country, and your language.\nThis information will better enable us to provide Symbaloo\u2019s products and services to you and other users, and will help us improve Symbaloo\u2019s products and services.</p>\n<p>Symbaloo\u2019s products and services may also provide the option for end users to voluntarily provide other personal information, generally for the purpose of enabling or enhancing a collective end-user experience.\nFor example, registered users may voluntarily add certain personal information to their user profile, including but not limited to a personal biography, a city or state, a date of birth, a gender, and a profession or category of profession.\nSymbaloo offers users the ability to change this information at any time and as often as necessary by choosing the \u201cedit personal information\u201d option or other similar functionality associated with a registered user\u2019s profile.\nIn addition, registered users of certain Symbaloo products or services used in connection with schools or other educational institutions may be asked to, but will not be required to provide other types of information, among which may include, without limitation, a name of an institution, a city, a state, province, or other administrative subdivision, an educational system, a type of institution, a grade level or other level of education, a subject of teaching or education, a name of a teacher, professor, or other educator, classes, courses, quizzes, or lessons previously or presently taught or enrolled in, such as Symbaloo Learning Paths, questions or answers in any such classes, courses, or lessons, and grades or scores given or received in any such classes, courses, quizzes, or lessons.\n</p>\n<p>Symbaloo also gathers data about the activities of its end-users in relation to the end-user\u2019s use of Symbaloo\u2019s products and services, both individually and collectively.\nThis data includes, but is not limited to, the features of Symbaloo products or services that its end users are presently or have in the past accessed, the identity of non-Symbaloo products or services that are or have been identified, accessed or made accessible through Symbaloo\u2019s products or services, and website visitor statistics, such as IP addresses, sessions sources, and other data which tracks end-user access to Symbaloo\u2019s products or services.\nSuch data may be sent by your browser or mobile device, and may also include the identity of your browser, mobile device, or operating system.\nWe may analyze this data for the trends and preferences they reveal about our end-users and how our end-users use Symbaloo products or services, such as traffic, usage trends, and demographics.\nSuch analysis may be performed with third-party analytics tools.\nWe do not supply any of this data to third parties, except to the extent necessary to perform analysis of such data with third-party analytics tools.</p>\n<p>When you access Symbaloo\u2019s products or services using a mobile device, including through a Symbaloo mobile application, Symbaloo may also have transmitted to it certain unique identification numbers or other identifiers associated with your device or Symbaloo\u2019s mobile application.\nThis may include, for example, a Unique Device Identifier (\u201cUDID\u201d), a Google Ad ID, a Windows Advertising ID, A Unique ID for Advertisers (\u201cIDFA\u201d), a mobile carrier, a device type, model, and manufacturer, a mobile device operating system and version, a phone number, and depending on your mobile device settings, geographic location data such as GPS coordinates.\nYour mobile operating system may let you opt-out from having certain device identifiers used.\nYou should refer to the instructions provided by your mobile device\u2019s manufacturer.\nthis information is typically available under the \u201csettings\u201d function of your mobile device.</p> Social Spaces <p>Certain Symbaloo products and services may make social spaces available to end-users wherein end-users may publish or communicate information to, or otherwise interact with, other end-users.\nThese may include chat rooms, message boards, forums, newsgroups, or other social spaces.\nPlease keep in consideration that any information that you may disclose in any such social spaces will be viewable according to the nature of that social space, and as such may be viewable by other registered end-users, subsets of registered end-users, or non-registered end-users.\nCaution should be exercised when personal information is disclosed by end-users within these spaces.</p>\n<p>Certain Symbaloo products or services which make social spaces available to end-users may also include the ability for certain end-users and/or those end user\u2019s institutions to determine the appropriate privacy settings for those social spaces.\nAll end-users of any social spaces are solely responsible for monitoring the privacy settings of the social spaces they decide to use and updating their privacy settings in order to protect their end-user data in accordance with their personal preferences.\n</p> Symbaloo\u2019s Use of Collected Information <p>Other than as specifically stated herein, the personal information that you supply to Symbaloo will not be given, rented, sold, loaned, or otherwise disclosed to any third party outside of Symbaloo or its agents unless (1) we have your express permission to do so, or (2) Symbaloo has a good faith belief that special circumstances make it reasonably necessary for Symbaloo to disclose such information.\nSuch special circumstances include (i) to enforce the Symbaloo Terms of Use, (ii) to comply with a subpoena, summons, or other writ or court order in a legal proceeding, (iii) to respond to claims that the rights of third parties are violated by content appearing on Symbaloo\u2019s products or services, and (iv) to protect the rights, property, or personal safety of Symbaloo, any of its employees or users, or the public.</p>\n<p>Symbaloo may use aggregated personal information in order to determine the demographics of our end-users and to distribute statistics or other information about Symbaloo and/or its products and services.\nThis aggregate information does not identify specific end-users.\n</p>\n<p>The internet servers that may host Symbaloo\u2019s products and/or services may also record certain non-personal information regarding the users that access those products and/or services as part of their standard operation.\nSuch aggregated non-personal information may be used from time to time by Symbaloo for lawful purposes, such as to describe Symbaloo and/or its products and services to third parties.</p>\n<p>Certain of Symbaloo\u2019s products, services, or features thereof may be offered in connection with a third party partner.\nIn order to provide these products, services, or features thereof, it may be necessary for either you or Symbaloo to share your personal information with this third party.\nIf you do not want your information to be shared with that third party, you can choose not to permit such sharing by not using those particular products, services, or features thereof.</p>\n<p>Symbaloo may also partner with third parties to provide certain limited services, such as customer support, event coordination and management, mailing, and web analytics.\nThese third parties are only permitted access only to information that reasonably necessary for them to provide such limited services, are prohibited from using such information for any purpose other than those limited services, and are required to maintain the confidentiality of any such information which may be personal information.</p>\n<p>Please also be aware that third party websites may be accessed or accessible through Symbaloo products and services, and that those third party websites may have their own information collection practices and policies that are not covered by this Privacy Policy.\nSymbaloo is not responsible for information collection practices and policies of any such third party websites.</p> Security <p>Symbaloo maintains reasonable administrative, technical and physical procedures to protect any information that may be stored in our servers, which are located in the United States and in other jurisdictions in which Symbaloo, its subsidiaries and affiliates maintain facilities.\nSecurity safeguards may include, without limitation, data encryption, firewalls, data use and access limitations, and physical access controls.\nIf you have any questions about security, feel free to contact Symbaloo at the address listed below.</p> Cookies and Similar Technologies <p>A cookie is a small file placed onto your device that enables certain features and functionality.\nLike most providers of online services, Symbaloo uses cookies and similar technologies to ensure its end-users the best possible experience, such as to allow us to recognize you and/or your device on, off, and across Symbaloo\u2019s products and/or services, and to keep any user account you may have safe.\nThe cookies and similar technologies used by Symbaloo will generally fall into one of the following categories:</p> Category Why we use these Cookies Preferences We may use these cookies to remember your settings and preferences.\nFor example, we may use these cookies to remember your preferred language.\nSecurity We may use these cookies to help identify and prevent security risks.\nFor example, we may use these cookies to store your session information to prevent others from changing your password Performance We may use these cookies to collect information about how you interact with our services and to help us improve them.\nFor example, we may use these cookies to determine if you have interacted with a certain page.\nAnalytics We may use these cookies to help us improve our services.\nFor example, we can use these cookies to learn more about which features are the most popular with our users.\nAdvertising We may use these cookies to deliver advertisements, to make them more relevant and meaningful to our end-users, and to track the efficiency of our advertising campaigns <p>Your browser may provide you with the option to refuse some or all cookies.\nYou may also be able to remove cookies from your browser.\nFor more information about how to manage browser cookies, please follow the instructions provided by your browser.</p> Student Educational Records <p>Certain of Symbaloo\u2019s products or services may be offered to its end-users in connection with an agreement between Symbaloo and an educational institution.\nAs such, certain information collected by Symbaloo in connection with those products or services may be \u201ceducational records\u201d as defined by the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (\u201cFERPA\u201d), 20 U.S.C.\n\u00a71232(g), and other applicable state laws.\nSymbaloo will not use any such educational records other than as authorized by that educational institution.\nSymbaloo will also consider such educational records to be confidential, and will not share it with any third party unless authorized by the terms or conditions of an applicable written agreement you or your institution have entered into with Symbaloo.\nIf you have any question about reviewing, modifying, or deleting any such educational records, please contact your institution directly.</p> Children\u2019s Personal Information <p>Symbaloo does not knowingly collect any \u201cpersonal information\u201d of an individual under the age of 13 as defined by the Children\u2019s Online Privacy Protection Act (\u201cCOPPA\u201d), 15 U.S.C.\n\u00a76501, and other applicable state laws.\nIf Symbaloo receives such personal information, it will assume that (1) the provider of such personal information has provided such information following having obtained the consent of a parent and/or guardian of that individual to provide such personal information, and (2) that the provider of such personal information has taken reasonable precautions to prevent individuals under the age of 13 from falsifying such consent.\nSymbaloo will not use any such personal information other than as authorized by an agreement entered into between the provider of that personal information, or that provider\u2019s institution, and Symbaloo.\nSymbaloo will also consider such personal to be confidential, and will not share it with any third party unless authorized by the terms or conditions of an agreement entered into between the provider of that personal information, or that provider\u2019s institution, and Symbaloo.</p>\n<p>If you believe that Symbaloo has inadvertently collected personal information from an individual under the age of 13 without proper consent, or if you are a parent or guardian of an individual under the age of 13 and wish to review or delete any personal information Symbaloo may have collected about or from that individual, please contact Symbaloo at the address below.</p> Common ID Cookie <p> This site uses cookies and similar tracking technologies such as the Common ID cookie to provide its services.\nCookies are important devices for measuring advertising effectiveness and ensuring a robust online advertising industry.\nThe Common ID cookie stores a unique user id in the first party domain and is accessible to our ad partners.\nThis simple ID that can be utilized to improve user matching, especially for delivering ads to iOS and MacOS browsers.\nUsers can opt out of the Common ID tracking cookie by clicking here.\n</p> Advertising Privacy Settings <p> FOR EU USERS ONLY: When you use our site, pre-selected companies may access and use certain information on your device and about your interests to serve ads or personalized content.\nYou may revisit or change consent-choices at any time by clicking here.\n</p> Changes to the Symbaloo Privacy Policy <p>If Symbaloo changes this Privacy Policy, it will post those changes at https://blog.symbaloo.com/disclaimer/disclaimer_us.html, so that you always know what information Symbaloo gathers, how Symbaloo uses that information, and under what conditions, if any, and to who Symbaloo will disclose such information.\nBy using www.symbaloo.com and any other Symbaloo products or services, you agree and assent to the the Symbaloo Privacy Policy.\nIf you do not agree to the Symbaloo Privacy Policy, or any changes made thereto, then please do not use www.symbaloo.com or any other Symbaloo products or services.\nYour continued usage of www.symbaloo.com or any other Symbaloo products or services following the posting of changes to the Symbaloo Privacy Policy will mean that you accept and agree to those changes.</p> Contact Symbaloo <p>Symbaloo takes all concerns about privacy and data usage very seriously.\nIf you have any questions or concerns about the Symbaloo Privacy Policy, please contact us at one of the addresses listed below, and we will do our best to provide a prompt response to your question or concern.</p>\n<p>If you believe that Symbaloo has inadvertently collected personal information from an individual under the age of 13 without proper consent, or if you are a parent or guardian of an individual under the age of 13 and wish to review or delete any personal information Symbaloo may have collected about or from that individual, please contact Symbaloo at one of the addresses listed {"id": "7311", "name": "Terms of Use", "url": "https://blog.symbaloo.com/terms/terms_us.html", "xpath": "//body", "text": " Symbaloo Terms of Use <p>These terms of use (\u201cTerms\u201d) govern your access to and use of Symbaloo\u2019s software, products, and/or services (the \u201cProducts\u201d) and any information, content, text, graphics, photos and/or other materials uploaded, downloaded, purchased, and/or appearing on or through the Products (\u201cContent\u201d).\nThese Terms apply to all visitors, users, and others who access and use the Products (the \u201cUsers\u201d).</p>\n<p>By accessing or using the Products you agree to be bound by these Terms.\nWe may revise these Terms from time-to-time, the most current version will always be at the referenced link.\nIf the revision, in our sole discretion, is material, we will notify you through the Products or through Email.\nBy continuing to access or use the Products after those revisions become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised Terms.</p>\n<p>Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in these Terms supersedes or limits your rights under (1) the terms and conditions of any written agreement you have entered into with Symbaloo regarding the use of Products, or (2) any applicable laws or regulations, to the extent these Terms are prohibited by such laws or regulations.\nIn the event of any conflict between these Terms and the terms and conditions of any applicable written agreement you have entered into with Symbaloo, the terms and conditions of the written agreement shall control.</p> 1.\nGeneral Terms <p>You are responsible for your use of the Products.\nYour access to and use of the Products, and the extent of any such access and use, may be controlled at Symbaloo\u2019s sole discretion.\n</p>\n<p>Symbaloo\u2019s Products are always evolving, and the form, nature, and/or functionality of the Products may change from time to time, without prior notice to you.\nSymbaloo retains the right to temporarily or permanently stop providing a Product and/or a feature within a Product to you or to Users generally, without prior notice.\nSymbaloo also retains the right to create and/or modify limitations on usage or storage at its sole discretion at any time without prior notice.\n</p>\n<p>If you are accepting these Terms and using the Products on behalf of an institution, company, organization, government, or other legal entity (individually or collectively, an \u201cInstitution\u201d), then (a) \u201cyou\u201d includes you and that institution, and (b) you represent and warrant that you are an authorized representative of the institution with the authority to bind the institution to these Terms, and that you agree to these Terms on the institution\u2019s behalf.\nYou may use the Products only in compliance with these Terms, any agreement entered into by your institution relating to the Products, and all applicable local, state, national, and international laws, rules and regulations.</p>\n<p>In cases where you have authorized or registered another individual, including a minor, to use Symbaloo\u2019s Products, you are fully responsible for (i) the online conduct of such user.\n(ii) controlling the user\u2019s access to and use of the Products.\nand (iii) the consequences of any misuse.\nSymbaloo reserves the right to provide access to any data collected pertaining to any minor to that minor\u2019s parent(s), guardian or other authorized adult, upon such adult\u2019s request.\n</p> 2.\nPrivacy and Personal Information <p>Any information that you have made available or may make available to Symbaloo, or may be collected by Symbaloo in connection with your use of the Products (\u201cYour Information\u201d) will be collected, maintained and used in order to provide the Products to you or your institution.\nYour Information may include, but is not limited to, your name, email address, and any other information, including personal information.\nYou understand that, through your use of the Products, you consent to the collection and use (as set forth in these Terms, Symbaloo\u2019s Privacy Policy, and any other agreement entered into between your institution relating to the Product) of Your Information, including the transfer of Your Information to and/or from the United States and/or other countries for storage, hosting, processing, and/or other use by Symbaloo.\nBy using the Products, you consent that Symbaloo may use any or all of Your Information in connection or combination with other Symbaloo Products, including to provide, maintain, protect and improve the Products provided to you and/or your institution.\n</p>\n<p>To the extent that any of Your Information you make available to Symbaloo may include information directly related to an identifiable current or former student that is maintained by a school, school district, or school-related entity (\u201cStudent Information\u201d), Symbaloo does not own, control, or license such Student Information.\nRather, you own all right, title, and interest to all such Student Information.\nSuch Student Information may include \u201ceducational records\u201d as defined by the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (\u201cFERPA\u201d), 20 U.S.C.\n\u00a71232(g).\nSymbaloo agrees to treat such Student Information as confidential and will not share it with third parties unless authorized by the terms and conditions of an applicable written agreement you or your institution have entered into with Symbaloo.</p>\n<p>To the extent that any of Your Information you make available to Symbaloo may include the \u201cpersonal information\u201d of an individual under the age of 13 as defined by the Children\u2019s Online Privacy Protection Act (\u201cCOPPA\u201d), 15 U.S.C.\n\u00a76501, Symbaloo does not own, control, or license such personal information.\nBy making any such personal information available to Symbaloo, you acknowledge that you have obtained the consent of a parent and/or guardian of that individual to provide such personal information, and that you have taken reasonable precautions to prevent individuals under the age of 13 from falsifying such consent.\nSymbaloo agrees to treat such personal information as confidential and will use it for no commercial purpose other than in connection with any applicable agreement you or your institution has entered into with Symbaloo.\nUpon request of the parent or legal guardian of an individual under the age of 13, Symbaloo will allow the review or deletion of that individual\u2019s personal information.\n</p>\n<p>If you have any questions regarding the privacy of Your Information and/or if you are a parent or legal guardian who wishes to review or delete any personal information of your child, you may contact Symbaloo at violations@symbaloo.com, or your institution.</p> 3.\nUser Accounts <p>Certain of Symbaloo\u2019s Products may permit and/or require the creation and use of a user account associated with Your Information.\nYou may never use another user\u2019s account without permission.\nIn consideration of your use of Symbaloo\u2019s Products, you agree that Your Information associated with your user account will be kept true, accurate, current, and complete.\nYou are responsible for safeguarding any password and/or other security features that you use to access Symbaloo\u2019s Products, and for ensuring that you exit from your user account following use of Symbaloo Products.\nYou agree to notify Symbaloo of any unauthorized use of your user account or any other breach of security.</p> 4.\nIntellectual Property Rights A.\nSymbaloo Intellectual Property <p>All right, title, and interest in and to Symbaloo\u2019s Products (exclusive of Content provided by Users or other third parties) are and will remain the exclusive property of Symbaloo.\nThe Products are protected by copyright, trademark, and other laws of the United States and foreign countries.\nNothing within these terms gives to you any right to use the Symbaloo name or any trademark, logo, domain name, or other distinctive feature of the Symbaloo brand.\nAny feedback, comments, or suggestions that you may provide or make regarding Symbaloo and/or any of its Products is made entirely voluntary and without expectation of any obligation to you, and Symbaloo shall be free to use such feedback, comments, or suggestion as it sees fit.</p> B.\nUser Content <p>You are responsible for the Content that you submit, post, or display in connection with your use of the Products, and any and all consequences thereof.\nYou retain any rights you may have in such Content.\nBy submitting, posting, or displaying Content on or through the Products, you acknowledge that such content may be viewed by other Users of the Products.</p>\n<p>By submitting, posting, or displaying Content on or through the Products, you grant to Symbaloo a worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free license (with the right to sublicense) to use, host, store, copy, reproduce, process, adapt, modify, publish, transmit, create derivative works, communicate, display, and/or distribute such Content in any and all media or distribution methods as part of providing, promoting, or improving Symbaloo\u2019s Products.\nYou agree that this license includes the right for Symbaloo to make such Content available to other institutions or individuals as part of providing the Products, and you represent and warrant that you have all rights, power, and authority necessary to grant the rights granted herein to any content that you submit.</p>\n<p>All Content, whether publicly or privately transmitted, is the sole responsibility of the person who originated that content.\nSymbaloo may or may not monitor or control the Content submitted by Users, and takes no responsibility for such Content.\nAny use or reliance by you on any Content appearing on Symbaloo\u2019s Products or obtained through Symbaloo\u2019s Products is at your own risk.</p>\n<p>Symbaloo respects the intellectual property rights of others.\nWe will respond to notices of alleged copyright infringement that comply with applicable law and are properly provided to us.\nIf you believe that your Content has been copied in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, please provide us with the following information: (i) a physical or electronic signature of the copyright owner or a person authorized to act on their behalf.\n(ii) identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed.\n(iii) identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit us to locate the material.\n(iv) your contact information, including your address, telephone number, and an email address.\n(v) a statement by you that you have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.\nand (vi) a statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and, under penalty of perjury, that you are authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.</p>\n<p>We reserve the right to remove Apple Privacy Policy was updated on December 31, 2019.\n<p>Your privacy is important to Apple so we\u2019ve developed a Privacy Policy that covers how we collect, use, disclose, transfer, and store your personal information.</p>\n<p>In addition to this Privacy Policy, we provide data and privacy information imbedded in our products connected with our Data &amp.\nPrivacy Icon for certain features that ask to use your personal information.</p>\n<p>\n<br>\n</p>\n<p>You can review this information before enabling these features, in Settings related to those features and/or online at apple.com/legal/privacy.\nPlease take a moment to familiarize yourself with our privacy practices and contact us if you have any questions.<br>\n&nbsp;<br>\nYour California Privacy Disclosures&nbsp;<br>\nInformation Regarding Commercial Electronic Messages in Canada<br>\nApple Health Research Apps Privacy Policy<br>\n</p>\n<dl>\n<dt>\n</dt>\n<dd> Collection and Use of Personal&nbsp;Information\n<p>Personal information is data that can be used to identify or contact a single person.</p>\n<p>You may be asked to provide your personal information anytime you are in contact with Apple or an Apple affiliated company.\nApple and its affiliates may share this personal information with each other and use it consistent with this Privacy Policy.\nThey may also combine it with other information to provide and improve our products, services, content, and advertising.\nYou are not required to provide the personal information that we have requested, but, if you chose not to do so, in many cases we will not be able to provide you with our products or services or respond to any queries you may have.</p>\n<p>Here are some examples of the types of personal information Apple may collect and how we may use it:</p>\nWhat personal information we collect\n<ul>\n<li>When you create an Apple ID, apply for commercial credit, purchase a product, download a software update, register for a class at an Apple Retail Store, connect to our services, contact us including by social media or participate in an online survey, we may collect a variety of information, including your name, mailing address, phone number, email address, contact preferences, device identifiers, IP address, location information, credit card information and profile information where the contact is via social media.</li>\n<li>When you share your content with family and friends using Apple products, send gift certificates and products, or invite others to participate in Apple services or forums, Apple may collect the information you provide about those people such as name, mailing address, email address, and phone number.\nApple will use such information to fulfill your requests, provide the relevant product or service, or for anti-fraud purposes.</li>\n<li>In certain jurisdictions, we may ask for a government issued ID in limited circumstances including when setting up a wireless account and activating your device, for the purpose of extending commercial credit, managing reservations, or as required by law.</li>\n</ul>\nHow we use your personal&nbsp;information\n<p>We may process your personal information: for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy, with your consent, for compliance with a legal obligation to which Apple is subject, for the performance of a contract to which you are party, in order to protect your vital interests, or when we have assessed it is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Apple or a third party to whom it may be necessary to disclose information.\nIf you have questions about this legal basis you can contact the Data Protection Officer.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The personal information we collect allows us to keep you posted on Apple\u2019s latest product announcements, software updates, and upcoming events.\nIf you don\u2019t want to be on our mailing list, you can opt-out anytime by updating your preferences.</li>\n<li>We also use personal information to help us create, develop, operate, deliver, and improve our products, services, content and advertising, and for loss prevention and anti-fraud purposes.\nWe may also use your personal information for account and network security purposes, including in order to protect our services for the benefit of all our users, and pre-screening or scanning uploaded content for potentially illegal content, including child sexual exploitation material.\nWhere we use your information for anti-fraud purposes it arises from the conduct of an online transaction with us.\nWe limit our uses of data for anti-fraud purposes to those which are strictly necessary and within our assessed legitimate interests to protect our customers and our services.\nFor certain online transactions we may also validate the information provided by you with publicly accessible sources.</li>\n<li>We may use your personal information, including date of birth, to verify identity, assist with identification of users, and to determine appropriate services.\nFor example, we may use date of birth to determine the age of Apple ID account holders.</li>\n<li>From time to time, we may use your personal information to send important notices, such as communications about purchases and changes to our terms, conditions, and policies.\nBecause this information is important to your interaction with Apple, you may not opt out of receiving these communications.</li>\n<li>We may also use personal information for internal purposes such as auditing, data analysis, and research to improve Apple\u2019s products, services, and customer communications.</li>\n<li>If you enter into a sweepstake, contest, or similar promotion we may use the information you provide to administer those programs.</li>\n<li>If you apply for a position at Apple or we receive your information in connection with a potential role at Apple, we may use your information to evaluate your candidacy and to contact you.\nIf you are a candidate, you will receive more information about how Apple handles candidate personal information at the time of application.</li>\n</ul>\nSource of your personal information where they are not collected from you\n<p>We may have received your personal information from other persons if that person has shared their content with you using Apple products, sent gift certificates and products, or invited you to participate in Apple services or forums.\nWe may also validate the information provided by you when creating an Apple ID with a third party for security and fraud prevention purposes.</p>\n<p>If you are a potential candidate for employment with Apple, we may have received your personal information from third parties such as recruiters or external websites.\nWe will use the personal information we receive to contact you about a potential opportunity or in evaluating your candidacy.\nIf you did not provide us your personal information directly, we will inform you of the source when we first contact you regarding your candidacy.\nFor research and development purposes, we may use datasets such as those that contain images, voices or other data that could be associated with an identifiable person.\nWhen acquiring such datasets, we do so in accordance with applicable law in the jurisdiction in which the dataset is hosted.\nWhen using such datasets for research and development, we do not attempt to re-identify individuals who may appear therein.</p>\nCollection and Use of Non-Personal Information\n<p>We also collect data in a form that does not, on its own, permit direct association with any specific individual.\nWe may collect, use, transfer, and disclose non-personal information for any purpose.\nThe following are some examples of non-personal information that we collect and how we may use it:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>We may collect information such as occupation, language, zip code, area code, unique device identifier, referrer URL, location, and the time zone where an Apple product is used so that we can better understand customer behavior and improve our products, services, and advertising.</li>\n<li>We may collect information regarding customer activities on our website, iCloud services, our iTunes Store, App Store, Mac App Store, App Store for Apple TV and iBooks Stores and from our other products and services.\nThis information is aggregated and used to help us provide more useful information to our customers and to understand which parts of our website, products, and services are of most interest.\nAggregated data is considered non\u2011personal information for the purposes of this Privacy Policy.</li>\n<li>We may collect and store details of how you use our services, including search queries.\nThis information may be used to improve the relevancy of results provided by our services.\nExcept in limited instances to ensure quality of our services over the Internet, such information will not be associated with your IP address.</li>\n<li>With your explicit consent, we may collect data about how you use your device and applications in order to help app developers improve their apps.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If we do combine non-personal information with personal information the combined information will be treated as personal information for as long as it remains combined.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\nCookies and Other Technologies\n<p>Apple\u2019s websites, online services, interactive applications, email messages, and advertisements may use \"cookies\" and other technologies such as pixel tags and web beacons.\nThese technologies help us better understand user behavior, tell us which parts of our websites people have visited, and facilitate and measure the effectiveness of advertisements and web searches.\nWe treat information collected by cookies and other technologies as non\u2011personal information.\nHowever, to the extent that Internet Protocol (IP) addresses or similar identifiers are considered personal information by local law, we also treat these identifiers as personal information.\nSimilarly, to the extent that non-personal information is combined with personal information, we treat the combined information as personal information for the purposes of this Privacy Policy.</p>\n<p>Ads that are delivered by Apple\u2019s advertising platform may appear in Apple News and in the App Store.\nIf you do not wish to receive ads targeted to your interests from Apple's advertising platform, you can choose to enable Limit Ad Tracking, which will opt your Apple ID out of receiving such ads regardless of what device you are using.\nIf you enable Limit Ad Tracking on your mobile device, third-party apps cannot use the Advertising Identifier, a non-personal device identifier, to serve you targeted ads.\nYou may still see ads in the App Store or News based on context like your search query or the channel you are reading.\nIn third-party apps, you may see ads based on other information.</p>\n<p>Apple also uses cookies and other technologies to remember personal information when you use our website, online services, and applications.\nOur goal in these cases is to make your experience with Apple more convenient and personal.\nFor example, knowing your first name lets us welcome you the next time you visit the Apple Online Store.\nKnowing your country and language \u2212 and if you are an educator, your school \u2212 helps us provide a customized and more useful shopping experience.\nKnowing someone using your computer or device has shopped for a certain product or used a particular service helps us make our advertising and email communications more relevant to your interests.\nAnd knowing your contact information, hardware identifiers, and information about your computer or device helps us personalize your operating system, set up your iCloud service, and provide you with better customer service.</p>\n<p>If you want to disable cookies and you\u2019re using the Safari web browser, go to Safari preferences and then to the privacy pane to manage your preferences.\nOn your Apple mobile device, go to Settings, then Safari, scroll down to the Privacy &amp.\nSecurity section, and tap on \u201cBlock Cookies\u201d to manage your preferences.\nFor other browsers, check with your provider to find out how to disable cookies.\nPlease note that certain features of the Apple website will not be available once cookies are disabled.</p>\n<p>As is true of most internet services, we gather some information automatically and store it in log files.\nThis information includes Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, browser type and language, Internet service provider (ISP), referring and exit websites and applications, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data.\nWe use this information to understand and analyze trends, to administer the site, to learn about user behavior on the site, to improve our product and services, and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole.\nApple may use this information in our marketing and advertising services.</p>\n<p>In some of our email messages, we use a \u201cclick-through URL\u201d linked to content on the Apple website.\nWhen customers click one of these URLs, they pass through a separate web server before arriving at the destination page on our website.\nWe track this click-through data to help us determine interest in particular topics and measure the effectiveness of our customer communications.\nIf you prefer not to be tracked in this way, you should not click text or graphic links in the email messages.\nPixel tags enable us to send email messages in a format customers can read, and they tell us whether mail has been opened.\nWe may use this information to reduce or eliminate messages sent to customers.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\nDisclosure to Third Parties\n<p>At times Apple may provide third parties with certain personal information to provide or improve our products and services, including to deliver products at your request, or to help Apple market to consumers.\nWhen we do, we require those third parties to handle it in accordance with relevant laws.\nApple does not sell personal information, and personal information will never be shared with third parties for their marketing purposes.\nFor example, when you purchase and activate your iPhone, you authorize Apple and your carrier to exchange the information you provide during the activation process to carry out service, including information about your device.\nIf you are approved for service, your account will be governed by Apple and your carrier\u2019s respective privacy policies.</p>\nService Providers\n<p>Apple shares personal information with companies who provide services such as information processing, extending credit, fulfilling customer orders, delivering products to you, managing and enhancing customer data, providing customer service, assessing your interest in our products and services, and conducting customer research or satisfaction surveys.\nThese companies are obligated to protect your information and may be located wherever Apple operates.</p>\nOthers\n<p>It may be necessary \u2212 by law, legal process, litigation, and/or requests from public and governmental authorities within or outside your country of residence \u2212 for Apple to disclose your personal information.\nWe may also disclose information about you if we determine that for purposes of national security, law enforcement, or other issues of public importance, disclosure is necessary or appropriate.\nWe may also disclose information about you, but only where there is a lawful basis for doing so, if we determine that disclosure is reasonably necessary to enforce our terms and conditions or protect our operations or users.&nbsp.\nThis could include providing information to public or governmental authorities.\nAdditionally, in the event of a reorganization, merger, or sale we may transfer any and all personal information we collect to the relevant third party.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\nProtection of Personal&nbsp;Information\n<p>Apple takes the security of your personal information very seriously.\nApple online services such as the Apple Online Store and iTunes Store protect your personal information during transit using encryption such as Transport Layer Security (TLS).\nWhen your personal data is stored by Apple, we use computer systems with limited access housed in facilities using physical security measures.\nWith the exception of iCloud Mail, iCloud data is stored in encrypted form including when we utilize third-party storage.</p>\n<p>When you use some Apple products, services, or applications or post on an Apple forum, chat room, or social networking service, the personal information and content you share is visible to other users and can be read, collected, or used by them.\nYou are responsible for the personal information you choose to share or submit in these instances.\nFor example, if you list your name and email address in a forum posting, that information is public.\nPlease take care when using these features.</p>\n<p>If you or anyone else using Family Sharing logs on to a device that is owned by a third party, any information shared within your Family\u2014including calendar, location, photos, and iTunes purchases\u2014may be downloaded on to that third-party device thereby disclosing any such shared information.\nVisit Family Sharing for more information.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\nThe Existence of Automated Decision-Making, Including Profiling\n<p>Apple does not take any decisions involving the use of algorithms or profiling that significantly affect you.</p>\nIntegrity and Retention of Personal Information\n<p>Apple makes it easy for you to keep your personal information accurate, complete, and up to date.\nWe will retain your personal information for the period necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy and our service specific privacy summaries.\nWhen assessing these periods we carefully examine our need to collect personal information at all and if we establish a relevant need we only retain it for the shortest possible period to realize the purpose of collection unless a longer retention period is required by law.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\nYour Privacy Rights\n<p>You can help ensure that your contact information and preferences are accurate, complete, and up to date by signing in to your Apple ID account page.\nFor other personal information we hold, we will provide you with access (including a copy) for any purpose including to request that we correct the data if it is inaccurate or delete the data if Apple is not required to retain it by law or for legitimate business purposes.</p>\n<p>We may decline to process requests that are frivolous/vexatious, jeopardize the privacy of others, are extremely impractical, or for which access is not otherwise required by local law.\nWe may also decline aspects of deletion or access requests if we believe doing so would undermine our legitimate use of data for anti-fraud and security purposes as described earlier.\nOnline tools for the exercise of access, deactivation/restriction, correction, or deletion requests are available on a regional basis by signing in to privacy.apple.com.\nFor users with Shazam accounts sign in to www.shazam.com/privacy.\nWhen you make a request using these online tools, we will verify your identity and the legitimacy of your request.</p>\nCalifornia\n<p>The California Consumer Privacy Act provides California consumers with the right to obtain from Apple information about the personal information about you that we collect, use, and disclose.\nYou can exercise your rights through an authorized agent by providing relevant details to allow sign in to privacy.apple.com.\nIf you cannot access Apple\u2019s online tools, you or your agent can make a request to apple.com/legal/privacy/contact or by calling 1-800-275-2273.</p>\n<p>If you choose to exercise your privacy rights, you have the right to not to receive discriminatory treatment or a lesser degree of service from Apple.</p>\nNevada\n<p>You have the right to opt-out of the sale of your personal information.\nApple does not sell your personal information.</p>\n<p>See our page on understanding and controlling your personal information for more information on exercising your rights.\nWhere the online tool is not currently available for access requests in your region, a request may be made directly to apple.com/legal/privacy/contact.</p>\nChildren &amp.\nEducation\n<p>We understand the importance of taking extra precautions to protect the privacy and safety of children using Apple products and services.\nChildren under the age of 13, or equivalent minimum age in the relevant jurisdiction, are not permitted to create their own Apple IDs, unless their parent provided verifiable consent or as part of the child account creation process in Family Sharing or they have obtained a Managed Apple ID account (where available) through their school.\nFor example, a parent must review the Apple ID and Family Sharing Disclosure and agree to the Consent to Apple\u2019s Collection, Use and Disclosure of Your Child\u2019s Information.\nand the iTunes Store Terms and Conditions, before they can begin the Apple ID account creation process for their child.\nIn addition, schools that participate in Apple School Manager and have reviewed and consented to the Managed Apple IDs for Students Disclosure may create Managed Apple IDs for students.\nThe Managed Apple IDs for Students Disclosure describes how Apple handles student information and supplements Apple\u2019s Privacy Policy.\nLearn more about Family Sharing, the Managed Apple IDs and Restrictions for children\u2019s accounts.\nIf we learn that we have collected the personal information of a child under 13, or equivalent minimum age depending on jurisdiction, outside the above circumstances we will take steps to delete the information as soon as possible.\nIf at any time a parent needs to access, correct, or delete data associated with their Family Sharing account or child\u2019s Apple ID, they may contact us through one of the options provided at the bottom of this page.</p>\nLocation-Based Services\n<p>To provide location-based services on Apple products, Apple and our partners and licensees, such as maps data providers, may collect, use, and share precise location data, including the real-time geographic location of your Apple computer or device.\nWhere available, location-based services may use GPS, Bluetooth, and your IP Address, along with crowd-sourced Wi-Fi hotspot and cell tower locations, and other technologies to determine your devices\u2019 approximate location.\nUnless you provide consent, this location data is collected anonymously in a form that does not personally identify you and is used by Apple and our partners and licensees to provide and improve location-based products and services.\nFor example, your device may share its geographic location with application providers when you opt in to their location services.</p>\n<p>Some location-based services offered by Apple, such as the \u201cFind My\u201d feature, require your personal information for the feature to work.</p>\nThird\u2011Party Sites and Services\n<p>Apple websites, products, applications, and services may contain links to third-party websites, products, and services.\nOur products and services may also use or offer products or services from third parties \u2212 for example, a third\u2011party iPhone app.</p>\n<p>Information collected by third parties, which may include such things as location data or contact details, is governed by their privacy practices.\nWe encourage you to learn about the privacy practices of those third parties.</p>\n<p>If you purchase a subscription in a third party app or within News, we create a Subscriber ID that is unique to you and the developer or publisher which we use to provide reports to the developer or publisher that include information about the subscription you purchased, and your country of residence.\nIf you cancel all of your subscriptions with a particular developer or publisher, the Subscriber ID will reset after 180 days if you do not resubscribe.\nThis information is provided to developers so that they can understand the performance of their subscriptions.</p>\nInternational Transfers\n<p>All the information you provide may be transferred or accessed by entities around the world as described in this Privacy Policy.\nPersonal information, relating to Apple services, regarding individuals who reside in a member state of the European Economic Area, the United Kingdom and Switzerland is controlled by Apple Distribution International Limited in Ireland, and processed on its behalf by Apple Inc.\nApple uses approved Model Contractual Clauses for the international transfer of personal information collected in the European Economic Area and Switzerland.\nApple, as a global company, has a number of legal entities in different jurisdictions which are responsible for the personal information which they collect and which is processed on their behalf by Apple Inc.\nFor example, point of sale information in our Retail entities outside the U.S.\nis controlled by our individual Retail entities in each country.\nApple, Online Store and iTunes related personal information may also be controlled by legal entities outside the U.S.\nas reflected in the terms of each service.\nImagery and associated data collected by Apple around the world to improve Apple Maps, and in support of our Look Around feature is transferred to Apple Inc in California.</p>\n<p>Apple abides by the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Cross Border Privacy Rules System.\nThe APEC CBPR system provides a framework for organizations to ensure protection of personal information transferred among participating APEC economies.\nIf you have an unresolved privacy or data use concern regarding our APEC CBPR and/or PRP certifications please visit our third-party dispute resolution provider.</p>\nOur Companywide Commitment to Your&nbsp;Privacy\n<p>To make sure your personal information is secure, we communicate our privacy and security guidelines to Apple employees and strictly enforce privacy safeguards within the company.</p>\nPrivacy Questions\n<p>If you have any questions or concerns about Apple\u2019s Privacy Policy or data processing, you would like to contact our Data Protection Officer, or if you would like to make a complaint about a possible breach of local privacy laws, please contact us.\nYou can always contact us by phone at the relevant Apple Support number for your country or region.</p>\n<p>When a privacy question or question about personal information received in response to an access/download request is received we have a dedicated team which triages your contact to address your issue.\nWhere your issue may be more substantive in nature, we may request more information from you.\nAll such substantive contacts receive a response within seven (7), days wherever possible - providing a response on the issue raised, requesting additional information where necessary or indicating that a response will require additional time.\nYou may at any time refer your complaint to the relevant regulator in your jurisdiction if you are unsatisfied with a reply received from us.\nIf you ask us, we will endeavor to provide you with information about relevant complaint avenues which may be applicable to your circumstances.</p>\n<p>Where your complaint indicates an improvement could be made in our handling of privacy issues we will take steps to make such an update at the next reasonable opportunity.\nIn the event that a privacy issue has resulted in a negative impact on you or another person we will take steps to address that with you or that other person.</p>\n<p>Apple may update its Privacy Policy from time to time.\nWhen we change the policy in a material way, a notice will be posted on our website along with the updated Privacy Policy.\nWe will also contact you via your contact information on file, for example by email, notification or some other equivalent method.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Apple Inc.\nOne Apple Park Way, Cupertino, California, USA, 95014</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n</dd>\n</dl> ", "created_at": "2018-07-17T10:11:57.480Z", "updated_at": "2020-12-14T15:24:28.075Z"}, {"id": "223", "name": "Website Terms of Service", "url": the changes.\nAs long as you comply with these Terms of Use, Apple grants you a personal, non-exclusive, non-transferable, limited privilege to enter and use the Site.</p>\nContent\n<p>All text, on or through the Site or any service offered on or through the Site.\nYou may not pretend that you are, or that you represent, someone else, or impersonate any other individual or entity.</p>\n<p>You may not use the Site or any Content for any purpose that is unlawful or prohibited by these Terms of Use, or to solicit the performance of any illegal activity or other activity which infringes the applicable to a specific portion of the Site or for any service offered on or through the Site, the latter terms shall control with respect to your use of that portion of the Site or the specific service.</p>\n<p>Apple\u2019s obligations, if any, with regard to its products and services are governed solely by the agreements pursuant to which they are provided, and nothing on this Site should without notice.\nThe materials on the Site with respect to products and services may be out of date, and Apple makes no commitment to update the materials on the Site with respect to such products and services.</p>\n<p>The following terms also govern and apply to your use of the Site, and they are incorporated herein by this reference:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Guidelines for Using Apple Trademarks posting such changes on the Site.</p>\nAccounts, Passwords and Security\n<p>Certain features or services offered on or through the Site may require you to open an account (including setting up an Apple ID and password).\nYou are entirely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the information you hold for your account, including your password, and for any and all activity that occurs under your account as a result of your failing to keep this information secure and confidential.\nYou agree to notify Apple immediately of any unauthorized use of your account or password, or any other breach of security.\nYou may be held liable for losses incurred by Apple or any other user of or visitor to the Site due to someone else using your Apple ID, password or account as a result of your failing to keep your account information secure and confidential.</p>\n<p>You may not use anyone else\u2019s Apple ID, password or account at any time without the express permission and consent of the holder of that Apple ID, password or account.\nApple cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to comply with these obligations.</p>\nPrivacy\n<p>Apple\u2019s Privacy Policy applies to use of this Site, and its terms are made a part of these Terms of Use by this reference.\nTo view Apple\u2019s Privacy Policy, click here.\nAdditionally, by using the Site, you acknowledge and agree that Internet transmissions are never completely private or secure.\nYou understand that any message or information you send to the Site may be read or intercepted by others, even if there is a special notice that a particular transmission (for example, credit card information) is encrypted.</p>\nLinks to Other Sites and to
